BS7SycmMtjx90ynHSL-zhg.text: Breaks my heart to give them a low review but this place has one big problem:   They've clearly bitten off more than they can chew.   While it is nice to have an extensive menu, it doesn't help when the waiter essentially tells you before you fall in love with anything on the menu, ask me if we have it.  I have been here several times at different times of day (even right when they open) and this message is always the same.    The things I have successfully ordered have come out cold, bland, or poorly executed (I.e. things that should be crispy come out soggy, cold condiments put on something that should be hot, etc.).    While the woman running the kitchen has great ideas, I wonder if she has ever run a kitchen before.   They are missing key elements that a professional could help them clean up.   I have high hopes for this place and will return to see if they're able to get past these basic issues.

ytLe3BH66g1cZtC9wVNIsw.text: Best VEGAN comfort food around town! Fun upbeat  atmosphere. Awesome vegan adult beverages too!!!  They just need to supply toilet seat covers for the unisex bathrooms--- Please  and Thank you !!!

czrPqYiqSfbQFj6NpsigbQ.text: Cool spot. Huge menu. I got the lobster roll as I was very intrigued and it looked quite mayo forward..which I can get behind. I was a bit bummed that it was just hearts of palm and maybe a little jackfruit and felt it needed a bit more texture. But judging by how delicious other people's plates looked I think I just got a dish that wasnt for me...not something that was made badly. Looking forward to coming back to try more. Breakfasts look legit.

Kfm9B8yPLAewBKX4kaEfzg.text: Looking for a vegan spin on everyday food. This place is for you. Chicken and waffles is more than one person can eat.

vkmNoxHZ3A8EXQuTf9ZSGA.text: Here we go! We ventured in this past Saturday to give TMV a try. Some people might say the location is slightly questionable, don't let that stop you. The addition of a legit restaurant on this corner will hopefully add more positivity to the atmosphere. I myself am pleased they did not choose an ultra hipster or multi million dollar venue to debut there efforts. Good choice guys!  The decor is crisp, clean,hard lines that I would describe as ultra modern. Everything from table and chair seating, picnic table, couches, to bar seating. Well lit with clean white being the overall color way. Appealing art and decor through out which also continues right into the two unisex restrooms.   Upon arrival we were greeted and seated promptly. Servers were friendly and attentive,a little scattered at times, but hey they'll have their rhythm and flow down soon I'm sure!!  The menu is much larger than I had anticipated. I'd have to say probably the most expansive vegan restaurant menu in town and yes they offer signature cocktails and beers as well. Although tonight our server informed us of several items on the menu that would not be available, due to the chefs working out the kinks and getting in their groove I suppose.   Tonight we tried the breakfast burrito which is served supreme style with all the fixing you would expect in an all out supreme burrito. It is served with breakfast potatoes on the side. Good combo and very delicious. We also tried a burger called "the BFF". It is a Beyond Beef Patty decked out with Mac and cheese in the middle. Mmmmm, mmmmm, tasty as can be and accompanied with fries. I nearly forgot, we also had the trifecta avocado toast(see pictures)so delicious. I had a PBR my wife had a strawberry smoothie.   We really enjoyed our dining experience and look forward to returning to try the rest of the menu.

IP9heAt15lQC_qyEGnC7og.text: Great selection and great service.   Food came out a little staggered for our party, but we'll be back none the less!  Near the grove for canna folk

GGj193SEyYLYEvwPp1ccdA.text: This was amazing!!! My non vegan hubby fell in love with the chick'n and waffles.  My favorite was the fried peanut butter and jelly sandwich!   I sooooo wish we had a Modern Vegan in Eugene!

QWQrNOKTQ4jyFd0JQ1TBbw.text: I have literally no idea why there are any 1 star reviews of this place.  Service was lovely and food came insanely fast.  I got the chicken and waffles- huge, delicious, sweet, savory perfection.  Very good food, extensive menu.  Maybe there were kinks to be worked out when they first opened, but everything seems to be running well now!

fUKGfxxhCktcTuR_q4mwFg.text: literally the best chicken and waffles you will ever have!  my boyfriend was scared and thought it was real chicken LOL.  so good! we ordered delivery to our hotel room twice!

PxCCMPIPnb1KoRY-ds1U-g.text: Love this place! Awesome staff, good prices and the food is always amazing. Never been let down. Wait times for food can be longer, but haven't been disappointed yet.

N1onUU04dyQpOI9eMwLIvQ.text: The outside of this place kinda threw me off but when I stepped in I completely forgot where I was. This place was definitely modern. I ordered the vegan chicken and waffles. Believe the hype. Get the vegan chicken and waffles. TO DIE FOR. Plus the mashed potatoes with vegan bacon under it was such a delicious surprise that went perfectly with it. My sister in law ordered fish tacos, which she enjoyed but then wished she had also ordered the chicken and waffles when she had a taste of mine. She also ordered an espressi, an espresso rum drink that was too delicious to just have one! We can't wait to go back. The staff was very sweet and helpful.

photos.caption: Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and waffles + fish tacos.

JWzUH6ANjaqQ_WzwaN1LoQ.text: Awesome vegan restaurant!! The food was fantastic and service was great. I recommend chicken and waffles for sure...I also ordered the jerk salad was amazing...we also ordered side Mac and cheese and popcorn chicken. I'm definitely returning to try other things on the menu...  Pro tip: portions are HUGE! I recommend family style to try everything.  Side note for owners: it feels like I walked into a dentists office...I don't mind the cleanliness of course, but it's very white. I would recommend a bit more greenery or an accent wall.   Overall, great experience

5Fz_YL0lkipqYd_jrq13fg.text: I've been here a couple of times now and I am overall happy with the menu and service, but it feels like they are still working out some kinks of being a new restaurant. The hostess seems bored and the wait staff are a bit green (no pun intended) and therefore super attentive. Silverware and napkins aren't bundled, so I got my fork first, then my spoon with my coffee then a knife when my meal arrived. It's a first world problem, but if the wait staff and hostess were doing side work then they might hover less and look a lot less bored. There are also table top staples that are conspicuously absent, like salt and pepper or sugar packets. Again, I think it's because they're new, and it didn't inhibit my enjoying my meal terribly.  The preparation of menu items seems a little inconsistent. My first visit I noticed my waffles were missing some toppings, and on my second visit my husband's breakfast burrito was missing guacamole and rice and beans, but got a lot of lettuce and onion. Being that he's not even a vegetarian, I don't think I'll be able to get him to go back with me, he was pretty underwhelmed.  I however will be back, the breakfast items are pretty yummy and I want to try their smoothies and desserts. Also, the coffee is really good and they have an abundance of dairy free creamer options, which is something I can't find at a regular greasy spoon diner.

PZSQyiUjMv8ybGo-j1csAA.text: The owner contacted me today and took care of everything with kindness and grace. I appreciate the honesty on her part and everything else about this restaurant was amazing, so five stars from me!

Jnwril-iPU_gz_N8HK1x8Q.text: Ambiance: modern on a low budget with music at 7/10 in an echoey environment.  The good: Buffalo chicken is top notch. Fries appear fresh cut and are a nice square size in between steak fries and shoestring. No goofy seasoning. Best vegan cheese dishes I've ever had in the queso and Mac and cheese.  The bad: the Lobster roll - lobster being replaced with hearts of Palm is pretty clever. The hot, buttered, soft but crisp roll being replaced with a pale, cold, doughy thing is not. Probably the result of a too-many-items on the menu issue.  The meh: carrot cake has zero carrot flavor but overwhelming almond flavor. Great frosting and consistency and wonderful if you love almond. Weird if you expected carrot.  The price: understanding that quality fresh ingredients cost more, the food prices here still feel a buck or two on the high side. Likely will drop as more vegan competition opens up.  Why go here? Maybe you're a newly converted vegan who would give your left turnip for a spicy buffalo chicken sandwich, or maybe you're super lactose intolerant and could KILL for some queso dip. Or maybe you've been vegan4lyfe and want to convert some of your omnivore friends over to the green side. All good reasons to be a patron.

3Jr-0FNMoZ99onxeiYxfog.text: The waitress we had (Rachel, I believe) was not helpful. Really didn't have customer service at all. The system "glitched" and my friends food wasn't cooked by the time everyone else at the table (5 others) were done eating. She said she didn't want it anymore. By that time, it was ready for her. But we were all ready to go. Instead of offering it to her for free for waiting - the kitchen staff was seen eating the food out in the open! No one came to apologize. My husband spoke with the manager because he hunted down an employee after waiting for a check for 15 minutes. The waitress just wasn't attentive to our table whatsoever. But on the way out she had a very terrible attitude and was saying goodbye in the most condescending tone of voice.   The owner offered 10% off of our next visit. There won't be a next time. I had high hopes - but after the lack of professionalism.. I won't spend another $50 there.   Food ideas were great. Fry appetizer was literally fries, lettuce and cheese sauce. Jerk burger was flavorless. Mac n cheese was too sweet and overpriced. I would go back if the service wasn't crap but they don't seem too concerned about that just yet.

tXYlTPzZ1Ok17gXVRG9wpg.text: Update:  I accidentally deleted the TMV response laughing at my food poisoning and telling me it could not have possibly happened there and to look at everything else I ate that day. I will let you know it is the only place we ate all day and we were the last table of the day.  I certainly hope you are reviewing handling and prep practices.  A posted picture of your Queso from earlier showed it topped with red and green peppers.  Ours came out with a big glob of shredded lettuce on it which is where I think the problem came from as this is the only thing we shared besides the cheesecake. Probably a substitution after you ran out of ingredients.    I would like to sincerely thank you for your concern and suggest that some customer service training may be in order as well when it comes to handling dissatisfied customers.    Let me start by saying we have really been looking forward to this place opening and really wanted it to be great.  Any new opening is going to have challenges.  I'll explain the 1 star rating upfront.   My wife and I ate there Saturday afternoon, two words, food poisoning.  She got sick first out of nowhere  about 6 hours after we ate and I quickly followed suit.   Been getting sick all night.  The one dish we shared was the Queso dip.  We got there at 1:30 PM, and did not get seated until after 3 PM.  Tables were full, several had "Reserved" signs on them with no people.  It was very noticeable that there was no food coming out of the kitchen.  As tables started emptying out, they would not seat anyone because the kitchen was so backed up. They also were turning people away at the door with the restaurant half empty.  We were able to order after 3 PM and placed our entire order at once so we would not have to wait any longer than necessary.  They were out of most of our first choices, I finally just asked the server what they did have instead of continuing to be told they were out.  We ordered the Queso appetizer,  the Ruben, the meatball sub and the Cheese Cake Sampler.    The Queso had a very strong Nutritional Yeast taste.  ur desert came out 10 minutes before we saw our sandwiches.  Definitely have timing issues that may get worked out over time.  My wife really liked the Ruben.  The meatballs on the Meatball Sub were well seasoned.  The sandwich was supposed to have melted "Mozzarella".  It came with what looked like Daiya shredded Mozzarella that was ice cold.   The cheese cake was fine.  Kind of a play on Peanut Butter and Jelly.     The Hostess spent most of her time apologizing.  Does not appear they were ready.  We were alreay talking about giving TMV another shot during he week, unfortunately, die to the food poisoning, we will not be going back.

5qt87TO4-IOOo9jI3SpCJw.text: I ordered the chicken n waffles and a side of Mac n cheese. The chicken n waffles were pretty good it came with a bacon type and I didn't care for that, but everything else was amaze balls! The Mac n cheese was a tab bit disappointing because they referred to it as "baked Mac n cheese" and indeed did not taste like a baked Mac n cheese... but vegan Mac n cheese is hard! The place is cool! The menu is huge and will def be going back to try other stuff!!

NbVTZ451lNWqufUg9epf-Q.text: This place makes me mad because you have TOO MUCH FOOD TO CHOOSE FROM! Omg I want to try everything! Lol.   I loved my experience and the food was better than expected! Thank you for bringing food to non vegans eyes that vegan food is just as great!   My bank account is not big enough to try everything, just yet! Lol  5 stars!

ajc3T7jNzMNJqFER8T2HfQ.text: I hate to give this place such a low review, but they really gave me no choice with all the issues they had today. It's been exactly one week since they've opened so I will definitely come back in a month or so when they're more in the swing of things  The restaurant wasn't full of people when I came in so I was looking forward to decent wait times.  I started off with the flamingo smoothie and it took about 10-15 min to get it. For a $7 smoothie I feel like I should've gotten a bigger portion and it wasn't very sweet.   I ordered the chicken and waffles and the wait time was about 30 min, which is fair. The presentation was great; however, the waffles were borderline cold and they were not crispy on the outside at all. It was more like chicken and pancakes than chicken and waffles. It was also served on top of mashed potatoes which made them a little soggy. I had to ask for a side of salt because the potatoes were so bland. Additionally, there was no syrup on top of my waffles, just butter. All of the syrup was on the bottom of the plate and got into half of the mashed potatoes, which made them sweet instead of savory (you can see in the picture).  I had to ask for two sides of syrup so I could actually get some on my waffles and came to find out they charged extra for it. The fried chicken was amazing! It was crispy, juicy and so far the best vegan chicken I've ever had. I got a refill of my smoothie and the second one was way better than the first one.   I also had the TMV cheese fries, which were okay. The fries by themselves were pretty good but the queso had no flavor to it at all. It seemed like it was there for nothing more than to look like cheese because it didn't taste like anything. I ended up dipping the fries in ketchup because I couldn't get on board with the bland cheese.   I ended up having a lot of left over food and when I asked my waitress for a to-go box she told me that they didn't have any. I was pretty done at that point, how does a restaurant not have to-go boxes? Needless to say I had to waste the generous amount of leftover food I had and was very disappointed with my experience. I will visit again eventually to give them a chance to redeem themselves. I hope their service gets better.

5__bOXRW-JEPTCBHE80ZrQ.text: Great atmosphere.   Food Is tasty aswell.....a little to much soy for me personally,  but there are still plenty options....big menu.

paH4ZEz4R-eLh-qeIKBRWg.text: I am so ecstatic to have a comfort food , vegan type of place in town ; warm welcome. We sat down to look at the menu first , and decided to eat there based on all of the selections . I saw that other people reviewed the restaurant being out of several items, we did not run into this problem. We ordered the loaded fries, a chocolate shake , Buffalo chicken burger , and the burger that had macaroni and cheese on it ; fucking delightful . The only think I will mention is that the chocolate shake description stated it would have coconut whipped cream on top , which it did not . I didn't care though lol, I am easy to please and it was bomb as hell either way. The French fries were loaded with cheese sauce, which I love and the burgers were extremely flavorful and each had a distinct taste. I am very excited to try everything on the menu. Last thing , the portions are huge , and I had plenty of food to take home :) so excited for more vegan food !

Jvj_2asNZLNH3qSEuE1Tng.text: Great spot! The chicken and waffles were amazing!!! You literally think you're eating chicken. The portion is pretty big too. Can't wait to try out different items on the menu.

KA7j3rhrY9F4-TZMmu0Ezg.text: I had an excellent time here! Inside the vibe was classy and modern. The waitress was super friendly and knowledgeable about the menu. She gave us recommendations based on her preferences and popularity of the dishes.  They were unfortunately out of about 10% of their menu items, but the waitress told us what was unavailable upfront, and the menu was huge we still had plenty of options. We ordered the Reuben and steak and eggs. Both were delicious and came out fast. I love having a vegan place so close to where I work. I'll be back soon for sure!

-7_AbYJb52PMSMP0_1mAWw.text: My girlfriend and I came in last Saturday and were blown away with the fantastic decor, menu, cocktail selection, prices and how amazing the food was. We will return, often.

d5pFB9dIHxSE0If_7wyBjw.text: I'm going to give it 5 star because I know it's going to become better! We drove 30 minutes from Summerlin to check it out. Cool decor and vibe. The  food was insanely good and our waitress was super sweet. This is the second day opened but there are a lot of kinks to work out. I  would start with more training on the menu. There was a lot of I don't know.  The three of us ordered and two meals came out. They ran out of the 3rd option which was a common theme on a lot of items. Again our waitress was super sweet. We were going to come back on Sunday but we're going to let them work out the kinks. I'm giving a 5 star because this place will only get better with practice. Good luck!

ngSLtX56r7oId8ygL37jfA.text: The staff was friendly, prompt, and attentive. They were busy and the food came out quickly. The food looked amazing, but wasn't quite hot....but the staff made sure to fix it...and fast! They went above and beyond to make it right. The owner even stopped by the table to apologise and was very pleasant and accommodating, made us feel right at home. The food was outstanding, the coffee was hot, and the atmosphere was super chill. We will definitely be back to try more of their HUGE variety of menu options. This will definitely become a Vegas Vegan favorite fast!

pbzckwODupjvS6WBnmDvUA.text: Absolutely in love with The Modern Vegan!  The food they create and plate is phenomenal! The staff is friendly and the vibe is on point! Anthony took care of us this morning, awesome service.  We will definitely be back for more!

lntMg2E5YKHE7pOZpz1ZZw.text: Delicious! Bookended my trip to Vegas with visits; everything my companions and I tried was awesome. All the fried things came out fresh, piping hot and cripsy; the waffles were amazing (so many blueberries on the Penelope!); and the array of sandwiches and appetizers we had were all great. There is something on the expansive menu (easily more than 50 options) for everyone, even non-vegans in my group were happy. I'm honestly perplexed by the other reviews complaining about the service, as over my two visits it was stellar both times, attentive without being annoying.

8SiSzyTN5MAtNqk-ApgRsQ.text: I wasn't expecting the delicious food that came out of this restaurant.  I'm from Houston and we don't have a vegan/vegetarian restaurant like this there. The food is phenomenal.  Been there twice and well probably return for a third time before i leave. The corn dogs excellent,  the pad Thai superb, the Louisiana fried chicken to die for, fish tacos dynamite!!! Wonderful service!!! Even for non vegans/vegetarians this place would be great as well. 10 stars!!!

kbvAYhpAEHdPsJ2ED4IRxQ.text: Lots of yummy things to choose from . Also breakfast dishes all day!!! Loved my tofu breakfast skillet: tofu, breakfast potatoes, guacamole, salsa , sour cream. Lots of sandwiches and they serve very generous portions!

md0ay3kXumLx7RyOOU8R-g.text: Amazing menu and truly delicious food (I got Mac and cheese balls, fish tacos and rose which was all soooo fire; wish I could have ordered like 20 more things). The staff and owners Gia and Todd were SO friendly and welcoming. If I lived in Vegas I'd be a regular here for sure. Love you guys and wish you the best! I'll be back anytime I'm in town.

jydSdJXltTuXivNhP9I4tA.text: I ordered the chicken and waffles. It was so good!! Even though the portions were huge, I couldn't put my fork down.

Ehz01D_EY1sQm89dUPe8AQ.text: So good!  So many choices!  Fish tacos are amazing.  We also had a Reuben that was incredible as well!  Staff was helpful, friendly and very informative.  Definitely on the 'gotta go back' list!

dq9ODEizE5fe612mvKUgMA.text: This place is EVERYTHING!!!! If I could rate 100 stars, I would!! I've tried the burgers, dip, popcorn chicken, chicken and waffles, pasta, etc... if I could go everyday, I would!

qKuv7r1Nc64lJ-1J4ZR58w.text: We had friends from out of town came to visit us. They said they want to treat us to a meal in exchange for some show tickets. We took them to TMV. We told them we became vegan 2 years ago and they immediately told us "the kids won't eat vegan..." Strange, the kids are 5 and 9 they don't even know what vegan is.....  The kids were pouting because the parents already poisoned their views of "vegan food" and kinda presented "vegan" as a nasty word to them. The kids pouted the whole time they were in the restaurant. The parents ordered mac and cheese for their kids and they didn't touch it saying they don't like the flavor. I tried it and it tasted amazing. Anyways the server found out the kids didn't touch their food and took the items off the bill. It was a very nice gesture. My husband and I had Chicken and Waffles and cleaned out our plates. I really appreciate TMV's staff looking out for their customers.

Bg4y3MUj6eRQT4s5V1rHRg.text: AMAZING !!!! I Love this place. From the modern looking inside to the mouth watering food. Food filled with sooo much taste and comes out very artistic looking. I highly recommend this place to ALL vegans. They have everything we can eat from biscuits and gravy to desserts. Best part about it, it's ALL VEGAN !

BeKFDB46ex_jAbk0gWMJKw.text: Fucking loooooove this place! The food is always so amazing! I usually order through GrubHub or Postmates! They're so worth it! The few times I've been to the restaurant it's been interesting. The first couple of times I came late night. The late night crew is fucking amazing!!!! So sweet & chill! Shoutout to the really tall guy! I forgot his name :( But he's always super cool. The day time however, not my favorite. The girls are usually stuck up, all except the owner! She's so fun & nice! One of the female bartenders who's short, dark hair & usually has her hair in a bun, yeah doesn't have the best attitude. Kinda seems like she doesn't wanna help anyone. I ordered from her one time, she didn't offer me fries or a salad with my order & left so I had to stop her before putting my order in to make it with fries her response "oh yeah"  But like I said, the food is fucking amazing. Best Vegan food in Vegas FOR SURE.

mCnFxEtuBAv6nnnmnXXffw.text: Just ordered The King and The Queen burgers via postmates. Excellent burgers. I could only eat 1/2, but it was a lovely 1/2. Enjoyed this much more than breakfast here.

ILgvxPykh3YLOio9L582MA.text: I know if you see my profile and all the reviews I've done there mostly all 5 stars. That's because I haven't come across one bad vegan spot yet. If I have I would definitely write about it. This place was me and my wifes first time here and we were blown away on how pricey everything was. I mean normally vegan food is pricey but that's because it's all about the quality of the food and not so much the quantity. I have to say that the quantity and quality at the Modern Vegan was over the top! Everything was superb. Lots of flavor, very tasty. The chikn and waffles my wife got was Humungous that we actually ended up sharing it lol. I got the pulled pork sandwich and it was just amazing. Very tender and the sauce that went with it was amazing. We are coming back in April for our next Vegas adventure. Till next time. Thanks!

SmJ5UmAbhGW3TENfCMZ8iA.text: there's just no reason to eat anywhere else in Las Vegas if you are vegetarian.   If Kendrick ate here he'd be like "Eww, that Pulled-pork good why don't you sit it on my taste buds?"  seriously: try the Pulled Pork pretzel bun sandwich if you like spice!! As always, add jalapeno to make this Om nom Nomb Chompsky pop!  The breakfast menu is wicked too. Their breakfast burrito is lit. That is to say, it looks great when served! food porn!!   Their desserts and designer cocktails border on ridiculous they're so good. Go Veg!   #vegan #OneLove #vegetarian  They even public WiFi. Get the password from your server on your way in.   i saw an apple pay logo up front to pay for togo orders but will need to confirm they really work today when I get takeout. what more can you ask for?

dxTBu39LjGjCngdXVAfRDQ.text: OMG! This is amazing! On Thursday they have a house special called the "Mac Attack". It tastes better than a "real" big mac. Totally worth coming hear again.   If all Vegan food tasted this good NO one would ever eat meat!

dwuIcvo4J5wLZL2u_aYD3Q.text: I was in town for EDC weekend and this restaurant was by far the highlight of the weekend! So many food choices! YicjyM1gA25v_a5pnMQsig.text: First time here! Will be back 10000 more times to try everything. I was blown away with how delicious it all was! And the portions were great!

hHWolzSTHphxICaJ-71KIg.text: My maid of honor recently took me here for dinner before my bachelorette party. I was wearing "bride to be" sashes/tiaras and the staff quickly picked up on it and were really congratulatory, which was sweet! They quickly sat us and brought us our drinks which were delicious (The Plant Killah and Too Pretty to Work.)  Our food was equally as delicious. I ordered the Mac and Cheese, while my MOH ordered a buffalo burger. It's hard to find good vegan Mac and cheese, but this was absolutely delicious. My MOH really enjoyed her burger as well, and ate it so fast I didn't get a chance to try it! Lol. I wish we had room for dessert, but unfortunately we did not. However, it is a food excuse to return another time - which I definitely will!

photos.caption: Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States

pHNNn-xf0DMPPlGAYKRQ0g.text: So many great choices- I ate here twice this trip and plan to return to try more each time  in Vegas. The cauliflower wings were great, the burgers are amazing. The portions are HUGE- so share! I liked the modern vibe and they seem to be busy most times. Our wait last night was a little long but the food was worth the wait. It's also awesome to be open to 11-

R7oXfK7zPAvaLh3nCI6lRQ.text: I love this place. We just spent a week in town and we enjoyed our first meal so much we had to come back even with so many great vegan options around the city (compared to central Wyoming). I tried the philly cheese steak, the lobster roll, and the Austin (a killer salad covered in their own house "steak"). We also had a side of the Mac and cheese which was phenomenal on its own. I caught notes of roasted garlic but none of the standard noochy notes that come from vegan Mac. If TMV published a cookbook I'd be in line for 2 tomorrow. The food carries this place but the decor is great and the staff is professional and attentive. I never needed anything. I'd recommend this place to anyone regardless of your dietary preference. We took a friend that wouldn't have known the chicken on his salad was plant based if we hadn't been up front going in.

pEf8b35m8g39-G7RYvZbkg.text: Probably some of the best vegan food in Vegas, go on an empty stomach!! The menu has too many options to choose from. I live here and it's going to take me a year to try it all! Scott was great and very helpful. I recommend this spot to all vegans coming to Vegas!  Enjoy!!

Mmo0TCb6MN9PiZ0ZsjpXkg.text: I'm not sure if it's a trend for vegan restaurants to have horrible service. I've been here once before and everything was perfect. Tonight was a total ShitShow. No eating utensils, had to beg for ranch 5 times. Had to ask for boxes to go and the bill 3 times. Tonight's staff was truly below average. The food was also poorly made, our sandwiches were drenched in butter/oil.   This will be my last time back here ever again. Customer service needs to be addressed.

ok8euJSKRDmfu3mgleAPJw.text: LOVE THIS PLACE. My gf and I came for the week to visit Vegas and in our adventure to find a vegan spot, we found this gem! In the week we've been here we have stopped by this place twice and both times exceed our expectations. The ambiance, the staff, and the food are all to remember. And the dessert is just as wonderful! The Oh My God is O.M.G. If we ever come to Vegas again, you'll know where to find us!

CTWm_2IHmEYV41dc6h90Ew.text: I come for the chicken and waffles, the poutine is amazing as well. Kylie is a great server, knows all my favorites and her service is amazing! Love this place!

i3BniQ9JLuxd4ThNwvIoGQ.text: First time in 8 years this veg chick got down on some chicken n waffles!  Super chill and classy vibe, very open and with great sunlight.  Menu was expansive, left feeling full and satisfied. Good job Vegas!

amltmA-boZjLh-oM3YmyTQ.text: Poor service even when it's not busy. Nice servers, just not very experienced. I had the curry, very good but also had the zoodles. Zoodle dish was cold and covered in too much oil. Not a fan. Would return maybe.

nN5XizoJPkgr4hA89Qgnfw.text: By far the best vegan burger on the planet.  I wish I would have ordered one to go!  We all had a incredible culinary adventure with great service & great music.

Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Top secret new special

QENxfYu7UNcArZPNXbw3sA.text: Overall the food was good. My partner, an Omni, ordered the Pulled Pork Pretzel Bun. First bite he stated he wasn't able to tell the difference between an animal based pulled pork sandwich and the plant based one he was currently eating.   I had the Louisiana Fried Chicken. Overall the food was good. The chicken was crispy, the mashed potatoes were creamy, and the coleslaw was refreshing. Although, parts of my meal were incredibly salty. I'm not sure if it was the gravy or the breading on the chicken that was covered in salt. When I ate each bite of food with the mashed potatoes it definitely mellowed out the salt though.   Each staff member was very friendly. The wait time on food was pretty inconsistent though. We recieved the Pulled Pork Pretzel Bun relatively quickly but had to wait much longer for the Louisiana Fried Chicken. My partner had already eaten his whole Pretzel Bun by the time I recieved my food.   I would definitely go back again to try out other things on their menu. Overall we both enjoyed the food dispite some hiccups.

photos.caption: Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pulled Pork Pretzel Bun
Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Louisiana Fried Chicken

yqVkVr4Pyp1SKCt_saHdjg.text: So...the hours are all over the place, apparently. Call before heading in, that is if you dare to head in at all. Limited hours on Mondays and Tuesdays with a completely different, limited menu. Weird, but we're starving so we stayed. Wish we hadn't. I wouldn't bet on them being around in a year or 2 unless they up their game in a major way. Anyway....  Place looked closed when we got there. Very few patrons, but that doesn't stop us from having to chase down the waitress constantly as she seems to love ignoring us. At least she was smiling and cheery in our limited interactions, I guess....  Burritos came out cold. Took awhile to get them out, too. Odd given such an empty place. For some reason they also serve wet burritos on a pan lined with paper...which gets wet and soggy...and, ya know, tears and gets absorbed by your food. I don't think I need more paper in my diet, but I guess they think otherwise.  Goes well with the deafening music they blast, I guess. Maybe they figure you'll complain less if you have to shout at the top of your lungs.  Anyway, we asked for our burritos to be heated up. When they came back they were lukewarm instead of cold, so we took them to go since I guess heating up food outside of your home is a challenge.  So why 2 stars instead of 1? Well the French toast we also ordered that came out while the burritos were being "reheated" was pretty good. Not amazing, but good. "Anything with that much sugar is going to taste good" remarked my dinner companion. Still, I maintain it was at least slightly more than that, and enough to hit 2 stars when combined with a cheery, if mostly absent, waitress.

Pp3EBx2ddBYz6Zm1rBtGxQ.text: Wanted to like this place since I'm always about supporting vegan spots. We started with a ginger and celery shot that had lipstick on the glass. We ordered the the corn dogs which were tasty. My bf ordered the cowboy burger, he got the jerk burger instead which we kindly accepted to avoid throwing it out. My order of the number one skillet somehow never got put in so we waited 15 minutes while the burger got cold, which we then sent back bc no one likes cold burgers. . My skillet finally came and it was the wrong one. We ate it anyway. The server apologized and the rest of the staff was friendly. The manager apologized as well but unfortunately did not comp the meal. This might not be our first choice next time we are in town for Vegan food, too bad because the food is actually pretty good.

OLOjXuAXhXfiE0w6dOYunQ.text: TL;DR great service, friendly service, plethora of menu items, so-so food.  Came in with no expectations. One thing to note none of the staff asked about if there are any allergies for them to be aware of which I think for a vegan restaurant that should always be asked to the guest!!!!!   Was greeted immediately and sat down with menus. Menu had like 100+ items (a lot TBH) which is great and all but it was sorta overwhelming. Waitress was kinda pushy on getting apps but also was thorough on what was hot on the menu.   Food was alright. Had the cauliflower and fries (should be an APP, not an entree) it was a little too breaded for me but it was still great. Fries were hot and not soggy which is a plus!   Had the pasta which was alright but the bread that came with it was waaaay better then the dish itself. Meatballs were tasty.   Would I come back here, yes if I studied the menu so I know what I'd get prior without feeling so overwhelmed with the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spaghetti and meatballs

V1Dg52UUiEgPNH4_ofD-4A.text: Louisiana fried chicken was good. Mac and cheese not so much. Sangria pretty good. The rye sandwich was good as well.

photos.caption: Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I also had the mac and cheese. Not a big fan of that. My partner had Louisiana fried chicken and that was delicious

Bn_sOWCr1ZGIvf1w_k14sg.text: The portions are huge, you could split and share.  I had the biscuits and gravy and the biscuit was the size of my head!  Hubby had the burrito.  This is place you eat if you are starving or need comfortable eat food!

OvFxJjTS_DHjT-mNYzTAWQ.text: I ordered the pulled pork pretzel bun. I was expecting the "pulled pork" to be made of jackfruit or yuba, but it was more like seitan strips. So I wouldn't say this actually had the consistency of pulled pork, but regardless was very tasty. A messy and delicious sandwich. Restaurant is all white/modern, could do with some more color and decor in my humble opinion.

-riA1aAo4fN3bw3-tM0CBw.text: Rather than go on and on about what I like. I'm gonna post an informational break down. TMV has something for everyone whether your vegan or not. It's the type of place you can take your non vegan friends (if you have any) and they won't know they are eating plant Based. The menu covers every meal for every time of day. They are also open basically all times of day. There is beer, wine, and cocktails. The whole place is black and white mod so it has to stay clean or you'd see it. This isn't like the I only eat salad dressed with alkaline water type of place. This is the can I get a beer a margarita a bacon burger and loaded nachos type of place. Or mimosa v'eegs Benedict and breakfast burrito type of place. Whether your vegan, vegetarian, or a person who hasn't figured out eating animals will kill you. You will like something here.

vwKLxQdtXg_LVe551VV94w.text: I can't even explain how delicious this place is. We had their "Chicken and Waffles" and a Philly Cheese steak and both were amazing, I can't even tell they had no meat. The dishes were also huge so bring a big appetite or be ready to take some stuff to go. Definitely a must!!

Everyone was Awesome & the Food was Outstanding We had:  Chicken & Waffles The Reuben The Great American Burger Eggplant Parmesan Sandwich  They were all Fabulous

b_JrzxID6JuvGipjq_Gt7A.text: Pretty good food but cheap, rude owner. They use single use plastic at night. I asked the owner why and he said it was because he would have to have a "full staff" how cheap.  A vegan restaurant that does not care about the environment.

tLFENbcqBTA3f5rtdRvVkw.text: I Can't wait to come back Scott is the best waiter verry genuine with recommendations and gave us the best service!

biddAuWgmMnFY410UPOo9g.text: Updated my original sub par review because this place is amazing and I had forgotten I left it in the first place! Sorry Modern Vegan! You've more than made up for the first few times I went there!

doAoQkwUhi35ng30IvAQVA.text: I thought this place was decent. A series of "off" experiences brings me to give it three stars in the hopes they improve for the next time I'm in Vegas.   It's uncannily bright inside. Lights are turnt up and every table is reflective bright white.  My husband was excited about the milkshakes and tried to order one, but they no longer offer them despite them still being on the menu. Out-of-date menus are one of my pet peeves... just put some tape on the milkshakes.  We ordered a side dish I was very keen on, but never received, with no explanation. The restaurant wasn't busy when we were there (early evening) so I'm not sure what happened.  The food is obviously erring on the unhealthy side; duh. I knew what I was getting into but still was surprised at the oiliness of the breading on the buffalo sandwich. The pretzel bun was also slick on top with oil.  On the plus side, I'm really thankful for additional vegan options in Vegas, and the menu is very ambitious.

G0n3QKQkpmtmG7lkMi6fvg.text: I visited this restaurant in Vegas with two friends.  It was our first visit to the location and we all loved it!  We sat in the bar area and after a short wait we were greeted by Scott the bartender.  Over the next two hours he was the best host we all had ever experienced.  He kept our drinks full and had suggestions for every food-related desire we could come up with.  I cannot say enough about his service and this company.  If you are anywhere near Vegas and want a wonderful experience go here and ask for Scott!  I am eagerly awaiting the opening of the San Diego location!  Thanks so much Scott!

BxeQ8oxKJb4vfx_xHHtsvA.text: Had to give 4 stars only because there is hardly any gluten soy free options. Online menu was hard to read so I decided to take the drive only to find very few options for me. Had the beyond beef patty with grilled onions and BBQ sauce. Very yummy. I was able to have the Holly hell desert. That was really delicious. However it was brought out at the same time with my food. Ice cream started to melt. It reminded me of a mazapan. Very very good. Service was excellent and they had plenty of parking and seating.

V9VeLrY5latmL2tphxeRyQ.text: I've eaten here multiple times and enjoyed myself but was very dissatisfied with my most recent visit. Friends and I went for breakfast and my order took nearly an hour from when I ordered it to when I received it which I consider unacceptable for a simple waffle and fruit. My friends were finished eating by the time my food arrived. The food was good but I had to rush my eating because I was late by the time I got it. On top of all that it was quite expensive. I really enjoyed the food here on prior visits but this experience has left a bad taste in my mouth.

0GuNbc7TTSRtFZj7crrNmw.text: Me and homie visiting from la, we are used to eating good vegan food over there so we figured we would try out the vegan food in Vegas. I been vegan for a few years and have tried a lot restaurants. First impressions walking in..it felt like I was in the iRobot movie with Will Smith. They got chains hanging from the ceiling! It was kind of funny lol I'm slightly biased because I'm vegan to eat and be thicc. I don't care about no healthy tasty green salad vegan food. The food overall was kind of bland tasting. I think everything just needed to seasoned better.  Also I'm so grateful vegan restaurants are thing but I don't like when restaurants use gardein meat lol. It's probably the cheapest option I'd imagine. The workers here seemed kind of annoyed and depressed. They were nice and didn't do anything wrong but us vegans usually are out here radiating our positive energy and I just didn't feel that in there. Shout out to the bartender with the curls though, she was really sweet to us and none of that applies to her. I hope the other workers take after her.

oRZW_EcsU5YskSUB4CVo0w.text: This place is soooooo good! I ordered the fish tacos and was pleased surprised that I was extremely satisfied. My only feedback would be that I didn't care for so much coleslaw. I came back the next day and had the cauliflower wings. They were so big and filling. I highly recommend if you are a vegan or vegetarian. It's about about a mile and something from the strip though. Finally, the bartenders were fairly new so we're still getting acclimated so that part seemed a little rough but we laughed through it.

M_3TE5ZiQL7PqudbQdR70g.text: I'll start by saying I am not vegan and I love meat. I went here with my two vegan friends and the menu impressed us right off the bat. SO MANY OPTIONS. It was actually overwhelming. I got the Buffalo burger with sweet potato fries and a salad. Wow. It has to be one of the best meals I've ever had. Also the decor and atmosphere were so cute and classy. Highly recommend!

lSMbaGOnTBekY-mCSgN3GA.text: I will start with the good aspects! The interior is absolutely lovely and nice, ambiance is friendly, very spacious and enough place to seat.   As we walked in nobody greeted us however there is a host station. Waited for a waitress around 10 minutes to take our order. I asked for a cup of hot water, but their coffee machine was broken, so I asked to heat it up in a microwave. What as a result took them 30 minutes.   Served glass of water had a green lipstick trace. It was replaced in 30 minutes as well :/  Food...well, nothing special, we ordered a Pad Thai, it was too oily. And I had a carrot raw cake, which was frozen (although it is claimed that it should be raw and fresh). Didn't taste like a desert at all. For 10$ it is disappointing.   Wish I could give this place another shot. That have a great potential and definitely happy that we have more and more places for Vegans. Wish they could add more raw dishes like wraps or desserts, less "meat" substitutes (because for lots of Vegas it is unacceptable).  Wish luck those guys!!!

gynddJhptcRF8NiO1ks4WA.text: A friend took me here last night for my birthday.   Being a vegatarian/vegan I was excited and NOT DISAPPOINTED .   We  ordered a burger with mac and cheese on top (forgot the photo) , chicken and  waffles and for desert a deep fried banana.   Everything was amazing , the burger had some pizzazz kick  , and yummy , the banana was OMG .  The only thing I would of liked , was the waffles to be a little crunchie , not soft.  The server was very attentive  and the bus boy deserved a bog tip , he was always filling our water glass and promptly took away our dirty plates.   THIS place is SO awesome.  And I will he gpikg back .  So many more  yummy things to try and it may seem a little pricey,  but we only paid $45 .  You pay for what you get. .  Thanx guys.

PLohLX8W2Jl6o3AOeBLcqQ.text: Stopped here for breakfast before heading back home.   We got the French toast and some fried burrito type thing.  The burrito was really good, extra juicy....almost too juicy. But very flavorful  The French toast was pretty good. Except the fruit, I wasn't impressed with the fruit they had on top, see picture. Very nice set up as well. Very clean and well put together.   Will definitely stop here the next time I'm in Vegas to try one of their other dishes.

kphtYdsm9u1vBJWvaldiEw.text: We got shared a eggplant parm, meatball parm, and the rancho to start- the serving sizes were generous - they were all very good just not quite a five - my favorite was the meatball sub - and because we are fatties we got a cookie dough and ice cream dessert also very solid - I would definitely go back

dn3ZlZ3TAxQnbNvXFWiw7Q.text: First off, I had high hopes of the food because this place has good reviews and is a little on the pricey side.  Second off, I travel a lot and get to try a lot of amazing vegan restaurants, so again, I have high expectations.  The servers were kind and helpful.  The place is clean and comfortable. The menu is huge, but I was just not pleased with what I got. I ordered the V'eggs Benny for $15 and a side of Sauteed Broccoli for $5.    My side of broccoli came first and it was obviously steamed, not sauteed (and in a microwave, I assume).   Then the Benny came. It definitely didn't look as I had expected it to.  I've attached a picture.  On the menu, it says it comes with made from scratch hollandaise sauce.  While I appreciate things made from scratch, this was large mound of virtually flavorless fluff, whose texture mirrored that of the mashed potatoes underneath.  (Also found it strange that everything was in a huge heap, mashed potatoes on the bottom.)   Hollandaise sauce is supposed to be lemon-y and flavorful. Plus, there are so many delicious vegan mayo alternatives that could be used as a base.  Anyway, to enjoy my meal, I ended up scraping most of the "sauce" off and covering it with sriracha and it was ok. Not worth $15, in my opinion, but ok.  My hopes are that they improve and keep growing in popularity because we need yummy and healthy vegan food! My suggestions: serve things as described, maybe have a smaller menu with only the things that they make really well and can keep in stock?  Quality over quantity, basically.    I will be back in Vegas tomorrow and might give another item on the menu a try.

photos.caption: Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. V&#39;eggs Benny

smyW-w2-A6gbVnLFuhGTrg.text: Yummy food and great service. Check it out if your in Vegas and looking for some good vegan choices.

BwgS_MlQ-ajcOtzJ4g5Q7A.text: My first time here today and I've yelped this place before so I was really looking forward to it. It was a let down.  When I saw the menu online I was super stoked at the variety and the many vegan options available.  I tried to order the coconut curry soup.  They didn't have that soup nor any of the soups on the menu. They had just chili. I thought maybe they should take it the soup selection off the menu and just refer to it as soup of the day. There were about 9 diff soups on the menu.  I ordered the cauliflower buffalos bbq wings with fries and those were delicious.  Tried to order the cinnamon buns called nice buns on the menu. Waiter replied he wasn't sure if they had it and checked with the kitchen. He returned saying they used the wrong yeast, it didn't rise, so they don't have it today.  Then I tried to order a milkshake. He said they don't have milkshakes anymore and they've been meaning to take it off the menu. I chose to leave without dessert.  1 item available, which was a second choice, out of 4 I requested.  At some point it's just False advertisement on the menu.  Again part of the reason I was stoked to try this place was because of the variety and amount of options available which in the end didn't exist.

photos.caption: Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States

mYNlVaYIDhG36OGwn71mBQ.text: Vegan comfort food!!!!! Holy cow this place is off the hook! Chik'n & waffles...What? The prices are a bit high but, you'll go home with leftovers and be very satisfied with any meal on the menu!

StDZ-gOGU0pM--m8NYWxCg.text: This place is awesome! The service is great and the food is even better! We could not decide at first but ended up picking delicious food with the help from the awesome staff. Since it was brunch time, we got bottomless mimosas, Jalapeno poppers, chicken and waffles, and steak and eggs. Honestly, I was VERY nervous to taste the "steak" because it looked so real. If you're into the "real" feel mock meat, this place is for you! They have so much in the menu so whatever vegan you are, this place is for you!   I would definitely recommend this place to any person; vegan or not!

siP5gV-Nvcge7aVYHHN1og.text: After four long months of convincing Randall to go out with me again after our last visit to Applebees, he finally took me out. He admitted he had been distant due to the extra labia that grew on my left side, so he took it upon himself to take me to Oahu, where we sat in sun rays and I waited for my pina colada that never came. But he DEF made up for it later. I yelped and found "TMV" nearby. I'm still not sure what it stands for yet. We walked into TMV without ressoz but they sat us immediately, in the cold dark corner of the room with no light. Randall knew this would upset me because I am a REALLYY good food photographer. He wrapped his phone in old, used toilet paper that was in his tight pant pocket, turned on his phone to light my cocktail "Plant Killer".  We ordered the Ruben (which they said they had but replaced as a cold sandwich) & six minutes later, Randall got his food. He ordered the Vegan Louisiana Fried Chickies. He made an immaculate choice. He only gave me a few pieces because he's a greedy mother fucker but he paid so I let him get away with it.   Shandy gave us the Vegan Desert menu and we chose the peanut butter cookie dough with the vanilla ice cream. This was a bad choice. It was delicious but the second we ate it Randall got fat ankles and I got pregnant. We had to leave immediately. He convinced me to go on a walk, and I had to keel. I have attached a photo below of me having food farts.

PH6klD4-f2VKsRIklKynPQ.text: If I could give this place 6 stars, I would.   We came in on a Sunday, and I was already pumped for an entire menu of vegan goodies. Although I saw the prices were pretty high, I decided we should treat ourselves. The environment was decidedly hipster- clean, white, minimal, with bumpin' music.  We all chose something different: beet appetizer and pasta salad, corn dog appetizer, pulled pork sandwich, chick'n and waffles, and plain waffles with berries/walnuts. For dessert, we had cookie dough/ice cream and cheesecake trio.   Every single thing was AMAZING. Especially that friggin' pulled pork sandwich. My omnivore partner keeps dreaming about it! I mean, so do I... that "pork" had the same mouthfeel and taste if it's animal counterpart.   Only issues I had (though they were small): mashed potatoes were actually large chunks of undercooked potatoes, hot dogs used with corn dogs had a slightly odd taste (I think they used one of the more "meh" brands of veggie dogs), waffles were very soft/vegan butter was very hard. Oh, and yeah, the desserts were very, very overpriced for what you get.   To date, TMV is the BEST "junk food" vegan restaurant I've been to. YUM.

u49qGKnxCD84B9O91Sj8RA.text: First off, I don't like to post bad reviews but I had to given the food service and poor food quality. I ordered the Louisiana Chicken and inside the middle of the chicken was still frozen. They made me another one and this time around it was still cold in the middle (not frozen) but I was so hungry that I just ate around it. I let the server know and she said she would tell the manager but I don't think she told the manager because no one came out to talk about it.   My wife got the Reuben which is one of her favorites but they burnt the bread, she wasn't satisfied with it.  The only thing that was good was the potato skins and that's the only reason why I gave one star. Being in the restaurant business I would usually tip 20% or more but the service was so bad I had to tip 10%.   This is my second time being here and my last.

fAL83S1-mtl8CvL3Zg8QVA.text: This breakfast/brunch/lunch spot was sorely needed. Today was their Grand Opening, and they definitely still have some kinks to work out: 1hr + wait times for food, blenders not arrived yet for smoothies, broken juicer, etc...but honestly, what restaurant doesn't have a crazy first day/month?  The food was SO WORTH THE WAIT. Let me stress that. We ordered quite a few items and when they finally did come, it was heaven.

C3mFT2amMtcjG8Z4U9chWg.text: Slow inattentive service.  Overpriced, flavorless, poorly cooked and plated food. None of the stuff I interacted with was vegan. I feel this is a restaurant that was created to cash in as the vegan lifestyle grows and that it has nothing to do with the ethical and conscientious reasons that people are vegans in the first place. I've eaten in vegan restaurants all over the United States and the staff and the people preparing food or working in a restaurant that serves plant-based food because it is part of their lifestyle and it comes from a place of integrity. This place lacks integrity on every level. we ask that one item be removed from our bill because it did not taste good and wasn't prepared well. No more than a couple of bites were taken of a Portobello sandwich. The waitress refused and when I ask to see the manager she threatened to call the police.  It's also located in an area that does not feel safe or welcoming. Vegenation, Chef Kenny's, Violets Vegan are far better choices for plant-based dining.  The owners of these restaurants opened them to share this way of eating with others not to turn a quick buck.

dCN3jnWAeLpRqdAJulJ1ug.text: Amazing food, great mimosas. We were visiting from NYC and were not disappointed with their selection!!

R1cej_DYIk8YwTbO27ni_w.text: My type of intimacy at 4am is biting into a deep fried PB&J while I'm seated close enough to the kitchen to hear the chef say, "Careful baby, it's really hot". Pair that with some sweet potato fries and TMV sauce, and we're golden. Not only is this place open hella late now, but they serve ultra  vibey tunes and an all-around chill atmosphere with their delicious vegan fare. Shoutout to the cute bartender, Chris, workin' his magic in a glass near you until the early morn!  The decor (and even the dishes) are very IKEA, but the food definitely makes up for it. They've done a great job with the space, considering the semi-sketch strip mall it's in. This is a really cool spot for night owls like me to get our late night snack on with a side of vodka. Rock on, TMV. You're goin' places.

w_qZFpdmuQ-mnHpZXkuoXQ.text: Our first time at the Modern Vegan.  The food here is very tasty. We had the "meatball" hero and the Ruben sandwich, a falafel with sweet potato fries and salads.  Their Ruben is a very good facsimile of the real thing.  They use a great marble rye bread, real sauerkraut, and a vegan cheese.  The "meat" had a sweet smoky note like a tad of BBQ sauce was used to flavor it and pull it closer to real corned beef.  I would have loved some russian dressing, and also a critical detail that was left out... deli mustard.  French's Yellow mustard just does not get me there. Now the "meatball" hero, sub, grinder or whatever you want to call it was great. I loved the sauce and the "meatballs were delicious. Its super messy but so what? Dive in and enjoy. The falafel is a solid choice. Its not  heavily seasoned so you may want some hot sauce. The sweet potato fries initially came out cold. But our server replaced the basket with some awesome super crispy piping hot fries instantly. I also saw the "chicken" and waffles and they look downright insane. Salads are fresh too.  The service here can be a little slow but thats ok by me.  Settle in with a drink and relax. All the servers are super friendly, knowledgeable about the menu and responsive.  Overall, this restaurant is a significant advance for the Vegas vegan community and deserves a serious look. We will be back soon. Free parking in the lot out front. Highly recommend.

ElqT9cCgqHdQc7zPZqrJlg.text: Amazing service and delicious food. Besides the coleslaw being underdressed and peppery, the Buffalo Chicken Sandwich and Louisiana Fried Chicken with mash potatoes and gravy were scrump!  The ambiance is really modern and clean. The hostess and waiters all smile and very nice. Our waitress even told us what they are no longer serving and was very knowledgeable about the menu. The food came out in about 10-15 minutes which we are willing to wait for because the food is made to order.   And of course, as with most vegan restaurants, the majority of items are soy based. Not the best option but considering I only eat halal meat which is not easy to come by, I didn't complain.   I'm predicting this place will have lines out the door in a couple weeks ... Mark my words!

uroOZT5RyIBqQVkef_OCGA.text: If you have allergies, AVOID this place.   My girlfriend and I came here because she has several allergies including allergies to milk, eggs and gluten. Usually a vegan place would be ideal because they don't use eggs or milk. So we decided to come here.   Before ordering anything, we gave the waiter a card where we wrote down all of her allergies. We carry this EVERYWHERE we go and use it in ALL of the restaurants we go to.   Having that said, we asked the waiter on recommendations that would be suitable for her. At the end, we decided to have one of their gluten free breakfast bowl. The menu said it was served with gluten free cereal, and we thought so too because we have gluten free oatmeal and cereal at home all the time. It was after eating that we found out that the cereal was actually not gluten free. Unfortunately, her allergies take a while to manifest in her body so it wasn't until that night when she started to have an attack and had to take her to the Emergency Room. My girlfriend spent the night in the hospital and ruined our entire vacation in Vegas. After bringing up the issue with the restaurant, they said that they were not responsible and wouldn't offer any support for what happened. I would've hoped they offered some kind of support as the hospital bill wasn't cheap and even though she is OK, one of this allergic attacks can potentially kill her or leave her in the hospital for months.

IgQWNW_SOmyW88dZ6XTLKQ.text: Service was ehh  Presentation was ehhh  Overall exp... ehhhh   Pretty pricey for the quality and service. Great vibe walking in but the waitresses just didn't seem like they cared about our experience.

kK_xN4iOFa27yAw5Ky1voA.text: On a sunny Friday afternoon, the day after its grand opening, my SO and I decided to drive a half hour to try the hot, new restaurant boasting vegan comfort food--an offering that isn't as widely available in Las Vegas as it is in other vegan-friendly cities. Let me start by saying that the menu has an overwhelming number of options, although, nothing compared to the infamous Cheesecake Factory Bible (thank goodness).  As we sat down in the starkly white and monochromatic, IKEA-furnished establishment, I thought to myself that ordering JUST a few dishes would be devastating. But as our smiling server greeted us, she mentioned a long list of items that they were out of. To be quite frank, this was indeed a blessing. The less I had to choose from, the less conflict in my taste buds! Our limited yet still quite varied list of choices allowed us to enjoy three following items: the Louisiana fried chicken with mashed potatoes and gravy (no coleslaw for me!), a vegan lobster roll with a mountain of French fries, and a heaping side of baked mac and cheese.  Now, I'm not quite sure what it is about this establishment, but I found it so endearing. Maybe it was the Mockelby table in the far end of the room? The millions of pillows nesting on one lonely couch? The strange chain curtains separating the bar? Perhaps the wooden shelves hidden out of plain sight, or the sound of early-2000s Mariah melting into the background of a "modern" atmosphere? Stepping into The Modern Vegan, you forget you're on Nellis and are immediately immersed into a different world, the only reminder being your 8-year-old vehicle parked outside the window.  How much do you enjoy eating? If the answer is a lot, then wait-time could be a critical factor to your experience. We found ours to be relatively short. A mere 15 minutes after ordering, a baked mac and cheese was set in front of us, served in a piping-hot, cast-iron pan. It had that quintessential, crumb-top layer that mac and cheese is best known for. And while I thought it lacked cheesiness and needed a pinch of salt, I did in fact eat every single piece of elbow pasta on that pan. The vegan lobster roll didn't taste too much like it's seafood counterpart, but I thought the lobster mixture itself was refreshing and tasty. Add to that, a mountain of fried potato strips... I must admit I've never once met a French fry that I didn't like.   The True star to me, though, was the fried "chicken". I've had many-a-vegan-fried-chik'n's in the past few years of eating a plant based diet and I have to give it to this one. The Modern Vegan nails the batter, the seasoning, and overall flavor. To me, this was just right. It was crisp, but somehow light, and I couldn't help but to think about how a chunk of soy protein isolate could possibly be so, dare I say it... moist? On this spring-sunny day in March, somebody in The Modern Vegan kitchen knew how to work that deep fryer. A pepper-y gravy and some fluffy mashed potatoes complimented the crunchy, crispy, tender and flavorful vegan chicken. I was content. No animals were harmed.  The portions here met the "American standard". So much so that after licking each plate clean, the thought of ordering from their list of desserts would have been overkill for two rather petite individuals. Nevertheless, knowing I even had the choice was plenty promising. Seriously, check out those desserts! While The Modern Vegan is not perfect, and is at times reminiscent of a club, it has the potential to be such a great asset to the Las Vegas vegan community. I am definitely returning to The Modern Vegan with a bigger party to try and make my way through their menu. Give it a shot! I'm sure you'll find something you'll like.

v3nExxu-m_l4PfjwKFvSSg.text: The Modern Vegan is my favorite vegan place in Vegas. They make vegan versions of all your favorite comfort foods--burgers, waffles, sandwiches, tacos. The mock chicken salad sandwich is great. Their vegan protein is gluten free, as well. The decor is all white for that modern look.

xLjM_kTzy53yMMglbBRKVg.text: This is a great restaurant for everybody, and not just for vegans. It has a bright casual diner-like atmosphere and the service is friendly and professional. Im not vegan, but my friend Alexis took me there three times in three days, and the food is delicious and amazing! It's hidden at the southerly end of the Strip, but worth the Uber ride down. The menu is incredibly diverse. Ask Susie for her favorites, like the Louisiana fried chicken, baked mac'n'cheese, jalapeno poppers. Alexis' favorite dessert is the "Oh My God" gooey hot fudge brownie with ice cream and peanuts. My dessert was the deep fried peanut butter'n'jelly  sandwich! For those of us who aren't vegan, don't think "vegan," just think "fabulous food!" Break away for your ordinary routine and experience this exceptional restaurant while you are in Las Vegas!

Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The incredible buffalo wrap!
Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The ultimate fried chicken sandwich!

NAxwBknIdJwjOdlKftB-MQ.text: This was the last restaurant we hit before leaving LV on an epic weekend!  The menu is massive making it hard to choose!  But choose we did. We started with jalapeno poppers. I was excited since I haven't had these in years. They are advertised with bacon. I did not see or taste this.  However I did see lots of seeds left In the center making it unbearable for me to eat. My husband ate them all thee were 4 minus the one bite I took. They were fire hot. It kind of ruined his stomach for anything else unfortunately. So be ware if you order these. They don't clear the seeds!  Next I order comfort food. A nice plate of Luisiana "chicken" with mashed potatoes and mushroom gravy. The plate was massive which was cool. Lots of mashed potatoes. However when I took a bite the potatoes weren't really "mashed" like we know mashed potatoes to be. They were more like a plate of smashed boiled potatoes. No flavor no creamy taste or texture. They were chunked half finished potatoes . This was a bummer. I ask the waitress to give me butter and salt so I can try and salvage this meal. But even that was hard. I had to smash my food with a fork and add butter and salt and extra gravy just to give it flavor. She never offered to take the plate back to the kitchen or replace it.  She just said "oh yeah that shouldn't be like that". I have not reason to say why I didn't ask to send it back. I was tired and wanted food in my belly so we could start the 6 hour drive home at 8 pm in a Sunday night. Anyhow needless to say she didn't even offer to take the meal off our bill even when we said it was less than edible. The chicken and gravy was okay, But without mashies it's just not the same. She gave us a 2.60$ "military" discount as a way of making it better. Anyhow I was a little disappointed .  I didn't even take a picture of my plate to share on social because it was that bad. Service was "meh". The waitress should have done everything to make our experience better not act like she had no control over what was happening.

8cP5xWE1LKZ2XZU_P8PU5g.text: Was just there today to try and get lunch. I walked in and stood at the front where it said please wait to be seated. There was a server at the table who looked over to me and continued to take the tables order (as she should). After that however she never greeted me. She went to 2 more tables and then to the server station to put in orders. I work in the industry and I understand being busy (she seemed to be alone) but a simple "hi I'll be right with you" goes a long way. I stood there for over 5 minutes without any acknowledgment before I left. Horrible customer service

GImpQK51wwJtpGDcGj035Q.text: Amazing food and customer service!!! All vegan and amazing taste!! Great drinks too! Everyone needs to try this spot out!

ym98kyP3msFcrBdA-t9lyg.text: My. Goodness. This place is phenomenal. I am so glad my friends and I stumbled across it in our search for vegan food, cause it was such a delightful experience to come here.   We visited on a Monday morning and were seated immediately. While we had the option of ordering a beverage, we decided to forego it, as we would be getting bubble tea afterwards. We ended up ordering two Portobello Lasagnas and an Acai Parfait.   The portobello lasagna was displayed in such a beautiful manner, and it tasted absolutely specular. The portioning was just right for me, while my friends ended up splitting their portobello lasagna and acai parfait with one another.  The acai parfait looked delicious, although my friend did note that a good portion of it was frozen, so heads up on that. It made it a bit challenging to eat, as the chill slowed down the process. My friend said she would've ordered something else had she realized the parfait would be frozen.   Overall, good experience and would love to go back and try some other dishes!

pOBLChZSBmiILablvxTYfg.text: I'm not even vegan, but my friend is and wanted to try this spot while in Vegas.  Yes it's hard to mess up a waffle, but 1st off they blew me away. It tasted more like a funnel cake. Could of been on the dessert menu.  My friend ordered the "boneless chicken wings" which was actually cauliflower breaded and until i bit into it i would have never known.   I figure if i enjoyed it most people who live a vegan lifestyle would like it.

The Philly cheesesteak was also very delicious. I love how huge their menu is I can't wait to come back and try more!

jTYFWtRcpAsPtDNzGX5zgA.text: I believe that my last experience was just an off day.  The lobster roll was more "saucy" than anticipated and the gyro lacked the savory flavors that it typically has.  I know that I have been to an excellent experience at this place.   The owner is almost always present and that really makes it a opportunity to connect with her.    Due to time constraints, we weren't able to send the food back or make adjustments- the food took longer than usual to come out as well.    We'll be back and we'll be more communicative so that we're responsible for our 5 star experience as well.

rMsS_KXKudq441pDLk5q_A.text: AVOID IF YOU HAVE ALLERGIES!!!! I really wanted to like this place. But they tried to kill me with their negligence.   I am very allergic to onion and garlic -- I'm in town for a conference and there aren't a lot of options for me to order takeout, which is why I was excited when I saw TMV on UberEats. I ordered the Buddha Bowl (which has red onions in its description). I added a note about my allergies and then called the restaurant to verify that they had seen the note and could make the dish without onions/garlic. The woman who answered the phone put me on hold to chat with the kitchen to make sure. When she came back on the line she said it wouldn't be a problem for them. I double-checked and said that I'm allergic so no onions/garlic and no dressing (just  plain vinegar). She verified again with me and assured me that they could handle it. My food arrived and I didn't see any onions (at first). I poured on the vinegar, cut up the salad, closed the lid and shook to "toss" it. I started eating and after several bites (I was starving), I noticed a piece of diced red onion. I picked it out and then began using my fork to look around the rest of the bowl. Low and behold, there were more than a few pieces of diced red onions in my salad. This is so critical because eating onions (even in powder form) will close my throat.  If someone tells you they have an allergy and you assure them you can comply; you need to be vigilant in making sure the allergens don't get into their food. If you can't comply, TELL THEM. A $10 sale isn't worth putting someone's life at risk (nor the lawsuit that would follow should something terrible happen). Luckily, I realized the negligence before it got to that point, but this could've ended very badly for me. Do better.

photos.caption: Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. TMV was very negligent after telling me that they would make sure there were no onions in my dish (I&#39;m very allergic!). This is not okay!

Kxqv4wYs3vJpncN3VD0P4g.text: Started off with the avocado toast Personally I don't like cucumbers or tomatoes so my friend ate majority of the avocado toast! We both ordered the el Rancho and it was DELICIOUS. Who knew tofu could taste so good !
