bfr6pXaylYP0n3DAmQJXOw.text: I REALLY wanted to love the Modern Vegan. I read the reviews, saw the incredible pictures, and was really excited to try this place. It's not in the best neighborhood, but I wasn't going to let that dissuade me from going.   When we arrived, 80% of the tables were empty, yet we were told they were running behind and there was a wait. We waited about ten minutes to be seated, at which point we were told the restaurant was out of a lot of things from the weekend, including avocado, and hadn't gotten their food delivery today. So several of the items we wanted to order were unavailable.   Our food took about 30 minutes to arrive, despite a mostly empty restaurant. My order came with sweet potato fries, even though I didn't order them. The server offered to make it right, but I was fine eating them. The food was good, but it didn't live up to expectations. I wanted to be blown away, but it fell short.   Overall, the food was good and the staff was pleasant. I'd eat here again, but I'd definitely temper my expectations in the future.

jA5uBmIe3yF99rAy_SAQPA.text: Stood at the front counter for 10 mins because the sign said please wait to be seated.  Three workers passed by during that 10 mins and no one acknowledged or let us know that they'll be with us.  The place was only 1/3 full.  Two workers stood at the bar and looked at us rather than greet or seat us.  Got fed up and went across town for Violettes vegan instead.  At least Violettes always greets us even if there is no seating.  This place was only 1/3 full, no excuse for terrible service.  Never coming back, don't waste your time here.

UIG37hvlJ-G7S9l6ROTlsQ.text: The Best Fried chickn I've had in a while.  My husband had the chicken innwaffles, portions are delicious and huge!!! Great stop  close to  my hotel, love all the amazing menu items and deserts! Wonderful new Vegan spot!

mkWMSlHYC--fe7PWg6CoDA.text: My boyfriend and I stopped in this morning, we had the avocado love and biscuits & gravy with fried chick'n and it was absolutely amazing! Service was great, the food was to die for, and the owner was really cool also. I would eat here everyday if I could!

bvC4FECQMWp54qb1Pp4tuQ.text: Incredible.  I've eaten in almost every vegan restaurant in town and this place blew my mind.  Its in a nasty part of town but when I walked in I felt like I was in Mandalay Bay.  Everything was great but especially, from what I've tried so far, The Reuben The Buffalo are amazing.  I've gone back every week so far since I first discovered this amazing place.

9-IAnNXulRDlE3M3RoMxFQ.text: My boyfriend and I have been wanting to try TMV for awhile now, but we hadn't made our way over there until tonight. We walked in to a great atmosphere - the theme and colors flowed and made us feel at ease. It was very clean and relaxing, and the entire place was very welcoming. We sat down to a wonderfully large menu with food and beverages (They have AH-MAZING beverages by the way!) Now, I'm allergic to just about everything under the sun, and it's super hard for me to eat ANYWHERE, but Laurie and Chris were so kind and patient with me and got to know my allergies. They made sure I would be taken care of, and it made me feel so special! The chef who prepared my meal was so great too! The food I had was amazing. The best tofu scramble and sweet potato fries I've ever had. Not kidding! We were so blown away by out experience! The customer service was top notch, 5 stars. Water was refilled every time we needed more, and we were checked up on perfectly. The bathrooms were clean and well maintained. You can tell the staff take pride in the restaurant! Because of the warm welcome and the amazing food, we now can't wait to go back! 10/10 highly recommended! Thanks Laurie, Chris, and the awesome chefs who took care of us this evening!!

WXEdLM34WxzlXcJzX-URfQ.text: Incredible food!!! One of the best vegan menus I've ever seen and the food was phenomenal (I am still dreaming about the Reuben). We came 2 days in a row. As a vegan, I was so excited to find this option so close to the Vegas strip. Service was friendly and efficient. LOVE and will be back, but might have to get take out next time. The music was very, very loud (even mid-day) such that I had to yell at my friend across the table. The table next to us got up and left and decided to wait in the car for take out rather than dealing with the noise. Please turn the volume down a bit. Otherwise...perfection.

FWjH-uVW68wOIgaSNJwBPQ.text: so after reading these reviews I was on the fence about giving it a try or not. 1st off service is just eh if you will, nothing to rage about but also nothing for me to complain about. 2nd the inside is such a hidden gem, you would never know it was there. 3rd my food was so good! I got one of their sandwiches because Ive been searching for a meat free alternative and I have now found one! Highly recommend, be ready to read a novel as the menu though and brace yourself as the prices are on the higher side.

8BIMUaunYAS7Dp_GwpMSzQ.text: This is the best vegan place I've been to ever, by far. The food is incredible and there are so many things to pick from. I was in town only for one day and went twice to try and get as many things as I could.  I hope they're there the next time I'm in vegas because I'd eat nowhere else.

LbPGwpImtqMtloviHyG4VA.text: i've tried sooo many things from this place and honestly ya'll the food is good but not $15 a plate good. i've worked in more than a few vegan restaurants and only fully organic, locally grown establishments are usually this pricey. they're still new so they're probably just trying to stay out of the red. but the kicker is you can make alot of this stuff at home if you put your mind to it and spend a fraction of the money. almost all their plant meats are available at whole foods and sprouts. i don't mean to be so blunt but every time i'm here something i try taste very similar or identical to recipes i've tried off of the internet, its just nothing special. as a waitress i hate saying this but i've been here about 7 times and i've only seen one server here who didn't seem bored or confused. One random experience here that happened a few weeks ago occurred when they bring us the Gia waffles and there's almost zero syrup on it, kinda just tasted like sweet bread at that point. whatever no biggie, so i tell the waitress the waffles are a little dry and ask to get some more syrup... "okay its gonna be 75 cents if you want more" lol what? i'm expressing that i'm not fully satisfied with the waffles and your gonna charge me for it? i guarantee the blonde owner in the kitchen purposely puts such a small amount on the waffles knowing almost everyone will want more. 75 cents for 2 tablespoons of syrup surely adds up. yeah probably not gonna eat here again the more i think about it. i've regretfully given this place about $300 of my dollars, yikes.

UHn_bLnnCSB0u0OP3OvpbQ.text: Upon entering, myself and a party of two, waited patiently before being seated. We were handed menus and we're discussing what we wanted to endulge in. I noticed the waitress moved a purse from one seat to the next. As if she was "saving" a current customer from theft. The owner of the purse arrived within seconds and moved her purse right back to it's original space. Right then I felt uncomfortable and disrespected as a human being. After my company and i decided to stay despite what I witnessed. I also noticed the waitress whispering to the lady who's purse she moved. Soon after we were approached by the same woman waitress. At this point I'm feeling really  uncomfortable. She comes back and tells us that her establishement did not allow open containers. My fellow conterpart had a bottle of alkaline water. So you mean to tell me alkaline water is not allowed in a vegan restaurant? Instead, we requested water and restaurant policy. However, we were served a glass of warm water with no ice. And we did not receive a written policy, nor did the manager seem interested in serving us. We will not be returning to this establishment again. The manager and staff made it known that we were not welcomed here.

tQoBYIYENcqM5DdIA8afEw.text: I read the reviews and complaints, but wanted something different on Mother's Day. The service was actually great, with our table being pre-bussed, all food brought correctly and in a timely manner. Any server available checked on us, as well as the manager, and even the hostess. Our specific server was very helpful, and knowledgeable of the large menu, giving great recommendations. She even had a great sense of humor for our jokes, with a few of her own. My "know it all" cocktail was delicious. We ordered an appetizer, breakfast items (available all day), a lunch item and dessert. The lobster roll was actually very good, once your brain gets that it isn't lobster on the 2nd bite and just acknowledges that the flavors are still tasty. The nacho cheese sauce was not our fave, but the rest of the ingredients were good. The biscuits and gravy were delicious and I was so thankful for the suggestion. The banana split, perfect. Real french fries, are always a plus. Portion sizes are sharable, which makes for a great experience. I was so happy we didn't let the reviews deter us, that we went again within a week. My carnivorous teen devoured her meatball sandwich, barely wanting to share. Same with her waffles, which she said were the best ever. The flavor of the falafel was surprisingly fresh and tasty, though the bread maybe just slightly tough, but would still order again. The Italian sandwich was perfectly light and fresh for the 90 day, with their pesto butter adding dimension. The place is bright and clean inside, and they are the perfect gateway to plant-based eating for those who aren't committed yet. Unlike similar places, they have regular sodas, which was a plus for my coke drinking husband. There is a full bar, with tvs that showed a variety of interesting content. My only suggestion would be to please add seat covers to the restrooms. Also, I don't enjoy them being co-ed restrooms, but I won't complain because I know I'm just weird like that lol it is helpful to grab whichever is available, after all. I only wish we didn't live on the other side of town, but my wallet is probably thankful because we'd probably be there again today. There are so many more items we're looking forward to trying. The scene is growing in town, and hopefully TMV will be around for the duration. Worth the drive!

-hWClnRsLagyo90eDxTbig.text: i was visiting vegas with friends that don't have a vegan diet so i departed from them for a lunch to try a vegan establishment. i was delighted eating at the modern vegan. the service, interior, and food was fantastic. i'll go back next time i go back to vegas.

AUcppBc1RjRa3tf1anQjdA.text: this new vegan spot is an absolute MUST TRY. the food is absolutely phenomenal! and don't even get me started on how great the staff is, amazing customer service and good vibes all around! DO NOT sleep on this spot people!

LpSIBwxfYPLc00QMLJT_cg.text: Huge menus, I'm still stuffed and it's been 4 weeks. Chicken and waffles and a juice. Clean but they need an OPEN SIGN up front. It's super modern inside and fun

Definitely coming back to try more food from their huge menu.   Bonus points for having The Weeknd playing in the restaurant while I waited for my food.

gC0oBH7g1ZpZR89VJmxWZA.text: I am simply giving 5 stars ONLY for the food. Because it's bomb.  Service however: not so much. The lady was rude to me on the phone when I called in to ask if I could edit my online order.  The next day I walked in to order to go, I believe I spoke to the same lady because her voice was just as stone cold as the voice I heard on the phone. She was rude over the phone asking "What do you want?" When I had already told her what I actually wanted (and asked in my usual nice way). 86opnW4Yt1tsh3ZN88NOFQ.text: I really wanted to enjoy this place because from what I've heard/seen on Yelp-- the food looked really good and the menu was budget friendly. The food (from what I've ordered-- Gia waffle) and the Cosmopolitan smoothie we had, it was good. Mainly because waffles are my favorite things to eat.. but the my opinion of the Cosmopolitan drastically changed my view of the place and several of the coworkers who were there (at the time we were there). I want to say... before I go further, I do have a severe nut allergy. Before I went vegan, I had a terrible experience after eating a Ferrero rocher truffle and accidentally consuming nuts while I was at a mixed vegan fusion restaurant in LA... so I was unpleasantly surprised with how the staff handled the situation.  At first, when we ordered the Gia waffles I initially asked for the nuts to be removed from the dish. Thinking we were done ordering (because we were just going to ask for a milkshake afterwards) our waiter took our menus. Being out of stock, he politely said so and we didn't take it badly but we just asked for a recommendation on the smoothies (which is why I was unable to view the ingredients of the drink). He recommended the Cosmopolitan so we just ordered that. The second our food came and the smoothie, I took a sip and instantly recognized the strong flavor of nuts. Being cautious, I immediately waved for the attention of one of the servers out and asked about the ingredients (because of my allergy). Going to the chef then returning, she said there were no nuts in it. I didn't trust her-- because of how strong the flavor was, and I was 100% certain that the flavor of almond milk wasn't that potent. (I know I'm fine with almond and pistachios which is why none of the other smoothies didn't really concern me or the ones I've read that contained 'almond milk'.)   Fortunately, I didn't experience any severe allergic reaction from consuming the smoothie. But after knowing that the one of the servers lied-- just because she was afraid of something happening that wasn't even her fault, angered me. The smoothie contained peanut butter. So yes, it did contain a nut other than almonds. The food here is enjoyable but if anyone has a nut allergy, I strongly recommend to either not eat here or to be extremely careful with what you order.

YCSnQFJtb1H3Newi5VgURg.text: Great food most of the time. But overpriced as heck. When I first went here prices were half of what they are now and so the main thing keeping me from eating here as a local is the price.  . I don't mind eating expensive food but it better be gourmet and this is not.

cEM9NzsW-Ftt-hz4l76o0A.text: Ummmmm how do I even begin. The service was excellent. The food was even better. The amount of choice I had was unreal. So worth every bit of our, their soups blew my mind every single one sounded amazing  (I had broccoli cheddar and it was spectacular) this place was everything my little vegan brain could ever dream of.

XgQRL_1xqqo-1_3GCbMS3Q.text: This plzce has such an extensive menu. Theres always something for everyone. The hollandaise sauce on the eggs benedict are a bit off-tasting. Overall, its a good place and ive been there many times.

MCfwDjMm1lnCWi7mzUc70Q.text: Bomb! Glad to see such great plant based options in Vegas, I know where to go when I'm here, definitely will be back

7Fpb8bdKcxRv3F90aWIMWw.text: We were in Vegas for the weekend and found this amazing spot. I only regret not having more time to eat there more than for breakfast. I will be telling everyone I know to go try it! Great good and staff!

4QDcRHb07X_qOCUlV_-stA.text: I got the pad Thai and it was so good. It's a huge dish so definitely share. This was the first time I went to a restaurant by my self and it was a good experience because the bartender taking my order was really nice to me. I want to try more things, I can't wait to be back.

U1PcylaDacRJAGkT3y1n6A.text: This is one of those places that induces some serious option paralysis - the menu is extensive and everything sounds amazing. Initially we asked our server what's really good and she proceeded to list off basically everything, but helped a lot once we had to decide between a few things. The Big Easy burger was delicious - gonna wonder probably forever how they got the "eggs" to taste and feel so right - and the pulled pork on pretzel bun was maybe the best I've tasted. Excellent stop!

Y-fzV1t7XqJD3hS5xwGeyA.text: I appreciate the sheer existence of this place. It has so much going for it: A) Vegan. B) Vegan. C) Centrally located. D) Late hours. E) The menu is HUGOS. You could please many kinds of folks right there. F) Online ordering, yay.  K, so, when it comes to the actual food, I have mixed opinions. But I will be back to try more, so obviously I'm not that miffed. I think it would be best for me to individually explain the zeniths & nadirs of what we got.  The presentation of everything was high-end, and the portion sizes were awesome. I wouldn't complain regarding the price when it comes to the Chxn & Waffles, 'cuz that is a metric f#ckton of food. But, when it came to the Baked Macaroni, I felt jipped. If it were cheaper, I woulda ordered more things (curious about the Jalapeno poppers & the other 862 menu items, lol). In a way, their pricing is losing sight of that fact. Maybe in the future, they can offer a mixed appetizer dish for somebody like me who just wants to try a bunch of fried apps & get my feet wet.  The Chxn (of Le Chxn & Waffle platter extravaganza) was bomb-diggity, and the very best thing on either plate. The mash was acceptable, but needed some more love via fat & salt. I was glad they weren't too pasty & weren't instant, 'cuz there is no frickin' excuse for that. The waffles & asparagus weren't bad. Bacon coulda been crispier. All in all, 4/5.  The Baked Mac; however, had this really strong flavor, and once I had enough, I just couldn't look past it. It was supposed to be "bacon"-flavored, but honestly, it was like, cumin-chipotle-chorizo-tapwater. It also needed salt. Sigh. It coulda been good, too, and appealed to more palates if it were "plainer" or whatnot. Maybe offer two versions? Idk. And the parsley cheese topping looked so nice. I was disappointed. I coulda handled some bacon bits, but the flavor mix permeated every elbow macaroni, like woah.  I'm a fatty. I'll be back anyway.

IL7q37UshZBetVTSOo9xXg.text: The chicken and waffles here are to die for. Love the fact that TMV has a bar for alcohol and smoothies. The night probably has the best bartender in the city. Check him out for some of the best bar conversations.   Even though I'm not Vegan the food still tastes great. Definitely recommend to come out and try it.

CxEDeBKJO33lW_BVQV31XQ.text: Chicken and waffles were amazing. Was disappointed that many of the items on the menu were not avail. No bowls, no tomato soup, no zucchini fritters, they didn't know how to work the Lavazza coffee machine, no paper towels to dry my hands in the bathroom...and it was noon. Service was definitely lacking, will return maybe it was an "off" day. I'm hopeful it was because the dish I had was good! Very large portions.

yqZ3U_hG_C0B8pCUwi8RYg.text: I do my best to support plant-based eateries, but this one was a HUGE miss. They left the salad dressing off my salad and subbed Diet Pepsi for Diet Coke without notifying me ahead of time, so I chatted with grubhub about the issue. Lavanda called the restaurant on my behalf and was told that I needed to request salad dressing separately. Um, 1. the salad description listed salad dressing as being included, and 2. that's insane. So I choked down my dry salad with soda I don't like after nice Lavanda was lied to. 3 stars for so-so food, -3 stars for 2 problems with the order and terrible customer service.

NIHiZu2TeSz-8FXHGSW-pA.text: I really don't recommend this place, some plate are probably good but 2 out 3 was not really good and they couldnt do anything to replace them or give us a deal, but the waitress was really nice and polite. DONT TAKE THE JALAPENOS POPPER it taste like they dropped a shovel of spicy flour in your mouth, have fun!

yo6UjMZbq6vmtWDZoK0Ghg.text: Love the fact it's open through the night. They serve only vegan food!!! Kudos!   The flavor was too much for my taste. Ordered the meatball sub it came out to be soggy and it wasn't the best. Price is on the higher side; Will go back only if I hear about any changes to their menu.  Service 1/5 - slow.

rUE5p7X26v6yFVA_ehzbGA.text: Excellent comfort food and quick service! Like under 5 minutes for an appetizer quick. I got the aria smoothie, poutine, and chickn & waffles and couldn't be happier. It's 5 minutes from the airport so also super convenient for travelers. Couldn't recommend them more!

photos.caption: Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Canadian Poutine
Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chick&#39;n Waffles

kBvdvZtjEL8EN2FSPXsDkg.text: I had to try this new place in Las Vegas. It is very near the UNLV campus, and frankly, the menu was so big, I think I would probably have to go here 50 times before I could try Everything. What caught My eye immediately was Florentine with mashed potatoes. I am a sucker for mashed potatoes. This dish was beautiful, beautifully presented, great blend of flavors, appetizing in every way, and extremely filling. I had intended to get dessert but forget that. The mashed potatoes were creamy, mashed with skin on, and they had a great flavor from the combination of the other vegetables in this dish. No, I did not lick the plate...  The decor is beautiful clean, black and white, a metaphor for what our food choices should be. Black and white, food is either healthy or it isn't.  The background music is what you would expect for a college location, and the big screen TVs all around displayed adorable animal pictures.  And added bonus, free coffee refills! I completely enjoyed this experience and have every intention to return.

photos.caption: Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States

fzicjjAd4JkxrbiNZKiTHQ.text: Took a trip to Vegas for my birthday and found TMV on Yelp while looking for a vegan brunch spot.  I was craving more of a "traditional" brunch and when I found they made biscuits and gravy I was sold.  We ordered the biscuits and gravy, and chicken and waffles.  Both were absolutely delicious.  The service was friendly and prompt.  The prices were fair and the portions huge!    I liked it so much I came back the next day.  Was less of a fan of the lobster roll.  While the sandwich was good, it had no resemblance to a real lobster roll.    I will definitely be back next time I'm in Vegas.  Wish they would open a spot in SF.  They would make a killing.

fVUR1A-uniCHFhkw-iqwlw.text: Biggest vegan menu in town! Their service has really improved since I first went here about a year ago. Food has always been great every time I've been whether it's in-house or take out. The bartender is super friendly and remembers you when you come back. They have everything from healthy choices to sheer gluttonous deliciousness LOL.

photos.caption: Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Their new addition,  a Portobello steak stuffed with &#34;lobster&#34;, topped with mozzarella and herbs with veggies on the side. Yum!

lo-8EnBp9Wfpl80kzblVqw.text: We were in Las Vegas for one night and we told ourselves we had to try at least two vegan joints to see what Sin City had to offer and we were not disappointed.   We woke up and were craving that brunch "giant plate" comfort food, you know what I'm talking about ... the kind of grub that makes you un-do that top button of your pants and keep going.  The. Modern. Vegan. Delivered.  They had a huge selection of vegan comfort food like Mac n' Cheese Balls , Jalapeno poppers, Corn Dogs, Nachos, and also included old classics like ..French Toast , V'eggs Benny (which is exactly what we ordered) absolutely beautiful plates of plants! The hollandaise sauce holy s*** !! Amazing - is that eggplant??!  The "bacon" was scary good and the English muffin was fluffy this combo sat on top of a bed a mashed potatoes and smothered in rich and creamy and savory Hollandaise  *homer drool*  you'll have to go and try this for yourselves I have no more words .. just drool.   Atmosphere was light and modern (duh, lol) and the service staff was attentive and very friendly ! We will be back

photos.caption: Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States

v5LXuThrR4Neqk3WNi4bWg.text: I've dinned here a hand full of times. The Modern Vegan satisfies! Each item on the menu is a mouth watering exceptional treat!!

fonz-EnWVfBP5Fwu3kpYWw.text: Make sure you get over to TMV for taco Tuesday! We went and ordered the fajitas, it was large enough to share. That didn't stop us for ordering a tostada, and a churro stuffed French toast. It was all extremely flavorful! Treat yourself to some great tasting Mexican food!!

AlCYwY0nQ0gPyrgSq7A3vw.text: My wife and I stopped by for Sunday brunch. We were greeted and seated very promptly. The server was very nice. The menu has a ton of options. This place is like heaven for a vegan!  We started with the avocado trifecta which was tasty. My wife got the made to order waffles which were probably the best vegan waffles we have ever eaten. I got the buffalo chicken sandwich. The servings are huge! Two people could easily split one entree.   Overall we had a very nice experience. The atmosphere was nice and the food was very good.   We will definitely come back.

IpOt1Ee_EVeGUb1c8fhjfQ.text: Holy balls. This place is epic. I could and will eventually eat everything on the menu. It was tasty. Had the pulled pork sandwich with fries. Ate it all. I think about it often. Eat here.

BfzhVy49aleE6IEwCGmXqA.text: The food is absolutely amazing. The menu selection is huge. I first had TMV when i placed a pick up order. The second time i sat inside. The service was good the waiter was awesome and didn't give any attitude to me when I asked to have the fries remade because the were cold and my philly sandwich was cold. The bartender (Lindsey I believe )on the other hand wanted to help but also tried to give me a guilt trip that the waiter has to pay out of pocket for the fries being remade because the owners don't like if something had to get returned . She was also hesitant to give her name.

B8Ew1EenLIXbucp0ZdoXXw.text: Largest vegan menu I've ever seen! I found this place on Instagram a few months ago before coming here & it lived up to my expectations & then more. I enjoyed the nice modern atmosphere & the friendly waiter. 10/10 would return.

xkJV2MOWKf-baNNXehiMIw.text: $20 for chicken and waffles? Lmaoooooooo. The food here is mediocre at best. Definitely not $20 worth. Trying to capitalize on the vegan dollar like this is lame. I will never step foot in this place ever again.

6dX18UnjR3SKoZYeQFs0Vw.text: I had the fried chicken it was incredibly tasty and very flavorful and the crispy breading was spot on. I got my gravy on the side so as to not make the breading soggy. My honey had the buffalo chicken sammy with a salad and liked it well enough. But felt the avocado should've been pureed so as to not make the toppings fall off. The environment was relaxed and clean. The waitstaff was friendly and polite. We had a server with a necklace on that said angel and she was very attentive with out being pushy, and gave us plenty of time to look over the menu and even recommended her favorites on the menu. Very good selection and variety of food. Super delish all vegan fare! We will be back next time were in Vegas! So yummy! Thanks TMV!

photos.caption: Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Buffalo &#34;chicken&#34; sammy with side salad
Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Louisiana fried chicken with mushroom gravy on the side.

_MHcFzovykD2Daheq1a-yA.text: So amazingly good. I would come to Vegas to eat here. Got the popcorn chicken and the Philly cheesesteak. Great vibes. Friendly staff. 10/10 would come back.

k86euVOiy9k9iTuydH-Nig.text: This is the first time I've tasted vegan meat and I have to say, I didn't hate it! I had the "Rancho Burger," which is a lot like the Buffalo burger but double patties. I'd say you don't need the double. The single patty is good enough. I had the fried PB & J and it's was just too much food. I much prefer a Normal PB&J, as I also felt the peanut butter overpowered the sandwich. This place is good, but contrary to my bias (which is of course ignorant), vegan doesn't mean light. Order like you'd order anywhere else and I'm sure you'll be happy with it. Don't just order a lot because you think it's "vegan" so de facto lighter than actual meat based staples. I Loved the food, service and cutest decor all over the walls. I would definitely go back if I'm in the area.

MkT1carlXuXzDFzz7u2MLA.text: Love love love! Went back twice in one weekend. Great vibe, great energy and so many options. I couldn't believe it was all vegan. Top 5 of all time for me in plant based cuisine. Maybe even top 3!

photos.caption: Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Front

QN7LYy3SoxlXBxeo0h867Q.text: They were out of a lot of items. One of us ordered a Blt and they were out of bacon. Instead they put syrup soaked breakfast sausage on without telling us beforehand. Also two items we ordered had avocado, but they were out and they didn't tell us beforehand. If you're out of something fine but don't try to sneak it past the customer hoping they won't notice.

SayUClah6yx5AE7che-kLw.text: The texture for the imitation meat stuff is great, food is hot and presented well, however, this place is pricey.  This is more a first impression, or first few visits review.  The location is weird cuz the neighboring businesses are ghetto or the rowdy gay bars.  The moment you go inside the property it's like you're not in east Vegas or the Tropicana paradise area.    The music Is upbeat and chill but not my preference.  It's the popular music for the kids-30 year olds  The clientele is mixed, which shows that this place needed to be here cuz there are a lot more plant based diet foodies in the area.  Fries are hot and well cooked but they're too salty.  They need like paprika or something.  I wish they would offer condiments other than Heinz ketchup.   The jerk chicken has a great texture and taste to the meat and cheese but it doesnt taste just like jamaican jerk.  More of a subtle American eh.  Reuben texture was great but still needs something.  Still one of the best vegan reubens ever.  Mac and cheese was also tasty, but wasnt as hot and gooey as I pictured it when ordering.  Packed house or busy, means the lighting is super bright like a museum and I'm not into it.  When it slows down the lighting is much more intimate and more my taste.  They have a bar here with your usual drinks.  It would be cool to see more specialty cocktails or special stash, high end liquor too.  The seating areas vary,  the majority of the seats are nice but not the most comfortable.  They are light and easy to move but need handles.  The decor isnt my cup of tea, but it is well placed and caters to the modern vegan, hence the name.  The whole feeling of the place is basically for the namesake.   Expect the servers to focus more on the large groups.  They are great but not top tier.  I purchase vegetables and cook vegan food.  So I know that what you're paying for here is mainly ambiance and hanging out.  Great spot for the UNLV guys, artists, young foodies and all that.  For me I think it still needs more. And to have more appropriate pricing.

GKzNXiP1etFhgw3Fpv49gg.text: FINALLY! I got to try this place! I've been hearing so many great things.   I decided to try "The Snob" as a meal and "Don't Stop" for dessert. I thought the burger came with a meat patty, but it's actually just a portobello mushroom. I was surprised, but it was great when I added the meat patty to it. A little too cheesy in my opinion, but good. Dessert was okay, I wish it was more of an apple pie crumble , not just an apple crumble. Definitely, will come back to try other items on the menu. Also, Alex was a great server! She took care of us and made sure we got everything we needed.

SJ1Hpd7qTe9yMoeMafXNEQ.text: OMG this is the absolute amazing phenomenal vegan place I've been at ! I got the great American and it was soooo yummy as well with getting the taste of my roommates orders and their drinks , we all got a taste of each others orders and I was amazed how delicious! Top notch vegan food , and this owners place is SO modern so inspiring and motivational. Absolutely love it   #HighlyRecommend #GoodVibes

rwGcGZApRKTBzDgWdk-B2A.text: This place has so many great vegan breakfast and lunch options, the menu is huge and the food is delicious!

-T8pzZNh0duGBBbfq-kL1Q.text: I've been here 3 times trying to give it a chance. The food is not good, there's way too many things on their menu to make anything great. And their service every time has been terrible. Dirty bathrooms as well. Not a fan.

vxmp1D4N4QNweidIOlz3pA.text: Yvette, the manager,  at The Modern Vegan gave me a call later that day and apologized. They had mixed up my order with another customer's order. I am here five days later at The Modern Vegan and they are taking care of me. They're making the wrong right. I would recommend The Modern Vegan to everyone who likes good food.

IBf2qunwUzK2q6ol6RwcsQ.text: I love the atmosphere and the girl workers are beautiful . I got the breakfast burrito it was not what I expected, but I loved the potatoes. I also tried the Mac n cheese but was also not what I expected. My friend got the chik n waffles, I wish I would of got that lol. They have so much on their menu to choose from .

rX-3ZeE-Jphi8cjCGu-Vtg.text: Perfect place for the vegans in my family. So many options and so little disappointment. We spilt the popcorn chick'n, chick'n & waffles, and also had the gyro, BLAT, and Jerk Chick'n sandwich. The jerk could have used a bit kore jerk seasoning or marinade but overall good experience. Also try the deep fried pb&j if you've never had one!

0ApuEsGOXZVQ9M7z7kHXJQ.text: This place is amazing me and my fiancee are vegans and my children are trying to convert, it's hard for them but after taking them to TMV they were like mom I'm done with eating meat...the food is amazing, the owner is amazing, she is very humble, kind and we felt so welcome.  This place is for everyone not just for vegans. 10 stars hands down.

nVlSVCXTu6N8Ah4rU5VyfA.text: The food is terrible. They advertise on Instagram the Impossible burger as if they have it all the time. Hardly ever posting ONLY served Thursdays. The waiter was not helpful couldn't even bring my drink even the the restaurant was empty. I thought my sandwich was going to be in the Impossible burger and it wasn't which she explained is only served on thursday. I say to her "I'm sorry I thought it would be the Impossible I didn't  mean to order this can I get the menu? " she says okay but leaves the food brings back what I ordered still leaves unwanted untouched food right at the edge. Finally at the end she says I have to pay for it THEY won't  except it. Who the F**k is they and why are trying to apply rules that don't apply in any other restaurant. Is this because your food is subpar? I actually want my money back for that horrible sandwich and I can't even speak to the manager because THEY don't  answer the phone. I would have rather said this to a Manager. We tried 3 dishes and they were all not good.

u2w6nUK5v_YywKuPA8ooLQ.text: Wow! Awesome food. First of all, the outside looks like they are closed because of the dark windows, but once you're in there... it's bright, lively, and fun. Vegan ptions galore!!! Loved the Jamaica salad. Best dressing ever... the best restaurant I personally I have been to serving vegan options in Nevada, California, Idaho, or Georgia!

TqBJb3LcW9iqX_kJTwJx-w.text: I have to start off with the amazingly huge menu, the diversity of the dishes offered makes it easy for anybody to find something that they will love and enjoy. I think that the menu is very reasonably priced considering the common misconception that vegan food is super expensive. The presentation of the dishes are fun and well thought out. The portions will not leave you hungry! The cocktails were not only aesthetically pleasing but tasted great as well. The ambiance is hip and modern as the name suggests. Every time I come in it is super busy but I am always greeted and sat right away. Service is fast and efficient. For a brand new restaurant I think they are off to a great start and am excited to see what fun and exciting things they think up next!

IESeREVLMnjm-3EBNW-hlQ.text: So freakin good! There are finally more vegan restaurants coming to Vegas, which helps vegans and non vegans that love vegan food a lot. Good location and the restaurant was very clean. Good vibes only!

3u1sI9ZUt1PHux3UEaLzLQ.text: The modern vegan is a hit, the owners and are very friendly and set a great atmosphere... Very clean and elegant. the Menu has a huge variety to choose from. The loaded nachos were amazing, the chicken and waffles were also great.

RG9Ye2DXlnjxOmL4i7D4ng.text: Huge menu variety, all Vegan, fast service by a team. Very well run. Happy people at e every table.   We had cauliflower wings, buffalo chicken sandwich and a Rueben. All delicious. Going back to try more. A great find in Vegas a short drive from the strip.

Dj_WkCbFQHa4CHcub7YN2Q.text: I'm from Philadelphia and have experienced some amazing vegan restaurants. Hands down, The Modern Vegan Restaurant food and service was amazing. I went again the same evening for dinner. The eggplant parmigiana was soooo delicious.

IgT158Daq_UxK2AUG5z8Gw.text: service wasn't the best. kinda took a while to check on us but to be fair she was the only server on. most of the stuff we had was mediocre. the guac and french toast was bomb tho

2FWtIWTArJeGqdp3azmE2A.text: Incredible food and friendly service. My family loved everything. For starters we had fried mozzarella balls and jalapeno poppers. The sauce that came with both was delicious. For entrees, the biggest hits were the chicken and waffles on mashed potatoes and the buffalo chicken sandwich. They are vegan wizards.

vK3GbeGcK0ZMNsDQRy3XTw.text: My wife and I recently had dinner here and it was fantastic.  Yup it's vegan but our meal was not health food...it was just great food.  I had the best "bacon" burger I've had in 8 years.  The menu is so extensive it took us a while to decide.  Staff was friendly and their recommendations were right on.  We were in the dining area but the bar looked like a great place to watch a game or hang out.  We'll be back.

MutwxxRHDij8bbF0DKXS2Q.text: Hands down the BEST vegan joint in Vegas!! My husband and I were in town for a few days and we went twice! The owners are really involved, and it's not a chain so support the locals! We had some coffee and  the chicken and waffles which we split and was phenominal, also had zucchinni fritters, buddah bowl, loaded queso, and buffalo chicken sandwhich. There was nothing that i didnt enjoy and i wish i had more room to eat because I could of stayed there all day and ate! Haha. They offer breakfast, lunch, and dinner with a wide menu. Also have appetizers, smoothies and cocktails. The staff was amazing and attentive! Check this place out!!!! You can't go wrong!

o7b4GgyKGhtsUrxNJgkYSg.text: I was so happy to find this gem! Vegan or not the food is refreshing. I encourage everyone to check it out. The hand held salads were a treat!!

9oa1ipbCicPWoIPPNUCbLA.text: HANDS DOWN BEST VEGAN BUFFALO BURGER EVER !!!! I left completely satisfied and happy, places like this is when I get the most joy out of being vegan. Vegan food is good period. Defiantly coming back when I'm back in Vegas.

uMhPQFIM91NSgx8MOJBhmQ.text: We had the frenchie and #1 skillet. The food is amazing! But  since they just opened,  they haven't worked out all the kinks.

nKuSGnWV7Uv2SWrmpzIYwQ.text: I was so looking forward to try their food for the first time, unfortunately I have to say that this was the first and last time I'll come in here. The menu choices were just overwhelming, narrow the menu down and work on bringing good taste to those items. Ordered the V'eggs Benny and mac n cheese baseballs. The v'eggs benny-everything except their Hollandaise sauce no flavor what so ever. The mac n cheese baseballs was an epic disappointment. Just the thought of them makes me cringe. Unlike v'eggs benny they had a flavor, a very very bad flavor. Like seriously how can you serve that to people.Spent almost 50$ on food I couldn't even eat (I don't mind spending money on food, if the food is worth it) If you're going to serve such flavorless food at least and put some salt and pepper on the table lol.  As far as the atmosphere, the place looks super cute, clean and the girls that served us were cool and polite.

4Ha75yIG2XfVDPtMOubnuA.text: Happy to find a good Vegan Restaurant in Vegas! Service was good food excellent. Portions are really big next time I will share.

A9kZWf7D36ApPZuu7dObZg.text: When this place first opened it was PERFECT! However the last few months I have noticed a huge difference. The quality of the food has gone way down, sloppy presentation and poor taste. The customer service is always good but I got a headache within the first 5 mins because the music was Soo loud!! I couldn't even hear the guest that I was dining with. I also can't help but to point out that the last few times I've been there I haven't seen the owner? Maybe things are different when he's there?

1E56vy9D9bHZAzmPhkjAoQ.text: I'm new to the Plant-Based Diet lifestyle. But I've been to a couple restaurants in Las Vegas and TMV is the best so far. I had the Philly Cheese Steak and Popcorn Chicken. I loved them both. Our apps were half price and were so large that we split the entree. Plenty of food for the price. Can't wait to go back.

3gj7_6N4w7zRTRKvpAcNDw.text: I am really excited that Las Vegas is gaining more and more vegan restaurants to ease our minds as we make our decisions for dinner throughout the week. I do think that new restaurants need to do more research about owning a restaurant as a whole before they open the doors. Great food is not the only thing that will keep your business going. You need to have the fundamentals of customer service, execution and presentation of your food and restaurant, and inventory down pat or you'll risk losing a lot of potential clientele simply because you were either ignorant or ill-prepared.  That being said, The Modern Vegan has a very clean look when you walk in, and the staff seems friendly. I was greeted by the hostess immediately who showed me to the bar, which I was excited and surprised to see was a full-service bar. The bartender was also friendly and polite, but you can tell that is stressed out for very a good reason. I sat down close to the food window, and just paid attention while I read through the menu. I will say that I am huge about making sure I don't hear any work drama in front of customers, and I wasn't happy to hear someone yell at the servers about not picking up food fast enough from the window. Say whatever you want, but do not do it in front of customers. It's embarrassing for the employee and kind of sets an aggressive tone around your space.  Back to the menu. It's a massive menu; too massive, if you ask me. Not only was it a lot for me to take in, but it was obviously too much for the kitchen to handle. Half of the items that I ordered were 86'd, including all of their 8 or so soups except for one, two appetizers, the cocktail I ordered, and one sandwich. And that's just based off of what I ordered and overheard people discussing. What I ended up with was the stuffed avocado appetizer, a side of Mac n cheese, and a raw carrot cake Togo.  The food came out quick. I wasn't a fan of the bits in the Mac n cheese, but it was a solid side dish. The avocado I probably wouldn't order again either. There was something in it that was very salty. So I just dumped out the tofu scramble and ate the avocado plain.  That raw carrot cake was probably my favorite thing. It's actually amazing. I would call back to order it Togo, but I did overhear someone on the phone tell the customer that she wouldn't do any take out orders.  I'm honestly not coming back for a while, until the buzz dies down and they figure some things out. I get that a new business needs to learn, which is why I'm reiterating that before opening up a business, some research needs to be done. If all you have is one soup, then do a soup of the day. Don't try to keep up with that huge menu. Customers get disgruntled if they can get what they want, and my second and third choices will never taste as good as what I originally wanted to dine in for.  I want to see vegan restaurants thrive in Las Vegas. Hopefully whenever I come back, I can edit this review and tell you how wonderful everything is.

L8XOeH-NKAgTA1uoXYnfmw.text: Nice looking place but the food not so good... do not try mac n cheese balls, they don't have any flavor super dry . I was waiting 25 minutes to get the food so they gave me 10% discount, thanks! I wouldn't come here again...

bZn70EE3jIm8PgR0kp8mrg.text: Pretty good Ruben and side of tofu. Thanks so much. Ruben was soft and I like it that way. Most are crunchy. Not here. Happy.

photos.caption: Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kitchen

WXQuLqj0AsyTtJbrII9caQ.text: So I normally don't write yelp reviews(seeing as my account is 7 years old and I only have one review). But after what I experienced today I just had to. I just want to take the time to say to whoever is in charge of this establishment that your employee Kylie is simply amazing. I walked into the modern vegan not expecting it to be as busy as it was so I thought I'd be waiting forever to be seated and eat. But the she managed that full busy restaurant so well I was seated in no time! And it was such a happy atmosphere for how packed it was, generally there's almost an upsetting vibe to packed restaurant especially when people find out they have to "wait." She was very quick and efficient with everything that she did to get us seated as fast as possible. She even recommended the buffalo burger as something I should try and it was absolutely amazing!!! I can see why it's a popular item. I will definitely be coming back here next time I have a Vegas trip and recommend anyone reading this to head there if you want excellent customer service with a smile!

MUVUph1OzB1tkhqgxO635Q.text: The food is amazing and the staff very friendly.  The only negative I have is the random days they are closed.  I have stopped in five times to eat in the last few months and they have been closed four of those days. It's not convenient to where I work and therefore I must make a special trip. The food is worth it IF they are open.  So--food and service Five Stars, hours of operation--One Star.

GjMThCpExH6spdNHIChrtg.text: Over processed and over priced. Food - 3 Stars. Service - 2 Stars. Prices - 3 Stars.   Food: The food was decent, but I had to scour the menu for something that was not over processed chemical versions of omnivore food. As a vegan, I wish vegan restaurants would embrace vegetables, nut cheeses, tofu, etc. and NOT processed fake meats and chicken. The menu is extensive and the restaurant is missing half the ingredients. The waitress must have returned to the table five times to say they were out of something.   Service: At first, our service was just fine, but then the waitress got busy. Not her fault at all. But while I sat there for twenty minutes after finishing my food, waiting for the check, I could not help but notice the four people behind the bar doing nothing. One was looking over ordering and appeared to be the owner. This is for you: help your employees! It looks so bad and is irritating to watch one waitress cover ten tables while the rest of you stand around.   Prices: WAY overpriced for what it is, honestly.   I won't return. Better vegan options in LV.

ecCfEj_QSobDPaKpcDdqzw.text: The vegan "Hash House a go go." Plain & simple. The food was so good! Best vegan restaurant in town! Grand presentation/plating & so many options on the menu! They have a full bar (try their Bloody Mary). Not gonna lie, I don't really like the location, but it's so nice on the inside, it doesn't even matter. It's worth it!

photos.caption: Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States

F298Gu_isduO4323WH0qqA.text: Cool place that I will for sure come back to. We got there about 5pm.. the place doesn't technically do dinner and closes at 6pm. Our server was helpful and attentive in making suggestions and letting us know what the favorites were. There was a bit of an issue with two people in our parties orders. The kitchen was out of pretzel buns. This was fine and they opted for the only other option given to them, sourdough. Our server came back saying the chef suggested they pick something else as their sandwich / burger choices were tailored to that bread choice. Understandable. They picked something else. We also split the nachos between the 4 of us with bits left on the platter. Our food came out in a timely manner, two at a time as the orders were out in. I got the chickn' and waffles... so good. Hit the spot on all levels of sweet and savory. And it's a tower of food see photo! Totally shareable. I didn't fully know what to expect but was happy to see asparagus and a bed of mashed potatoes that soak up some of the syrup... perfect. We also tried that Mac n cheese and weren't impressed there. The Ruben was good but the other sandwich at the table was not a big hit. The menu has something for everyone and a bit more. You can enjoy an adult beverage of grab wellness shots and smoothies. Excited to work my way through this menu.

photos.caption: Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nachos!
Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chikn&#39; n Waffles!

7ZoLwR5e0oQio0VCe86opQ.text: Have not been back to Vegas since living here for 7 years and relocating in 2009. When I lived here vegetarian and vegan options were limited. So to my great surprise, my wife researched and found some key spots she wanted to try on her first trip here. She picked a WINNER with TMV!  This is now my favorite place in Vegas! We ordered the Saucy Cauliflower Wings (which comes with fries),...delicious!   My wife ordered the Louisiana Fried Chicken, which comes with mashed potatoes and a mushroom-sausage gravy,... I sampled some of her plate and almost wish I had ordered the same, so tasty!  I ordered the Philly Cheesesteak w/fries,.... equally as tasty!   The price was $14-15 for each item we ordered, and WELL worth it as TMV gives you HEALTHY portions that don't disappoint and make it hard to finish your plate. I saw another patron who ordered the Spaghetti and Meatballs, and I regret my stomach isn't big enough to eat all of that in one sitting so Spaghetti and Meatballs is on my list to order when I come back.   Thanks TMV, cooks and staff, for making my return trip to Vegas and my wife's first trip so satisfying!   5 stars from me for the large variety of menu options, the delicious taste, large portions and decent price and atmosphere.

yQp4E7yPkeD1_aA3SQo5Kw.text: Food is very tasteful and abundant. Was here for a conference and ate two straight days here so far! If you don't know what to get, try the skillets.

yzp9d9G5af4fEQAenkXMDA.text: If you're vegan and stopping in Vegas, this place is a must. The menu has a large selection of items. The decor on the inside is modern and bright. Portions are rather large so consider sharing if you aren't too hungry. We enjoyed the chicken and waffles, poutine, and the BBQ pulled pork sandwich. We also had the Flamingo smoothie, a must if you're grabbing breakfast. Don't miss out on this place!

photos.caption: Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States

caKM4JcqviMwsjFw37Z2cA.text: Great spot near the strip. Sooo many options. They are not all the most healthy meals ever, having lots of late night junk food craving fare, but there are some dank salads, too. Love that they are open late and have some gluten free options!

tGI1HFzOt4wvL1XiKVuEZw.text: Had to try the new talk of the town in the vegan Vegas community since I was in town this weekend! 1st off, don't get discouraged from the off the beaten path location because once you step through their doors, it's very visually appealing. A modern diner feel with lounge couches! I almost plopped on one after my meal! Speaking of meals, I ordered the popular vegan chicken & waffles. OMG, living in Cali has made me forget how big Vegas does it because I couldn't even finish the whole thing! The waffles were crispy on the outside & chewy inside, the chicken was thick & cooked to crispy perfection, in between the waffles were 2 strips of what looked & tasted live Veggie Life bacon, and they put a heaping scoop of mashed potatoes on the bottom, then drizzled maple syrup on top!  Will absolutely, definitely swing by again because their menu is huge & everything sounded tasty

j1rPWsN5oT9E6vIhv4ou4g.text: Absolutely amazing!!! Found this place after a long night on the strip and it met our expectations times 10!!! The bar was great and the food was amazing. Our waiter Scott was fantastic. I wish we had a place like this in Albuquerque.  A+++

_55bETlAd0GGZMqGcnubdw.text: I had high hopes.   The location was easy to find and easy to park.   The menu is huge, "we don't know what we specialize in" huge.  They were out of a lot of food when we went. The way that was presented to us was like this was already a norm.  An entree will run you $15.00 a plate.   Our server was not attentive whatsoever.. she seemed a little clueless, she took our order for coffee and food, someone else brought out our food, not at the same time but in reasonable enough time that it was ok but we never saw our server again until we waved her down for our bill 25 mins later where she returned and asked if we wanted to order more food..   I wanted ketchup, a refill on coffee, a spoon for my coffee, but I had almost eaten it all by then. But no I didn't want to order more food. Weird.   In the meantime, a manager, possibly owner or just a much more attentive server passed and asked if we wanted more coffee, and asked how our food was which gave us the opportunity to tell him that our experience wasnt too good. He asked if we had "asked" for any ketchup.. and to that I hope he realized that it was hard enough to finally get some more coffee.. no one was available in our direction and for half of our sitting, we believed someone would come eventually.  My burrito was cold with cold ingredients intentionally making it that temp. I could tell it was on purpose, cold beans, lettuce, lots of pico, a little bit of chkn but yet it was a cold burrito and therefore it should be called a WRAP. When I told the gentleman who worked there this he seemed surprised that it was cold and went and talked to the cook I think. When he came back he informed us that it was supposed to be cold. I had already come to this conclusion but my point is that it's weird to serve things that are generally hot , cold without fair warning.   Here's the thing, it's new.. it's working through glitches and growing pains. But the bad server with the nose ring and animated features, she's not doing this restaurants name any favor. The menu is too big and it's missing half the things anyway. For $15.00 the breakfast burrito doesn't hold up with any other vegan burrito in town. For $3.00 coffee please refill it at least once.. please offer a spoon and condiments when you bring the food.   This experience was just too bad.

ktiolxPztoKcgwxGv3JhOg.text: This place was delicious. I had the fried chicken with egg, bacon and waffles. It tasted like the real thing. I visit this place 4 times a year and it never disappoints.

dgr2o6sH-TxKoOZzNf5tVg.text: The BEST vegan restaurant I have ever been to! I fell in love with the chick'n and waffles! I loved it so much that I had it all 3 days when I visited Las Vegas. Definitely would recommend to any plant based eater

GaZBJcHtVjsttyFqPZGcFA.text: I never thought I would write one of those "I wish I could give this restaurant 0 stars" type of review to a vegan restaurant but here it goes.  I followed this restaurant on Instagram because of the infamous @Veganfatkid (follow him because his posts are great). Everything on their IG posts are mouthwatering and look amazing, especially the waffles!!! BUT, I had to remember that IG isn't reality therefore, in person I had a different experience than on-screen led me to believe.   Ambiance: Outside: shady and dark during the night... Inside: The restaurant itself is "TOO modern" for me and I'm 21 years old... but this is a biased statement due to my preferences being more rustic-modern vegan restaurant. The ambiance in the restaurant is stressful; white walls that have me uneasy LOL, white tables, and black and white everything... Anxiety ridden ambiance lol.   Service: I probably was the most disappointed because I'm in vegas for vacation and being that it is 100+ degrees outside you would think that the water would be ice cold... lol no. And no prompt refills. lol. Also, no waffles that night (the most exciting thing on the IG page to me). I wanted to try the vegan chickn and waffles and the gia, but no waffles. SAD. But, with an overwhelmingly large menu and zero help from the server I opted for a regular burger.   Food: The burger was good, but beyond meat patties are bomb, so anywhere this would be great, BUT not anything spectacular for the price. SAD. Fries cold, o-rings (underwhelming oil taste and no seasoning). Warning, do not try the pad-thai, skip altogether. Lots of sauce, too sweet and too salty and oily and no noodles all in one bite LOL.   Wanted to try dessert but the serving size was underwhelming for the price... SKIP.  Do not recommend for vegans, non-vegans, vegetarians in the LV area...

8Jlvi2EgJZWDSTdK5wVFGQ.text: The menu is large - many, many options.  The food is extremely edible.  I am not a vegan, not even a vegetarian - but some of my friends are.  We were visiting the Las Vegas area and found this gem.  We liked it so much, we went there 3 times - in 3 days!  I had the Frenchie - 3 large pieces of french toast smothered in fruit.  The first time it was perfect - just a little syrup, which is how I like it. When we wend back, I ordered it again and it was swimming in syrup - so you might want to ask for the syrup on the side.  Still good, I just don't care for soggy syrupy french toast.  I also tried the avocado toast - twice.  3 large pieces, one with tomato with avocado drizzle, asparagus with drizzle, and one with perfectly sliced avocado.  Again, the first order was perfection!  The second time we went back, while it tasted good, but was not presented as well as the first order and the toppings weren't as generous.  I also had the sweet potato fries, which were MANY, very good and satisfying.  My only critique is consistency.  Again, the menu has MANY selections, the restaurant is small-ish and well stocked with patrons.

cIP0ISCJ_81WQij3PMlBWQ.text: Not vegan and this place was amazing! I only give it 4 stars because we tried ordering two desserts and they were out of both.

Elf3PZX6dlZ8oqT9KkVPZA.text: I'm not a Vegan, but I love trying new places and different types of food. The moment I came in, I was greeted, seated and within seconds served water and was given a menu and asked about drinks. The lovely gentlemen gave me some pointers on the hit foods on the menu when I told him it was my first time here. I ordered the "Anna" waffle cause that's my name haha and OMG so good!!!

hUBEJyOt6aqOPtAuH54pWg.text: loololoveeee the buffalo chicken sandwhich amd their bullafo chicken wrap!!!!!! 10/10 vegan menu

K35ZqnDH6KRtYT9kRFGuCQ.text: Hip lil spot serving some amazing vegan food! I came for the chick'n and waffles. Unfortunately, their waffle maker broke so I ordered the Louisiana fried chick'n instead. This dish did not disappoint! The chick'n was super crispy and full of flavor with just hright amount of spice. Oohhhhh and the mushroom and sausage gravy is sooooo good! I highly recommend this spot

-yljnHUuwa4Wc-txmPn-0A.text: First let me start with saying we are not vegan and have never tried vegan food. Needless to say we didn't know what to expect. We always try a new place when in Vegas and this trip we went way out of our comfort zone and we are glad we did. The owners were there and were amazing at explaining the menu to us, made suggestions for us since we haven't tried vegan food and were so friendly and helpful. We had the jalapeno poppers for our appetizer, baked Mac and cheese and my husband had the pad Thai. We loved it all. Is there a difference, well in the mac and cheese yes I tasted a difference, but a good difference. My husband is not a mac and cheese fan, but liked this one a lot. My husband was surprised that it wasn't chicken on his plate.  Their drinks are delicious too. We tried Too pretty to work (which was our favorite) and sex on the plane which was great too.  The decor is modern and welcoming. Not far from the strip and vegan or not you should try this place. They have so many options, there is something for everyone.  Wish we had healthy options like this in more cities. A menu with a lot of variety, big portions, great food and drinks. They serve breakfast, lunch and dinner. Open late nights some days too.  We will be back on our next trip to try more of their options. We can't wait! Great Job Modern Vegan. You have made us fans!

6qD5kbuLRLq-p1V4Em5L7g.text: I was blown away by the extensive menu here! They have the classic comfort foods that taste exactly like the real thing (or I've just been vegan too long :P) but they also have some exciting new things to try as well! The staff was so friendly and gave us great recommendations. This is my new go to spot for whenever I am in town!

LPyKWkqWUWVcmrgQ_TyDAg.text: Hugh menu; fast friendly service.  Hand a tofu skillet and it was amazing.  Great breakfast, lunch and dinner option.

fU8yAOH4WiQVmqmv87pWsg.text: The Modern Vegan... more like The Modern  Disappointment. Terrible experience! No one greeted us when we entered. Finally after minutes of waiting we were greeted and taken to a table. Again it took forever for someone to come and take our drink orders. The cups were dirty and had to ask for another one. The spoons were dirty. The food was extremely greasy and the server was practically non existent. It's truly is sad that a vegan restaurant that should be amazing is this bad. Definitely will not return. Also the prices were ridiculously expensive, just for one burger, one gyro and one desert and 2 drinks it was $60.00. Again, more like the modern disappointment. Oi vei

_QlFFSOvTwjvDxkFCiJc_w.text: On a recent vacation to Vegas, finding good vegan food was important. The fact that we went to The Modern Vegan three times in less than 24 hours shows that we found what we were looking for. There are so many awesome aspects to this place that it kept us coming back again and again.   First, the service was beyond impressive. The first time we went, I ordered something that, quite honestly, I just didn't like. It's not that it was bad, because I'm sure it wasn't. It just had coleslaw on it (which I overlooked on the menu...totally my fault), and I get easily nauseated by the taste of it...ANY coleslaw. I explained to the server that I had made a mistake in ordering that plate and that I would like to order something else. I said I would gladly pay for the meal I didn't eat, seeing as it was no fault of theirs. The server (Jessica, I believe) cleared it with the manager, both of whom were very understanding and polite, and I had a different plate (the Pad Thai) in just a few short minutes...which, by the way, was probably the best vegan Pad Thai I've ever had. Furthermore, I was shocked that they didn't charge me for the meal I sent back, even though--again--it was no fault of their own. It's refreshing to come across friendly, thoughtful, and expedient service.   Additionally, The Modern Vegan offers tons of options...literally tons, because their serving sizes are as gigantic as their menu. Not only do they offer breakfast food around the clock (minus their abbreviated late night menu), you have a multitude of options for each meal. Whether you order breakfast at 10PM, dinner at 4AM, or lunch at 9PM, you'll find your plate filled to the brim with larger portions than I've seen literally anywhere else at a vegan restaurant. Two out of the three times we went, we had to take some back to the hotel with us. The portions were so large that you'd get about half way through before you started feeling like a bear shot in the ass with a tranquilizer. You don't stop eating when you're full; you stop when you hate yourself. But it's totally worth it.  As far as price, yes, I know it looks a little above average on the surface. But once you see just how much food you're getting, you'll understand that you are getting far more bang for your buck.   The decor of the place is nice, and I wish they'd set up a shop here in Orange County, CA. Not only would they do VERY well, the chic modern decor would fit in well, too.  I wanted to specifically mention two people before this review is over: Jessica (the server mentioned before) and whoever the manager there is (burly guy with a beard and nose ring). While we interacted with a few other servers there during our three visits, these two were FAR above par. They were friendly, down-to-earth, hilarious, polite, expedient, and made us feel more than welcome every time we went.   We plan on going back to Vegas again soon, and I can say with confidence that we will be eating at The Modern Vegan.

RhiA7yIqa19Hot8CBh3GTA.text: I would give this place 0 stars if possible. I really wanted to like it because I am vegan and actively support every vegan restaurant I can. The food was poorly executed. There were 3 people in our party.. meals came out separately about 10 minutes apart. On top of that, the food was cold. When I tried to explain my dissatisfaction, the owner attacked me personally and made rude remarks. Our server Missy was great but the owner was a total A-hole! I am sure if you look at the owner's low class responses to critical reviews, you will look for other vegan restaurants to support. There are many great vegan restaurants worthy of support but this is definitely not one I would recommend.

tHVn_ACmOSDDmjxs_Hz4Xg.text: Amazing!!! The best vegan food I've ever had! Their chick'n and waffles were awesome and the portions are really big so you could probably share share one dish with another person.

LuCyWuhcrUXWXTvvNB4UIQ.text: Had the amazing EVeg My new favorite breakfast spot. Service was excellent!!!! I have one foot on vegetarian and the other on Vegan.  After this experience Vegan it is!

BkjBg-hqurpnC2ODjPs8Cg.text: I didn't dine in, because I got delivery (Thanks to Postmates) so I cannot say much about atmosphere. I ordered the Reuben and it was pretty good! If you order it , I recommend asking for light on the oil/butter/whatever they use to make the sandwich.  It was slightly too oily/greasy for my taste as the bread was basically soaked in some sort of vegan butter. Texture wise it was spot on, sauerkraut was really really delicious, sauce was bomb as well. I'll definitely have to try some other stuff, hopefully something less greasy/oily. The fries that came with it were surprisingly not greasy at all and were fresh! Their menu is huge and definitely the largest vegan menu I've seen in Vegas. What makes them unique is their options, they have a lot of vegan versions of "normal" dishes! Looking forward to trying their other dishes and dining in when I get the chance.

043JwGkQEyJIxUS6gm8_eg.text: The food was delicious and there are a ton of options. The GM and wait staff are incredible. Great service! Will definitely come back when in Vegas.

Jcq1xZZTqDQeIQyqzPH3pA.text: Best Vegan food I've ever had, even my non vegan friends love this place! The club Sandwich is insane, Scrambled Tofu and Potatoes on the side is a great breakfast, French Toast is amazing! Neighborhood is a little sketchy I'd say (everyone I know wish it was in a better location, Henderson/Summerlin that way we could go every day). Staff is super friendly and there is actually nothing bad about this restaurant, hope it ends up being everywhere down the line!

p6B1Gq0_vm_uXQJRLQGvXw.text: The restaurant never answers the phone. Dont know what kind of business or customer service that is. Must have called 10 times before someone picked up the phone to place my order. The food is over priced and doesnt taste that good. Adding some salt wouldnt hurt anyone. Would NOT recommend.

tj9Ag5590vKYOXUUH5vi1w.text: do not come here! i waited an hour for my food! one hour!!!!!! horrible service! when i asked why it was taking so long the server shrugged her shoulders and said she didn't know. worst experience! horrible horrible horrible

5uafRUqvC70X96APqXi7yg.text: This is the first time I've left a Yelp review. I don't typically feel like I have to express my dining experience typically. If it's a good experience? Great, I move on and even if it's bad, fine...I move on and never visit again. And yet, here I find myself wanting very much to beware future diners.   I was visiting town with my brother and his partner and we were quite excited to try this place. Food photos look amazing and we were pretty hungry. All vegan? Yes!!!   What we ordered:   Corn dogs for appetizers The Buffalo Chicken sandwich  The Gyro with fries  The Banh Mi with salad  1. The corn dogs came in 10 minutes. They were yummy. Feeling good about this place. 2. My brother's partner got his fish first - The Buffalo Chicken sandwich.  3. You guys, I'm not exaggerating when I say, it literally took 40 minutes before myself or my brother got our dishes. My brother in law refused to eat his Buffalo Chicken sandwich until we had gotten our food. So his sandwich sat there getting cold for FORTY MINUTES.   I feel like the Kitchen forgot our orders bc the waiter asked what we ordered 20 minutes after we ordered our food originally. We ordered sweet fries while we were waiting for our regular food items bc we were so hungry. We also noticed the table of four to the right of us had the same experience. One woman there ordered noodles and the other three people did. It get their dishes from the kitchen for another 30 minutes. They were eating off of her plate as well bc they were also hungry, I'm sure.   Here's the kicker. Maybe I would of just chalked this up to "new restaurant/new kitchen kinks" to work out. I understand those things, I can overlook things but what really made me want to write this undoubtedly is the lack of acknowledgement of what we were experiencing as diners. There was a bald guy with glasses (not our server) who blamed us for not knowing that the Kitchen there was a "Free Flowing Kitchen". "Oh! No one told you this was a free flowing kitchen??!!", is what his response was when we mentioned that we had waited 40 minutes between meals. "Yea, we serve dishes as they're ready." This same guy there also said to me as he was collecting our plates, "See? Doesn't the food taste better when you have to wait for it??"   I couldn't believe this guy. True blue Vegas bullshitter this guys was. I couldn't even look him in the eye after he asked that absurd question. Our actual waiter was nice and apologized for the wait and we tipped him in cash but I would warn anyone looking to try this place beware...you might just be there a lot longer than planned . I mean, it was unforgivable. We basically ordered three sandwiches and sides and then that guy with his "free flowing kitchen" talk. Gimme a friggin break.   Never going back.

ulKlHza3MSDtSL2_K_Ft8A.text: This restaurant popped up on my yelp feed, I was so excited to try it! The pictures looked on point, reviews looked good and so we decided to drive out of our way to check it out.   The location is definitely not the safest, I wouldn't suggest going at night. Upon walking in there's a sleek and clean vibe with music playing a little too loud for regular conversation. We where sat immediately, which was nice.   There was no napkin or utensils set up at our table, after ordering the first dish arrived. Cauliflower wings with French fries, we had ordered sauce on the side.   We asked for utensils but none arrived for some time, the second dish was the salad with a honey vinaigrette...it was honey mustard. Not very good at all. We still have no utensils at this point we are starving, the food is cold and we have hit savage level... munching with our hands!  We asked for Fiji bottles water, they finally brought over a karaf of ice water... needless to say we where ready to leave and just asked to cancel the Fiji water.   The food just wasn't flavorful but most of all they haven't gotten the service aspect down yet. I hope with time this place becomes a vegan gem but as of today I would not go back.

Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States

MAttInXyc07Z06nmOMHq2g.text: We enjoyed most of our visits, however they do tend to run out of items frequently. We went three times in one week during a recent vacation, and they ran out of several deserts and a few mail menu items even though a truck came with new food in the middle of the week. Still, we mostly enjoyed our food.   The menu is large, so there are many selection options. The salsa tastes like Pace out of a jar, and the cheese sauce (not really queso) tastes better with the meatless meat added.   By far, the desserts are the saving grace of the whole place! I'd go back even just for their dessert.

_iA1GEga8WOMEm2OqnCv8A.text: Awesome.   Huge menu Full bar  Very very satisfied!!!!!  Tried to leave my sons number for Kylie but he kept taking my notes from the bar tab wallet dang hmu I'll send it to you.

HYJ8trCzkW1qROXJqPeEgg.text: TMV is such a GEM. Too bad it's a drive from the strip...  First of all... I love the black and white decor, really modern, really friendly and able to accommodate large groups.   I went with a non vegan group of black folks, so you know we were side-eyein the southern staples.   I got the Louisiana Fried Chicken with mash potatoes and gravy with a side of coleslaw.   The Fried "chicken" was absolutely amazing, the texture and fry batter was shockingly familiar. Mash potatoes... golden and buttery, the coleslaw was super salty and honestly my least favorite part of the meal.   My homie also got "Fish" Tacos, which she said were BOMB. It's crazy how many different types of cuisine they have coming outta one spot.   Rarely am I rushing to go places that sell Italian and Sushi at the same time. But you can't beat 100% plant based eating. That's what I like to call good eats.

photos.caption: Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Louisiana Fried Chicken
Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy

oXmNawrivEN1Tvl3Qfhxzw.text: Would have been more stars but my return trip was terrible!  I came in one evening for dinner and through the service was a touch slow it was pleasant and the food was pretty good.    The following day, August 9th, I returned with friends for lunch. We arrived and there were about 8 open tables. We, as well as 3 other separate parties stood at the front door without being greeted. We all just kind of stood there waiting for some kind of acknowledgement the bartender and both servers would walk by and actively not have eye contact. I couldn't believe this was the same place I was the evening before. After about 10 min one of my friends went to ask the bartender if we were going to be greeted and we were told we would not be seated for about 40 min because the kitchen was backed up. If the kitchen can't handle a load then maybe the menu should be dialed back to a load that can be managed. The service staff literally let us stand there and not speak to or acknowledge us.  We left after 15 min of standing there with no real acknowledgement.   This is not how a guest should ever be be treated.  Had any of them just come up and greeted us and explained what was happening we could have either decided to wait it out or leave. What had happened was the staff let about 9 people stand packed in the doorway acting like we didn't exist.   Supper disappointing after my first visit was fine.

K47A4-AwsqMOQqu5X2tatQ.text: First of all, thank you for existing! It was such a great feeling knowing I didn't have to pick my way through the menu to find something I can eat. I got the spaghetti and meatballs and it was DELICIOUS. The meatballs were just perfect! My mom got the chick'n and waffles and to my surprise she loved the combo. I did go with my father and brother who are particular closed off to meat substitutes and anything vegan. Because of this they found it hard to find something to eat, but they both ended up getting food that they tolerated. My advice- don't bring people who don't want to try meat substitutes or anything "vegan". My brother got the nachos and they were fantastic, and the taco meat was delicious. I WOULD recommend the bottomless mimosas, they bring them out to you at the perfect time! And the mermaid mimosa... AMAZING.  Basically I loved this place and if I could, I'd eat there every day. The servers are friendly and you get food fast!

Z8sfNPgpVNboopMdbDaD8Q.text: Extensive menu of comfort food that just happens to be vegan.....and DELICIOUS! Be warned though, the portions are generous but can be boxed up if you can't finish them.  Vegan food coma paradise!

kwSeQdBYD1VneRs7QF5mBA.text: WOWOWOWOWOWOW!! I've heard about this place and was so excited to try the moment we landed in Vegas. We didn't even check in to our hotel because I was so hungry and excited to get over and try! The drinks were beautiful and very good. The service was awesome, the food came out quickly.   The menu is overwhelming, I was blown away by all the incredible sounding vegan options at my fingertips! It was very hard to decide what to eat but we finally accomplished the task. I ordered the lobster roll, it was unreal. The texture of the lobster was almost identical to the real thing, the magic sauce they use is the perfect compliment to the meat. The fries were fresh and tasty. The meatball sub was very good as well. Everyone in our party, vegan and none loved their food. I will absolutely return to this spot on my future trips to Las Vegas!
