MBdQx_48NhGR1B0GSQ597w.text: My bf and I were in town visiting before our half marathon last weekend and this place was easy to find. When we came through the door it took about 10 minutes for someone to notice and seat us. My bf ordered a beyond beef burger and I ordered the breakfast burrito. Our waiter was pretty great but we could tell that this place doesn't use team work.   There were times throughout our meal that we would need something white our waiter would be busy and the other waitress would walk pass with her head down, careful to not make eye contact with us so that she wouldn't have to help us. She was dressed  minimally so maybe she was only going to tend to the tables that were mostly men. Which is what she did. Anyway, our food was good but just wish we could of had more attentive service. Our waiter did the best he could. When you work in a place like this you have to have good team working skills or the place will fall apart.   I also had left overs, I had only eaten one half of my wrap. I asked for it to be re-wrapped before I left because it wasn't wrapped well to begin with. The waiter brought it back in a to-go box but it hadn't been re-wrapped at all. Just dumped in a to-go box.

hYyPbDGZ-0eJEXA3gfhO5Q.text: Mondays the menu is a Vegan-Raw menu. Tuesdays is taco Tuesday I believe and the rest of the week they have the full regular menu. I went on a Monday and had the avocado bruschetta which was amazing, and the cauliflower rice. Both were full of flavor and way better then I was expecting. If you've never had raw food before it's a good place to try. It's one of the better places I've been. The food wasn't to "earthy" like I've had at other places.  I'd definitely go back and order both dishes again! The staff was very nice and I was surprised that my bill was under $20 for two items! I had to take some home the portions were so big!

CgpK3haX6T0NwRDQGmnqlQ.text: I had just come off a 3 day binge of Cafe Gratitude in LA where I had eaten everyday and then my first night in Las Vegas I decided The Modern Vegan instead of my staple Vegenation.  Location was a $10 Uber ride from my hotel. Windows are all blacked out. As I opened the doors I questioned myself if I was entering a billiards hall. It was loud. Too loud. Many TVs all playing different channels. Bare decor. That's fine, it's about the food right?  I ordered the truffle mushroom soup, a glass of wine, and the corn dogs. I had seen the corn dogs on the yelp photos and decided I'd do that. Then I ordered the lobster roll- same reasoning. What other vegan places have a lobster roll? Let's try it!  First baddy- my waiter/bartender came back and told me there was no soup. Ok. Oh wait, none. That they ran out. Of all of them. And I'm a soup person. Ok I won't replace it.  Then my lobster roll comes out. Before my corn dogs I ordered first? Which were an appetizer? No condiments for the fries offered.  The roll was OK. Forgettable. I can do this better at home with some mayo jackfruit onions and some Maywah seafood slices from china town.  Then I asked if I had ordered the corn dogs. I did. Phew.  They came out. I was finally offered water. Right?!  The corn dogs were insane. Insanely bad. I peeled off the batter. It was thin and extremely greasy. This was not a cornbread corn dog. This was a battered dog. A "baddered dog" one might say. I felt like I got sick.  I like soup didn't get it, I also like dessert so I was willing to try. I ordered the trio of cheesecakes. Strawberry, chocolate and blueberry.  I LAUGHED. I texted my husband and laughed. This was not three different cheesecakes. This was the same cheesecake cut into three slices with different toppings. Different toppings like a small dollop of peanut butter. I didn't finish this either.  Now let me be honest- I absolutely support and love vegan places. I've been vegan for 17 years. But just making something to have options? No. It's 2018. Quality over quantity. And atmosphere man. This place had me looking around constantly being like...who decorated? Who signed off? WHO NAILED THE FAKE GRASS UNDERNEATH THE BAR?!   If you're vegan and want some out of the norm options I'm sure this place has perked your curiosity- but if you've been anywhere else in the world of vegan establishments this place falls short.   Sorry. But really, I should have gone somewhere else but I'm glad I checked it off my list.

KEHBpCEGLM1Un6ubZ62wGg.text: Definitely agree with most of the reviews here on their poor customer service...   Came here on a Saturday with my mom & fiance for lunch with the excitement to finally try their famous chik'n & waffles and thankfully were seated right away despite how busy and filled up it was.  The menu is massive - heads up you'll take a good couple minutes trying to figure out what you want especially since everything sounded amazing! We decided to go for the chik'n & waffles, the vegan lobster roll, & a side of the baked mac n cheese.   After the server took our order, we basically didn't see her until the end of our meal. We had to ask more than one server/busser that passed by our table when we needed something and it would take almost 10 minutes for them to even come back.   The food was just okay, especially for the price. The only good thing about the chik'n & waffles was the waffles; the breading on the chicken was falling apart and everything was just too sweet. The vegan lobster roll was wayyy too sour and I had wish it was a little warm, I felt like I was just eating cole slaw and bread. The best thing we had was the Mac  n cheese & it was only a small side portion - definitely recommend getting the full-sized entree.   Overall, our first time experience was okay. Not sure if we'll be back but definitely a good place to try out if you're vibing some vegan comfort food next to UNLV.

LP_d8Vo_011B85Cx3SFbYg.text: The food was fine. The service was terrible. We ordered through grubhub and we did not get our entire order. I did not immediately realize this so we didn't ask the grubhub delivery person about it. When I did realize, I called the number the restaurant has listed on yelp and on my order receipt. I called 4 times with no one ever answering the phone. The voicemail box also said it was full.   We visited the restaurant in person as well and they said the reason we didn't get our order was because they were out of the item we ordered. If you're out of something, then tell us and give us the chance to order something else instead of letting one of our friends go hungry. That was so rude. Why didn't someone contact us? In addition, they said they don't have a phone right now. What?! It rang each time and is listed on their page. They just choose not to answer it and that is different.  This business needs to communicate 1000% better with customers. Grubhub gave us a refund for the item but TMV was not very apologetic or interested in our business. The customary thing to do is offer a free item for our troubles. Our morning breakfast plans on our vacation were ruined because of their service. The least they could do is give us something for free.  BE WARNED: If you try to call this business they will not answer. I guess there's not enough vegan restaurants around for them to be competitive. They don't care about offering good service even though you're paying them $18 an entree.  We will not be back unless something drastically changes about their management style.

1SGv4LcKWUmEAXVdFSDcmA.text: I have had several meals from this place. I would have to say my favorite so far is the Louisiana fried chicken and my least favorite would be the corn dogs. I have read other reviews that state the food here is salty and I have to agree. They could cut back a little on the salt. That being said, the food is still yummy. Another favorite of mine is the lobster roll. I look forward to trying other meals here but if there's one suggestion I could make, it would be to cut back on the salt please. I am so happy that there is a vegan restaurant with so many options. Thank you for this vegan restaurant!  I have a new review for this restaurant. This is the first time I've ever experienced dining in this restaurant since I've always had take out. This time I brought my two girlfriends. The service was hardly desirable. Our meals came separately approximately 10 to 20 minutes apart from each other. The water tasted horrible and to even get a refill took forever. I was a little embarrassed that I recommended this place to my friends. I'm sure they will never come back. I will probably come back for takeout but like I said earlier the food that I have ordered here is very salty. But not unedible and it is still tasty in spite of the salt. I do hope they cut back on the salt, improve their service and water taste. I feel the water is not filtered by the way it tasted. Thank you modern vegan for trying! There could be improvements but not all is lost. You always have a chance to do better. Maybe I can convince my girlfriends to give it one more try.

nj2f1YHuJsCWcaVgqtFPhw.text: So good! Great service, clean, cute inside- and best vegan food! Can't wait to come back!!

Being vegetarian myself for 2 years, this chick'n salad sandwich was THE BEST. I felt like I was eating chicken again, but no animals harmed!!!! I've missed chick'n salad so much. The chick'n n waffles plate is ginormous and satisfying to no end. The folks who work there are great people too!  Can't wait to visit again!!!!  This place is a must go!

2PnhJrEbwva-jvTFkNPjSA.text: If I have to sum up the restaurant in one sentence, it is a slightly overpriced place that serves delicious comfort-food style vegan dishes, and A LOT of them.   The menu is HUGE. However, if you dive into it, you'll find familiarity in each item, and it becomes less daunting. Imagine a PT's (or a Gold Sierra's) menu, and substitute the protein and cheese in those sandwiches, burgers, and appetizers with vegan meat and vegan cheese.   We ordered the Queso Dip, mac&cheese, the lobster roll and the buffalo chicken burger. It was amazing to think that none of these dishes were made from animal protein. The seasoning and creative usage of different types of veggies alone brought out layers of flavors. The reason for 1 less star was 1) the price. I know eating Vegan is a little more expensive, but everything can be about $2-$3 less on the menu, and will keep me on the hook to go back on a weekly basis; 2) the fine details. If I were to pay that price, I expected a little bit more refinement in each dish (talking about presentation, garnish, final touches, etc.)  Is this a place to eat super healthy (think Panacea) ? Probably not. But is this the place to satisfy your cravings and convince your meat-eating friends (or yourself) that vegan doesn't mean bland food? Absolutely!

ciHojbk8wOhDD_xfYTM6Ig.text: Absolutely love this place!! Unbelievable!! We were in Vegas for a couple of days, and ate only here for our breakfast, lunch and dinner. We had no desire to check out other vegan places, because TMV has everything we could possibly want, juices, sodas, burgers, fries, pasta, bowls, desserts, etc. etc. The prices are very reasonable, the menu is expansive, and the portions are enormous! I highly recommend the "chicken" and waffles, and spaghetti!! (holy crap!!). I'm telling you, this place would turn a meat eater vegan!! The only problem with TMV is that there aren't more of them!! Seriously, check it out when you're in Vegas,or make a special trip just to check it out. You'll be glad you did!!

7r0iswFLCwp7lg-GxG24Ng.text: I stopped in to check this place out. I dont even know what vegan food is. A few years ago I built out this space and operated a bar here. 4_OqSLw6OpX2WtVS1no_iQ.text: We showed up around 1030 to order some food to go and while we were waiting to order, there was another customer at the bar recording a 30 minute long review vlog video or whatever it was. During that 30 minutes that we were sitting there ordering/waiting for our food, this other customer was recording herself ask the waitress/bartender, Rachel, if there was soy product in pretty much every item on the menu. Not only was the woman being extremely disrespectful towards Rachel and the restaurant in general, but she waited until about 10:55 to place her final order, mind you the restaurant closes at 11. This womans "job" is to review restaurants, but she wasn't really reviewing it, more like bashing everything on the menu. We just wanted to say great job to Rachel for staying extremely professional and pleasantly friendly throughout that process. Secretly we all hope that lady never comes back to The Modern Vegan, but hopefully this woman and all 35 of her ig vlog followers give The Modern Vegan another chance ;)  Good job Rachel! You're a beast! Keep spreading peace and love to all, even the ones that don't return it   Sincerely,  Happy returning customers,  Stacey  and Cody

LypAZpVFZW1tg5jwoA_jhw.text: This place is fantastic!  My husband and I came back to Las Vegas for our anniversary and we were staying on the strip. J-U0Z7C76O0YvMCKl2RaUg.text: The food is good for the most part. The housemade cheese is good especially in the jalapeno poppers. But I feel really bad for the staff especially the manager (I'm assuming manager) wearing an ankle brace that I have seen doing multiple jobs. The menu is way too big for staff to manage and customers to wrap their minds around. The owner might need to take some restaurant management classes. It's a long wait to be seated and to be served our food. There is no hostess so customers walk in confused of how or if they sign in. An employee randomly comes by and just grabs who she has seen waiting the longest. I don't blame her as I see her juggle the whole restaurant that's being sabotaged by a menu way too big. P.S. I was told I couldn't replace my fries for carrots. Carrots are super cheap.

Yq2yjxqt_a6vpw70dX2G3w.text: Holy Moly!! Service was AMAZING and the food is incredible! My sister is 100% vegan, I prefer mostly vegan items... the food blew us both away! We shared the popcorn chicken- their signature sauce its served with for dipping is perfect! We also shared the all American burger- basically a bacon cheeseburger with onion rings. We wished we could've eaten more because we had a big wishlist of items to try!  Our server was very knowledgeable and friendly. The crowd is very eclectic, everyone seemed happy and friendly. This will definitely be a regular spot for us!!

-FWux1obQcYacKWxhWbzjQ.text: I came here after I heard they opened, I thought it'd give it a try. I'm glad I did because I was not disappointed. I've been to many vegan places and I usually always order their nachos with cheese but the modern vegan left me surprised their dish. It was very different from what I've tried, the meal finger licking good and I also had a taste of my friends poutine and it tasted just like the original poutine. Their staff was also extremely friendly and their restaurant is totally meant for all those foodies snapping pictures of their food. They have amazing lighting! 10/10 recommend.

7vsOKy47ejqtrR6WtwoK3g.text: UPDATE: just decided to go back today and waited maybe 10 min tops for our food. It's absolutely delicious I'm so glad we went back!! Definitely try the biscuits and gravy.   When a place first opens it's always expected there's going to be some issues, but waiting 2 hours for food is absurd...so is being told they ran out food not once but 3 times.......and so is waiting 30 minutes to get the check. The food is good but not worth the wait or the price...I'll come back MAYBE when things are running a lot smoother.  One other thing...we ordered a burger after the 3 other things we wanted were gone, and waited 45 minutes for it, but by that time they were closing and instead of giving me the food that I wanted, they took it off the check without letting us know and sent us away. Train your staff.

1-AbyewHNwl70FwhpUvZfA.text: I eat mainly vegetarian / vegan and usually make all of my own meals. The few times I ordered lunchtime delivery the past few months, I decided on TMV! First, I tried the Louisiana Fried Chicken and the Mac 'n Cheese Balls (that were literally the size of baseballs!). Both dishes were delicious and HUGE portions. Today I decided on the Baked Mac 'n Cheese side and the Buddha Bowl. Again, enough for both lunch AND dinner. I love their diverse menu ... it will definitely be my go-to when I need some good Las Vegan comfort food!

F91WzC3MDrjyTxB7tIGSiw.text: The food here comes in ridiculous portions and is just plain amazing. As a vegan it's always the most fun to go to a restaurant and know that you can get anything on it, as a result I pigged out. Favorites include the BBQ sandwich and the Queen burger. Great service, great atmosphere. Also quite close to the airport for a meal before/after flying in/out. Can't wait to go back!!

gvb9IlwoFXIKgWNHCfbHcQ.text: I came here during my trip to Vegas for breakfast and dinner on separate occasions. This place is delicious. They have comfort food and mimosas with passion fruit which are so great they need they're own review. The chick'n and waffles plate is amazing and they're Mac and cheese balls are a must. I will be coming back every time I return to Vegas.

yMyKE307jCseqMcNhgq3Bw.text: I'm a California vegan, been up and down the state eating at vegan restaurants and nothing compares to TMV. Gina (owner) really knows who she is catering to, vegans who want savory comfort food. And for those who are skeptics, I came here with a meat eater, and he was truly impressed. We ordered the Louisiana fried chicken and the Reuben. We actually came back a second time because it was too good not to, we ordered burgers, I don't remember which ones, but it doesn't matter everything was delicious. Pluuus the service was amazing, we didn't wait long for our food. I really hope Gina opens a location in SoCal because TMV is the new standard.

photos.caption: Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gina, the fabulous owner of TMV, super nice and humored me with a picture. I can&#39;t wait to comeback!!

Q4PHacNpPoPYk2P69KwKZQ.text: It is hard to leave a moderate review when the food is really good, but the service sucks.  If you are going to offer "starters"  that is what they are.  We ordered avocado toast starters and 2 entrees, my entree came out first, when I questioned about the starter we wanted to share, the response " we are a free flow kitchen"  my partners entree came with the starter about 5 to 8 minutes later when I was more than half finished.  So what do I do finish my entree and let the starter get cold, or finish my entree and let the starter get cold.  Does my partner eat the starter, and let his entree get cold?  these are not the choices I thought I would have to make.  Great tasting food, stupid service.

QRqaDJJwapb9OuGLBpwVlQ.text: This was my first stop off the plane on Friday 9/28/18. The staff was amazing, friendly and very accommodating! The chick'n & waffles were amazing! The mashed potatoes were good but lacked salt. Fast forward to Saturday morning 9/29 (My Birthday) - we walked in with coffee and before we were greeted we were told outside food wasn't allowed - but we weren't told that the day before. Whatever take the coffee they were almost empty anyway. We order 3 different meals the BLAT, MAC & Cheese Balls & PB Delight. Everything was fantastic!!!!  We were given plates that were not larger then a slice of toast... When we asked for larger plates the waitress responds "Let me see if we have any" I'm sorry do you not normally have plates in a sit down to eat establishment? Anyway as we were brought back 2 plates we noticed they were dirty.. When asked for new clean plates we watched the waitress go over to the kitchen window to wipe them off - not wash them or get new plates... When asked for a new plate she takes it back to the window and we watch her and the owner & cook inspect the plate looking at the dried up old food and laugh & joke about it. Really???? This is how you treat your paying customers? Despite the good food; the lack of customer service received makes this a No for me in the future!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3joBOVQzIJQiEf5N96a6yg.text: I love this place! Seriously the BESSSSST buffalo chicken sandwhich I've EVER had In my entire life. Including before i went vegan lol. Omg so good!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best buffalo &#34;chickn&#34; sandwich ever!

qBqOjNdHV14FmMPQ060YSQ.text: Gia, I look forward to coming back to the Modern Vegan. I know what you are going through, been there before.  Like I said before  you are going to be a hidden gem. You are on your way.!!!!

JEZFO1eqoyxsCvCBQBDEwA.text: This place is amazing! Everyone who works here is friendly, helpful, and attentive. The food is delicious, the portions are satisfying, and the selection is overwhelming! One of the employees recommended the buffalo chicken sandwich. It was perfection! I also had a strawberry shake with banana,  which was a perfect sweet end to the meal.  I will be coming back!

gcqixqb-JIGHfUgn0_qcpQ.text: I had biscuits & gravy with mash potatoes. My friend had chicken & walffles. Portions were huge! Service was super friendly. Food coming out was a little slow but they were busy & the server apologized before hand. I would definitely go back!

ntxH2KFi4bqDSjtvlegmGA.text: First- the staff was the REALEST. Calm. Cool. Collected. Honest recommendations, attentive yet respectful of space.  Second- the food was absolutely stunning. The chicken and waffles was one of the best meals I've ever had. We also go the Mac n cheese balls which were a lot bigger than expected! Ending with I love you for dessert and our group ate it all under 2 minutes.   Overall Amazing. Must go for plant based dieters and meat heads alike.

349E06LJKZ-tlUhnafD1TQ.text: Came here with a friend since he highly recommended the food. We ordered the fried chkn' and a burger with "egg.". The food was pretty amazing.  The service, however.  The server didn't bring out our order together.   I had my food at least 15 minutes before my friend.  I had lemonade and she refilled it with water. My friend is a server in the food industry and was just listing off the mistakes she made.     It would really benefit the business for the servers to learn about customer service.  Especially since your a vegan restaurant!!!    Treating the customers well will ensure the longevity of the business.

ugg59FSTVIXI4W-KcKF_rA.text: Yummy brunch! I had the chicken & waffles, which was extremely filling and tasted great. I bet their chicken sandwiches/burgers are amazing too, if made with that same fried chicken patty. My husband got the biscuits & gravy, which tasted pretty good but was not as filling as my dish.  The service was spectacular. My mom is the least spice tolerant person ever and they changed out her order of pad thai (which we confirmed was not spicy prior to ordering it, but it came with hot peppers) right away.   VeganFatKid was having brunch while we were there by the way, which goes to show how good it is :) Def will come back.

U7w7QISq_oUGce8qdTJvKQ.text: Im not a vegan but my girlfriend is, so I've eaten at every vegan place in vegas. This is by far the best vegan place in vegas!! Their menu selection is the biggest selection I'm ever seen in a vegan restaurant. The food is excellent and the service was fast and friendly. I loved it! I'll definitely  come back!!

NTZzcsOUvDcCsCeTmF78Vw.text: Food is amazing one of my favorite vegan restaurants in Vegas so many options we eat there every time we go to Vegas keep up the good work

pGZB042yNr82c-4eBW6IQg.text: I went to the modern vegan with my daughter on Friday, March 16th at 1pm. When we got there we were greeted promptly and sat quickly.  Our waiters, Kim,  greeted us and asked for our drink order. There was no juicer and so no way to make any of the juices and for some reason no way to make the smoothies. So we got water and my daughter got a sprite. The sprite came in a can which I hate cause that means you pay per drink.  They should have a soda machine because the meal is already so pricey.  The water had a funny taste to it and we sent it back. I had Kim bring me another one but it still tasted funny. Also there was a huge list of foods they were our of. My daughter wanted the pulled pork sliders but they couldn't make them without the mayo and so she got the spaghetti and meatballs. It seemed a little small to me but the sauce tasted great and was had lots of veggies on it which I love. I ordered the v'eggs Benny which was wonderful. And the asparagus that came with it were great as were the mashed potatoes that my daughter ate half of. Alao we ordered the cauliflower wings with a medium aauce which came with fries.  Both were very tasty and i loved the breading on the cauliflower. Kim checked on us often and brought extra napkins,  salt and pepper. I ordered a 2nd sprite due to the water issue.  Then at the end alot of the desserts I wanted to try were also out. But my daughter was full so we left without. We paid $60 which is a hefty price for 2 people but we loved the food so we'll be back. I hope they get the water to taste better,  get in everything they ran out of and allow for more modifications I'm the future.  Overall though great job and we love you!!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grass wall
Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Decor
Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Decor

x30FP8tRvn3WJ8Q03ge-5A.text: The menu is extensive which is awesome but food that I ordered was mostly just ok and wait was crazy. Between waiting for a seat and waiting for our food, we spent 2 hours there.    People who came in after us got their orders first, one table ordered two of the exact same items I did. One of those items we were told was sold out but the other table was able to grab the last two. Felt like there's probably an issue with communication and timing between the front of house and back of house staff.   I ordered the Louisiana fried chicken. The chicken was good and tasted pretty realistic although I had hoped for more chicken. The entree included a large serving of coleslaw but it was pretty light on the dressing. The mashed potatoes had a coconut flavor which I didn't care for; I'd suggest they switch to using more neutral plant milks and creams for such items. Gravy was ok. Mac and cheese side was again, ok. My mom ordered the Philly cheesesteak which was pretty good. Fries not bad and was a large serving, but slightly mushy.  I went opening weekend though so I expected slow service and some kinks to be worked out. I'll be happy to try again in a few weeks.  I was happy the owner's husband asked us how we enjoyed the meal. I hope they learn a lot from opening weekend and can get the kinks worked out soon. Overall just happy there's another vegan restaurant in Las Vegas!

QqjjDg-7SVB4euSKpu8zDA.text: It's pretty good but very pricey for what it is. It's still new so there a few kinks that need to be worked out but overall it was a nice and enjoyably decent experience. Hopefully it stays open but I doubt the area it's located in can support a vegan restaurant at this price point. The real test for longetivity will be if it can get through the summer when UNLV isn't in session.

uE4bZi6Zai_pGlYDefwY4A.text: We were visiting Vegas and had recently gone Vegan! We were so happy to find The Modern Vegan! Only open 4 weeks when we were there and the food/Service were awesome! Great find!

0dHeJ-4fWV8O7j4h9P5row.text: Very good and what I loved the most is the energy and happiness of the employees. Cauliflower buffalo tenders freaking amazingly

fc9PWr3hV4ICy0-xWiMy3w.text: Great  truffle soup but they close at 6pm. Yvette was fantastic and seated us anyways.

photos.caption: Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. TMV menu

1Skuhr4_IY1APl478uMADg.text: I love this place because its all Vegan, has a massive menu with something for everyone, has excellent service, friendly staff and is clean.  Wish they were also on the west side of town. Keep up the great work!

NFMgNTd4tkCggsxaFse2sw.text: This place just opened so there's always room for improvement... a lot of the dishes that we picked they didn't have some of the sides so we ended up not trying them..food was very well presented and obviously tasted good. Their variety of dishes was very impressive. The only downside is the wait time... expect about 20-30min on seating and another 20-30 on the actual food. If kitchen staff grows then maybe I'll come back.

MKrYaUKf-xoreKLFlsDo_g.text: First time coming to this place! I'm not vegan but came with a friend who is. The food was incredible! Rich flavors and cooked to perfection! We had the putine fries, Philly cheesesteak and fish tacos! The fish tacos were the best! The crema and sauce were to die for and the taco tasted like actual fish! The price is worth what you get! Definitely would recommend to locals, or anyone visiting the Vegas strip, as well as UNLV college students, you won't regret it! Yvette (the owner) came to our table and greeted us as we were eating and she was bubbly and filled with life, and asked our names to get to know us more! Very thoughtful as well!

photos.caption: Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Bb5fgNP6zDrFqUKfaXLOnw.text: It's so hard to find a place that offers the variety of vegan breakfast dishes. We had the chicken and waffles, eggs benedict, french toast and the gia waffles, which were my favorite. Beautiful decor and wonderful staff. Lots of parking. We'll definitely be back

UNYqic63xSY_14t5E_QK9Q.text: Amazing Spot. It is NEW and everything is made FRESH so be patient about how long the food takes but It is WELL WORTH the wait.

NXQoxKi9uR5RiTiaas21xA.text: If I come back to Vegas it will be to eat here again. Highly recommend eating here vegan or not. I had the buffalo chicken sandwich and it was amazing. I haven't had good buffalo chicken since going vegan but this is definitely  close. The restaurant was clean and the host was very nice. Made sure everything came out great! Very big menu to choose from.

Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States

MYv8XBaTC4NNki2t6whUHQ.text: This was our second time at the restaurant and as a local Las Vegas vegan I am always excited about vegan restaurants.  My husband is non vegetarian and the first time asked for the pulled pork. They brought my food the first with such a big gap that I ate alone. My youngest daughter had the lobster roll, way too much sauce and dill.  My husband ordered again the pulled pork. The sandwich was completely cold. We told the waitress and she said that she was sorry and will remove it from the bill if he didn't want anything else. The manager came over and told us that she was sorry and that she'll take care of it.  They bring the bill and when I looked she removed only half of it. The vegan pulled pork sandwich (which is probably jack fruit) is $15!  I told the manager that she said that the sandwich will be removed from the bill and she said "I didn't say that". The waitress said that. "But not me. I'll talk to her." Ok first off what type of manager throws her co-worker under the bus. A good leader/manager owns it and follows through and then if you need to communicate with your employees and give them more training then you do that. Never in front of the clients. When I told her that she will see the review then she said "oh do you want me to remove it?" No girl, you already showed your leadership style and the culture of the restaurant.  Too expensive for the service and the quality of the food.  Never again!

O3cfzFjunuweHoQI9eiXJQ.text: To start, I was debating on a 4-5 star rating  Pros: it's a sheik, modern setting. Awesome pictures. There is a lot of white... I think they could use some plants, maybe some color. But overall the atmosphere was rad! The food was AMAZING. I don't understand the negative reviews as far as the food. I had the chicken and waffles, and my boyfriend had the Mexicana. Vegenation doesn't compare... IVETTE WAS AMAZING. I BELIEVE THAT WAS HER NAME. GIVE HER A RAISE. SHE WAS PHENOMENAL. (Really skinny, short, long black hair)  Cons: the wait is REAL, if you're in a rush, don't go. Also, people seated after us (and in a larger group) got served first ? And we ordered breakfast... we showed up about an hour after opening. They were slow, so I don't think the wait was justified.  Also the employees are soooo uninformed. A lady behind us asked if she was safe to order anything because she was lactose intolerant... in my head I was like duh, BUT THE WAITER HESITATED. then proceeded to tell her to stay away from certain things on the menu? When they are 100% plant based....  Definitely at-least give this place a try! I will definitely go again and hopefully the recent reviews aren't True.

5NzLNsNt5PInVR_PCZNkPw.text: Soooooooooooo good , cute atmosphere and the food was better than expected. Definitely coming back again and again , I wanna try everything on the menu.

okToq84fi4RXtRwbtqu-Tw.text: Amazing!!!!! First time at this amazing place! I got the all American burger with onion rings and it was the best.  The owner is super friendly as well.  I love this place!

Ldz-RbPlMIPd8kdHCdmxTg.text: Honestly very disappointed In this establishment. The food looks so good in the pictures. But the experience of going there was a totally different experience. Initially we walk in and get seated right away. But the table we were seated at was dirty. So I asked if they could clean it. The person came back set down silverware then returned to clean the table. Already a bad start. Next our server comes over and brings us water and informs us a large portion of the menu items were 86'd. She leaves us with a list of about 20 items that are not available. So the menu is limited now and have to ask if other items that have similar things on those are available. Some yes some no. The waitress returns 10 minutes later doesn't ask if we would like anything to drink. Then proceeds to ask if we're ready to order. We order and I ask to substitute something out. She says that's fine no problem. Puts the order in and proceeds to comeback about 5 minutes later and tell me for the substitution I'd have to pay an up-charge of 4 dollars. I would understand if it was 1-2 dollars as being a side. But 4 is too much for a substitution especially after being told it was no problem when I ordered. Lack of communication between front of the house and the kitchen. I say it's fine I no longer want the substitution just remove the side I didn't want. I then attempt to drink my water but notice my cup is dirty. Another dirty item in the same dining experience ruined it even more for me. I look for my waitress to inform her of the cup but she's off talking to a coworker and ignoring her tables. I have to call the hostess over and show her my dirty cup she states eww yeah I can see that it's dirty and gets me a replacement. Our food comes at different times with only two entrees ordered. Bad time management. Especially that the other person that dined with me ordered her entree atleast 5 minutes before me because I wasn't completely sure what I was gonna order as to not order the same thing. Also when I got my food I received the substituted item and was shocked because I told her I didn't want it because of the up charge. I brought it to her attention because I wasn't going to be charged for something I stated I no longer wanted before receiving my food. She stated no you won't be charged for the up-charge and that the kitchen messed up because she even told them don't put the substitution. The saving grace of the experience was the food though. The food was delicious and flavorful. And that honestly saved the experience from getting an even worse rating. But the lay issue we encountered was after eating our food and having our table cleared. Our waitress had disappeared yet again for another ten minutes. As we sat  there waiting for our check so we could pay and go. She eventually showed up asked if we wanted dessert but we stated we were full. So we got our bill paid and left. The all around experience was barely ok. And honestly if I were to eat here again I'd order to go as to not deal with the rest of the venue.

Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dirty cup. Not a floating piece of food. Crusted on food on the cup

M4h4y-b9W6gxCNrTQWQdIQ.text: This was my second awesome experience at TMV. Considering the variety of options on the menu and how busy the restaurant was, we were amazed at the level of service we received. The staff is friendly and accommodating and the food is incredible! The  first time there were 4 of us and today we were a group of 3. We have tried: Chicken and waffles, Eggs Florentine, Reuben, Lobster Roll, Breakfast potato skins, Buffalo chicken sandwich and Meatball sub. They were all sensational!! I can't wait to go back and keep working my way through the entire menu!

ap2qs0nsCKsSk4ItYBt_RA.text: I am glad this place exists! Nothing like finding a vegan restaurant; where the menu is catered around your choices, and not you attempting to piece together a decent vegan meal around appetizers and sides like most mainstream places. I will definitely go back, now the reason for a 3 star rating. First....how are you out of drinks, and or have to check if a menu item is available for purchase? I have to say, I have NEVER been to a restaurant that essentially cannot provide what is listed on the menu. I have eaten at many places, and as costs of meal goes up, I have an expectation that service goes up....not for service to go down. Strange! Another thing was service. Was slow, had to ask for things, like napkins, syrup, and spoons for the ice cream.....why do I have to ask for spoons....for ice cream??? It's also VERY loud...music is blasting....I am assuming because they are located under the flight path of McCarran Airport....I suggest bringing pen/paper,using sign language, or stop by Lakeshore Learning and buy one of those learning sets that elementary school kids use....it's like a phone system and 8 kids and a teacher "plug in" the sets;it sits in the middle of the table, and you can hear one another speak through the "phone piece".....yeah....get one of those....because communication even with the staff was an exchange of loud almost yelling interaction :) Still thou.....food was pretty darn good.

j7lq8M85t65fuygOntTXSg.text: GOODNESS this place is awesome.   Ambiance: Was initially skeptical because it was in a small strip mall situation. Once inside, it was True to the name and shiny and modern. Nice smaller size, too.   Service: I felt like the service was just a smidge slower than what I'm used to, but our waiter was super friendly and chill, and joked around with us a lot, and helped with recommendations.   Food: I want more! Not planning another trip to Vegas but man I really want to try more of this menu. Breakfast is available all day and they have a humongous menu, there were so many things I wanted to try! Definitely will be checking out their menu for home cooking inspiration.

qx64Et5D1_FYXj8u6mHuUQ.text: I'm not vegan and I very much enjoyed my meal. Got the chicken and waffles and it was delicious! Waffle was crispy, "chicken" is crispy, and the potatoes... didn't care for it. But everything else is good. Would definitely recommend!

aO_Hy0pAfv94GB_z9lNMrg.text: Went to TMV today. Great ambiance and service. I gave 3 stars because I was so looking forward to the V'eggs Benny but when I started eating it, it was way too spicy. The dish looked like the real deal but If TMV is going to make dishes spicy people need to decide if they want that. Eating with your eyes is very, very important but enjoying what you're eating is just as important.  We will be back and hopefully the chef will notice my advice.

5dDZAYeOb7eimVrP47u-Ww.text: This is our second time here this weekend, the food is amazing that's why we came back. There's no vegan restaurants on the strip but this is not too far just a few minute drive or Uber ride from the strip. Great food for everyone not just vegans! Breakfast, lunch, and dinner options

KY_m_JjHM3St1FXKh-vBHw.text: They definitely need to review the actual taste of their food. Don't waste your money here.

f84CtC2waYRf7M3MhKO9tw.text: We had just got to Vegas and stopped in for lunch. The great American burger which I had was REALLY GOOD!!! One of the best vegan burgers I've ever had. My kids ordered the pasta and meatballs which was quite disappointing.. The meatballs had a strong anis flavor and the sauce was very very  watery. They ended up eating all my fries which were really good. I would go again :)

photos.caption: Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9cPyD1a2ibNy46MC3V9vYg.text: Really wanted to like this place and like to support local businesses. I've been a long time vegan and took a non-vegan friend there who was visiting. First off, our food came way too fast upon ordering and was not hot?? So we can assume the food is not freshly prepared and quickly heated in a microwave. Heard the table next to us send their food back. We thought about it, but what was the point. We both picked at our huge plates and only ate the potatoes. The menu is way too big. Too much selection can be overwhelming. Perhaps they could scale back the menu to 1/3 of what it currently is and focus on making those few dishes fresh and tasty. So embarrassed that I took my friend here. Plus it's located in a sketchy area with people dealing who knows what outside. The cherry on top is my friend texts me later saying she feels dizzy and asks if vegan food can do that to you! If there was any chance of converting a meat eater, this missed the mark. What an awful experience. Don't take friends and family here who are visiting from out of town. They will look at you like you're out of your mind. Servers are nice though.

83icCGSpw6t6CaF0NrFPTw.text: Been coming here for a few months. The food is always amazing. However, the service is always terrible.  The first time we visited they only brought out half the table's food, then we had to wait 20 minutes to get the rest of our food. That time they compensated us for our troubles with some complimentary dessert.  Two visits we went for dinner. My husband got his sandwich before me and I, again, had to wait at least 15 minutes before my food came out. My husband FINISHED his gyro before I started eating. No mention of this or any apology from the servers.  Tonight we ordered takeout. First, they didn't tell us there was a veteran's discount and we have two veterans with us. Then They didn't get one of our orders so we had to wait another 30 minutes for them to make it. They claimed they put it to the front of the cooks orders, but it was a buffalo sandwich. They wouldn't give us that sandwich complimentary, either, and made us pay a second time for the meal.  I really love the food at this place, but if the service doesn't improve, they will lose patrons. Our patience was wearing pretty thin tonight.

hIkT6c4nFek1vTGXhZtdOw.text: Loved this place! The vegan food is delicious and there are tons of options. They provided outstanding customer service  Will be back very soon!!

XpTLzlexKwOJBEA4lZuvdQ.text: This is a cool spot. Definitely a lot of choices on the Menu. I sat at the bar, wasn't a great selection of drinks but I went ahead with the mimosa. The chicken and waffles was a really filling dish. The portions are really great here so you get your money's worth.

nfgkB5-Y5wtGiOoUUkETOA.text: Hands down best vegan restaurant I've ever been to. We had the poutine fries, chicken n waffles, Mac n cheese and wings. Definitely try the chicken and waffles! You can't tell that their food is vegan. Definitely look forward to coming back to Vegas just so I can eat here again! :)

DxgbhZHhw9xJRIs7OsnLsg.text: Scott was super sweet. The service was great and he made it a very pleasant experience! I also enjoyed the ambiance! I definitely would come back here considering it's one of the only late night vegan restaurants.

WRpI_xE9wrXf6EGQ1ZZmFw.text: Great decor and ambiance!  Friendly staff.  Espressi alcohol/coffee drink is a must for any coffee lover in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States

mShME4mc8yb7rMyVZFY6Vg.text: This place is poppin! And there are so many things to chose from on the menu, food was amazing and came out quickly, not your average vegan food

Yz6y8sfioO1LLL3EkhZLUA.text: This was an amazing experience. The restaurant was very bright and clean with a pretty and comfortable ambiance. We were greeted with a friendly smile as we walked in. The menu has so many wonderful things to choose from. Our food came out in a very timely manner and the presentation was excellent. I was impressed with the slightest little attention to details, such as having our own water carafe brought to the table with our water glasses. Their dedication to high quality vegan dishes showed throughout our experience. The service was fantastic. The menu was explained to us and recommendations were given. Our server was so friendly and nice. We will definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States

QomP8ktTcJu04TbGVcPx8Q.text: 100  Doing it right from front to back, top to bottom.  If you are vegan and you want to leave full and happy. This is your jam.

VfQcOqLEPlxBNIodWXKcQw.text: This place was a really great find on our recent trip to Vegas. Not only was the food good they are open late so we always had someplace we could go eat. Plus if your staying at the Hard Rock it's within walking distance.

Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and waffles

tCbIPeZl4zBjheuGmsOWjg.text: VERY DISAPPOINTING. Ordered chicken and waffles. Asked for water. Got a cup of water--no ice. I'd just assume ice would be in the water, but I guess the waitress took me literally.First chicken and waffle was cold. Second one was cold. My daughter ordered ramen-out of ramen. She then ordered fries and lobster sandwich. Fries were cold. I'm assuming the sandwich is served cold, because it was cold too. Asked for a second cup of coffee and creamer. Waitress brought creamer but no coffee. Waited. Had to ask again for coffee. The bill? The wife's husband told us he'd take the chicken and waffles off the bill. Too loud when he was talking and didn't hear what he was going to do with the final bill. Got the bill, gave the waitress my daughters credit card. When she came back, she was charged for the chicken and waffle. Waited until we got husbands attention, then explained we were overcharged. Waited again for waitress to bring corrected bill. Waited extra long for to go boxes.  The whole experience was bad. The chicken and waffle looked so good. My mouth watered. One bite of cold mashed potato did nothing but kill my appetite x 2. With the whole rotten experience, I'd think her husband would've offered more of a discount. I feel he needs more restaurant/customer experience because he has no idea how to speak to the customer. We may give it a second try but it'll be in 6 months or so when they have things going good. If they're still open. LOOK at how delicious that would've been--had it been served hot.

photos.caption: Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States

VFgNY8jPj_2al5d5Hsg0sQ.text: I might give a higher rating once I actually get to eat here.   I've been watching this place on social media for weeks and was so excited for it to finally open. I honestly didn't have high expectations for opening day as I know it takes time to work out kinks and get the flow down - but I went anyway because I wanted to be supportive of a new vegan restaurant. Unfortunately, the experience was even worse than my low expectations.   The place was busy but not overwhelmed, we only waited 10 minutes or so to be seated for lunch. We were given our drinks and our server took our order...and then nothing for an HOUR! Our server literally would not make eye contact with us and ignored us the entire time. We finally flagged her down and asked about our food. She said that food was coming out slow and the table ahead of us had been waiting 2 hours for their food! Seriously?? 2 hours??? She said she was going to go ask about our food and then never came back. This server was terrible. No communication, no apologies, no customer service. Just flat out ignored us. We were starving at this point so after waiting another 15 minutes and no news we decided to just get up and leave.   There were some positives that stood out:   - The hostess was very pleasant & friendly.   - The interior is super cute.   - I love the modern vibe (not the traditional "granola" vegan spot).   - The menu is large and diverse.  - The food that we did see go by to other tables all looked amazing.    I'm disappointed I didn't get to eat here today but I will definitely come back in a few months and give it another try.

Y-6kcpnC5oCALw3XqAT2hw.text: Went with a group of 4 and each ordered different things. The plates were very large and shareable. Very yummy desserts loved the fried peanut butter and jelly sandwich. The chicken and waffles was also very tasty but the waffles could have been a little more crispier. We also ordered the buffalo chicken wrap it had a lot of sauce tasty too... the pad Thai was good as well

zDmlJOeeP-6RbKA9j7e60w.text: My first visit was back when they recently opened, small menu great flavor and the owner going out of her way to assist in anyway necessary. Fast forward to the present. The complete opposite,  Huge Hype menu which makes hospital cafeteria food taste like 5 star dining. Most seasonings are vegan rt? So shake a few in those dishes so they no longer taste like a microwave TV dinner. Service was the absolute worst. It was 15 minutes before we were seated although they weren't busy at all. Four servers standing at the bar glancing up trying not to make eye contact with us. Only seated after I asked. Had to ask for water and never received a refill. I didn't want to post a review because I understand everyone and every business has a bad day. So my wife messaged the owner on IG and no response. So if that's how much she values her customers I figure I'd let the public know. It seems she let the success get to her head and falls far short of what initially won me over as a customer. I truly hope you can do some damage control and get back to the way this restaurant was. Or maybe it's a reflection of how you treat your employees? Whatever the reason is, you lost control of this place and it shows. The two things this establishment offers are service and food and on my visit the modern vegan can not execute either. Do not support a business that takes success for granted

wPDr6ztr2vIrPrfzWe_a2Q.text: First all vegan restaurant anywhere near the Vegas strip and since I travel here frequently for conferences it is a lifesaver. The food, although, yes, mostly Gardein products, is delicious.  Because my digestive system is sensitive to soy products like Gardein I opted for the "lobster" roll which I believe was either artichoke or hearts of Palm. Either way it was amazing. And if you tend to skip over the dessert menu, DON'T!!  Their deep fried PB&J is one of the best things I have ever eaten. Picture a Monte Cristo minus the animal cruelty. I don't know how they made the batter but WOW!  Next time I might brave the Chickn and Waffles because it looks amazing, just didn't need the digestive issues this trip. Thanks Modern Vegan!  You rock Girl!

Khz0kgmM9CjYHtwnJjd9yg.text: I ordered the Biscuits & Gravy w/breakfast potatoes, and it was one those meals that, even though I was full, I kept eating. They have such a big menu, that I can't wait to get back, and try some other options. As for the service, it was GREAT imo. So great, I left a $15 tip on a $25 bill. Thanks TMV for giving this Valley a new option for Vegan cuisine.... See u soon!

eC9woTqPM4kIVvgiT158sw.text: Love this place! The food was delicious!!! Will definitely be back every time I visit Las Vegas

Bab0W9Opjyop52MKWtqIyg.text: I wish one star rating was available, because that's what this restaurant deserves, in my opinion, after my first time experience there! It was understandably busy for a Saturday at 1 PM. Taking that into consideration, they still managed to take an unusual amount of time just to get our drink and food orders. We waited about 30 minutes to receive our drinks, and the waiter who brought them wasn't able to get our order right on the first try. My brother had to chase down his drink, or else I believe it would have never arrived! Our main waiter wasn't attentive to us in anyway, he even tried to give us the check before we recieved any food! Unfortunately, we had to leave, because after patiently waiting an hour and a half, we had run out of time. We  were not impolite or rude, and never received any food, nor an apology. I was expecting an apologize, at the very least! Any other time, in similar situations, it's always been acknowledged and/or accommodated in some way by the staff. I would never recommend this restuarant to anyone.

P3bXx6Z71gKkXAS0iximrA.text: Went here today with my cousin the food was awesomely delicious :)nice environment and atmosphere with great customer service 5 stars all the way. Will definitely be going here again sooner then later!!

6QZWwxEDaCVPMoxFUwqD8A.text: Everything about this place is perfect, upon entry you are greeted by a friendly hostess and seated. The inside decor of this restaurant is modern and clean and you are handed quite a large menu with a huge variety of options. The waiters are so nice and very attentive and when you get your food it is extremely good looking and so tasty, I cannot believe this food is vegan, definitely the best place to eat since I've became a vegan. Will return!

photos.caption: Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Buffalo &#34;chicken&#34; sandwich on a pretzel bun. 10/10

1DwlLUqQf6197AVe-55vmg.text: Excellent menu choices. Great service & friendly staff. Nice, comfortable, modern styled interior. Good location. And reasonable prices. This will definitely be my "go to" place in Vegas from now on.

gb7L7pTVH-1pd64eVry4Jw.text: All I gotta say it's that cowboy burger is the business !!!!  Beautiful unique place every one was super nice

scmvXqGylaQWZWv-18w3DQ.text: I have never experienced such an amazing restaurant anywhere!!!! I would love to say this is comfort vegan cuisine! The portions are huge and the quality is insane! They have picture perfect food at prices you can't beat. I flew 6 hours to try this place when I heard about the menu and I am so impressed! I can't wait to try the whole menu! Which by the way is so big would take 30 visits to try! I actually couldn't help myself but to look at every dish coming out of the kitchen and it all looks so good! I saw so many pictures being taken and happy faces I can't wait to come back and support the amazing owners! People making such a difference in the world and I'm so happy to be apart of the opening weekend! Thanks Gia and Todd for the amazing food and hospitality!!

ZlX4ic_Zx5ZDkA_MzrC70A.text: I would like to update my review! My wife and I decided to give The Modern Vegan another try and we are very happy we did. We had the chicken and waffles and it was delicious The amount of food you get is well worth the $15 you pay and can probably be split by two people. I cannot say enough about the service we received from Taryn today, she was great! The service alone would have added a star to my last review but the food was great too. This place has worked out the kinks and a we will most definitely be back!

Ipb5u1q1KUU6uIaR9ZH4yg.text: Have been twice. The first experience was odd due to the fact the food came out soooo slowly and there were very few other diners, and the weirdness and smugness of the owner.  Whatever...tried it again when family came to visit. Same issues as the first time but now with cold food, upcharging for EVERYTHING and a mandatory tip for our party of 4 plus a child.   After seeing the way the owner conducts herself in person and especially on social media ridiculing other honest reviews about how bad the place is, I will never go again.

EY9e3HGP4dsH6esg2cPq7w.text: I'm giving this 3 stars for a particular reason. I've gone here twice so far with the same experience when I enter this place. The staff should great its customers immediately when walking in to make them feel welcomed and it also adds to the overall dining experience. I don't care if the food is top notch this is extremely important. Both times we were at the door waiting to be greeted and seated for over 5 mins without anyone saying anything to us. It leaves a negative impression that the service will be like this when eating. First time I was there service kind of sucked there was just one girl taking care of the entire floor. Second time I sat closer to the bar and the lady was really nice and on point. Food is great but it's just these things that can be tweaked to make a business stand out even more.

YHxuTrgMW5NGRRSNsh4VyA.text: One of my new fav vegan spots in Vegas! My semi vegan boyfriend absolutely loved his Louisiana chicken, mashed potatoes (with gravy on the side cuz he's picky.... I ate his gravy with my mashed potatoes and could've drank the bowl!!) and coleslaw. My chicken and waffles were amazing! The mac and cheese was missing something. We couldn't quite put our finger on it though. Nevertheless, the servers were super courteous and helpful, the ambiance was very cool and modern, and the TVs with the game on were just up my boyfriend's alley. We can't wait to go back and try other items on the menu. Everything looked great!

1u5_n7nOfBvyjr3R47jHfg.text: Service was great. Food was even greater.  So many choices an the jalepeno poppers soo good. Definitely not your run of the.mill. they cared. You could tell it in their food.

C3mUjTxa2Ef2NHV5hIANwg.text: I'm out of town and ordered this on GrubHub - I got the Mac n' Cheese and it was awesome. I also got the pad Thai, the flavor was awesome but they use regular pasta noodles which isn't super authentic but was still good.   Solid vegan place!

Z2Pkr5fCmMHLLGhfHZ9gOg.text: Wow - just wow! We ate here three times during our stay in Vegas. We didn't plan on it, but it just worked out that way.   Right after we landed, we took a cab here. She was a bit crazy (if you watch Kimmy Schmidt Unbreakable - she was just like the old lady in the show). It was very interesting. Anyways, we went in luggage and all.   Inside its a bit modern/hip. Doesn't feel like super comfortable - more like a bit nicer environment, but it's whatever. We didn't feel out of place with our travel clothes. It's not classy per say, but it's all white and chic inside. It's funny that the couple at the other table from us ordered the exact same order as us. And then they were having issues getting an Uber back to the strip. I'll put this tip at the bottom too.   We started with the jalapeno bites. I liked them but didn't love them. It wasn't a cream cheese filling. More like melty cheddar filling. We also go the popcorn chicken. SUPER DELISH! I got the Chicken and Waffles with mashed potatoes, and the hubby got Shrimp Po Boy. CNW was AMAZING! Wow. The shrimp sandwich was ok. I never had the real version - so I'm not sure how it's supposed to taste, but I didn't like it that much.   Our second visit - I got the Philly Cheesesteak and I can't remember what the hubby got...was it Chicken and Waffles with mashed potatoes again?! I'm not sure. Whatever I had it was delish! We also got the deep fried banana split. It was a bit much. LOL but very interesting to try. Ice cream was super good!  Our third visit no photos. I got a burger and I can't recall what the husband ordered. I believe it was a Beyond Beef burger. Typical. If I could do this third stop over, I probably would have ordered something else.   Overall, the food was really good. I would definitely go again and recommend to vegan and non vegans. So many more things I would have liked to try! Until next time!

photos.caption: Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ruben
Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ruben
Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Popcorn chicken

KYUpHOGXwExZ_3Nqy7zCCA.text: I've been wanting to try this place out since they opened. I attempted one time to go and order some dinner to take home but they don't let you order to go which means I would really never get to come here often because they're closed Tuesday and they close at 6pm on operating days.  So I was able to pick anywhere I wanted to for Mother's Day and TMV was the first thing that came to mind! I was so looking forward to trying it and my daughter and I got dressed up and to go eat.  When you walk in the place is nice and clean the hostess was nice sat us down and our server came over to take our order. I always order my daughters food first even if I'm not ready to order and all she wanted was a order of fries with cheese. The server said (the cheese is vegan) is that ok?! What!!? This is a vegan restaurant so would hope the cheese was vegan. So she puts in her order then we put in 2 more orders and while we waited we got served the smallest cups of warm water.  So our first order comes out, not my daughters order so we don't eat until all of us have our food. We told someone we were waiting for my daughters fries with cheese and they still came out with our other order plus appetizer and not my daughters food. So we told them once again our daughter doesn't have her food so we're waiting to eat.  Then a server finally brings out her order and says it's way too hot and sorry they didn't know it was for a child! Even after making it very clear and my daughter is the one that asked for it. By this time I was not happy with the service I could understand if it was super busy but that was not the case.  The food was alright not what I thought it would be my coleslaw had no flavor and my other food was already cold from waiting so long.  So I asked for my food to go.  One more thing I want to add is 11$ for 3 jalapeno poppers to me is a little much! I never complain about prices especially if the food is good in this case it wasn't worth the price.  I was really disappointed all around and don't think I'll go back which is a bummer because I love to support our local vegan businesses.  This was just a no for me.

IHRt-SXoLleZul68YVtzcA.text: Food heaven! And that it's all vegan is a mega bonus. We had the chickn n waffles, steak n v-eggs, Mac n cheese balls, and the I'm a Dirty Girl dessert. Incredibly delicious! I can't speak to the restaurant atmosphere since we had our food delivered, but it arrived quickly on a Friday morning. We have had vegan comfort food other places, but this was too notch flavor. And the combination of the flavors, such as the chickn with the waffle with the mashed potatoes was so complimentary I can't rave enough about how yummy it was! The 'steak' was also incredible. It is difficult to get a faux meat to come out so close to real meat, as well as to get the different 'meat flavors' to come out tasting uniquely from one another, but this place is master at it. Whether you're a vegan or not, the food from this place is a must to try!

L3XWryCdY7GTkTzkxrKYsg.text: Excellent food and great staff! My husband was so excited about the jalapenos poppers, and he was not disappointed. We got the pulled pork sandwich (delicious sauces), and the meatball sub. Both were super yummy! We also got the brownie sundae with vanilla ice cream- the ice cream was so smooth and melt-in-your-mouth. They were really attentive and enthusiastic about their food. We will be back here as soon as possible.

oQs-2ggSFgL_sOaFHocxsw.text: Second time here and they didn't disappoint!! Our food was amazing and the presentation matched the flavour   This is definitely a must have every time we come to Vegas!!

LgvVMPgITtfbM5GJ2UwvgA.text: Yah, nah. Was told I have to go check out the new vegan joint on Naples Drive. Cute, fresh ambiance. Nice service. Menu- large selection, too many items on the menu, crowded and hard to read with the small font.   Had the $14 Baked Mac & Cheese, it was pretty good. Ordered the $10 Key Lime cheesecake to go. I was shocked at the size! For $10 at least provide a normal slice. Here's a photo with a bottle cap next to it to show scale. It's half a slice. C'mon! That"s four bites max! Not worth it. Worst yet, was the rude manager, when she asked me how everything was, I told her the desert was overpriced. Her response was arrogant and dismissive. For a local off strip joint in the fruit loop district,  Robuchon you're not! Your prices and unfriendliness don't justify the 3rd rate strip mall experience.

ZEE--hH1bfviB-QCwZ9ZRw.text: I came here for the first time last night, Thursday night, I had The Mac Attack, which was recommended by our host Moe (sorry if I misspell your name). My date had the cauliflower buffalo wings, and the strawberry margarita. All I have to say is, WOW! THAT WAS FUCKING DELICIOUS!!!! The Mac attack was amazing!! My date loved her cauliflower wings and margarita. I want to give a special recognition to Moe, who went above and beyond with the customer service, you were very informative, and detailed. Thank you for your generosity and hospitality. We will definitely be back!

NWptlwkPSznZ7DCWCQyb0A.text: There food was amazing however when I was there they just couldn't get my jalapeno poppers so cook correctly. It was fine though they made up for it. Food quality on the dish was A1 !

0kvpR5Gm4SDTl1VVYn6ZQg.text: Good food! Horrible ambience! Cool if you want to eat "at the club" otherwise, turn dat shit down (the music AND the AC). I've usually gone on a weekend morning. Overall it's ok, great food, good portions. But I'd hate to be there when it's packed.

L4F3LIxAPXIPXu3A9JIadQ.text: Ordered four items for delivery : chicken and waffles , a salad , Avocado  and acai bowl . Two item missing .waffle served with no syrup. I called the restaurant To inquire about a credit  and ask about syrup . Overall not a great experience .

2A1YOW1p3dbPlgPHCRqP_g.text: I've been here twice so far and I am looking forward to coming back many more times. First time was 2 weeks ago with a non vegan friend visiting from GA. He loved their French toast. My first time trying chicken n waffles and it was vegan and delicious. My 2nd time here was with my cousin and the Cube of Truth crew. It was a tough decision between a sandwich, burger or breakfast. I'm greedy  The Reuben (am I spelling it correctly lol) was delicious. I am looking fwd to trying their ramen, steak n eggs and spaghetti. And everything else. Service was also great. I don't remember our server's name but she was definitely one of the best servers I've seen especially handling a large group. The lady who sat us was sweet too . Thank you guys!

BmQlLI-uwL9rRQnMzbJRJw.text: The food was extremely bland, the tofu scramble had no seasoning , the plate my water was recommended "fit bitch" was just a plate of steamed veggies with maybe only salt and pepper.  The server asked what I though of the food and I told he the truth and she told me  "sorry I'm not going to be able to do anything about that, so you want me to bring you some hot sauce" I then noticed on their menu it says there is no refunds or cancellations on any food.   Food was not good.

GtVE65t1V-iPIi-TM5e0xw.text: I'll never go to another vegan restaurant while vacationing in Vegas..only this place from now on. The menu was huge and the food delicious!

HjE0La5qg0XCs2wxID3Syw.text: Holy hell this place is crazy good. I'm usually more of a vegetable person and don't eat a lot of Seitan or vegan cheeses/ products....but they know what they're doing here. AMAZING. Loved the jalapeno poppers and gravy fries.

6INJ1l0clbB-GwaWLANTYA.text: Tried Modern Vegan while on a trip to Vegas. Its so awesome to see more of these restaurants pop up, and I love supporting all of them! I really enjoyed the vibe, definitely modern with a hint of fancy-ness although still casual. I also appreciated how friendly the staff was. They were on top of taking orders and being very efficient, as well as kind. So all the stars for that!  My husband's choice was the coconut curry (good call!) This was delicious and definitely my fave of the three we ordered. I think it would go great with rice! The lobster roll was okay, I'm not sure I even liked lobster roll when I used to eat seafood, so honestly I don't know why I ordered it haha. I think I was surprised it was cold, but that's how a real lobster roll is served, so totally not their fault, mine for lack of research. The Mac and cheese was on point with creaminess, but not super cheesy that I'm used to tasting, but not bad.   I honestly wish I could have ordered more to sample, but our time in the area was limited and I only have so much I can fit in my stomach. All the menu items looked incredible and I'm sure very delicious. That's another plus, lots to choose from, so whatever mood they seem to meet that need. One thing is for sure, we'll be back again when in the area!  Overall the experience was great!

photos.caption: Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States

HTdmrYlMnb1SLD3tJM3RdQ.text: The food was so yummy!!  The waffles were perfect and fluffy.  The lobster roll is a cold sandwich it was so good!!!  OMG THE CORND DOGS they were so crispy.   My sister had the clam chowder it was a little watery and she said it didn't taste the way clam chowder does but it was still really good:)  The Know It All drink was prefect:)

s2bXktnG8CLu2-iTZ3em0Q.text: I was recommended to come her by a family member. What is interesting is I came here to pace myself to experience a full course meal here. The energetic pace of my server seemed slightly rushed and inattentive. It felt as if she was rushing me just to see if I would order more than an appetizer. I The corn dogs on the appetizer menu should be provided with a garnish for the $11 price point. Presentation should strongly be a factor when asking your patrons to invest in this portion of a meal, especially if you are modern in Las Vegas. Nonetheless, I had to ask another server to order another item due to the server for my table being more absent than she was towards the beginning of this visit. I have been to vegan restaurants nationwide, and this was my least favorite of them all. Hopefully, this franchise will focus on a wholistic experience other than the menu being 100% plant-based.
