Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Prickly Pear Tea

KIK4TvqPMW-_KdVy0DT4ww.text: Man.. This place was amazing. I only learned about it from my cousin that lives in Vegas. It is in a small non descript strip and looks very unassuming. It is white and it was immaculate. The menu was so extensive that I was overwhelmed with what to try. Normally, I'd try more than one dish in that situation, but the  prices were so high I couldn't afford to. I didn't knock the prices, though, because we were in Vegas, right? *shrug* Instead of being overwhelmed, I went with the daily special, which was a vegan version of a Big Mac (close to $25). That thing was huge!!! Like, so big I couldn't bite it without squeezing it hard. I tapped out before finishing it with the delicious crispy fries that came with it. The service was great. The guy who helped us was patient and kept checking on us.  I can't wait to get back to Vegas so I can try another item on the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegan Big Mac
Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States

HlEqOcYEt7Hh6W9ro-sr9A.text: I have to hand it to TMV....the food here is AMAZING!!! Every single item on this menu is vegan which is superb. I ordered the buffalo cauliflower wings as an appetizer and for my main course i had the lobster roll with a side of french fries. It was so delicious, and flavorful with that creamy avocado sauce drizzled on top-delightful. My sister ordered the Mack Attack sandwich and she gave it a two thumbs up and said the taste was similar to the 'Big Mac' except guilt free! There's nothing like eating guilty yet guilt free. The moment we got to the restaurant and looked at the menu, we knew that during our Vegas stay we'd be coming back again. The restaurant is right next to UNLV in the same plaza as the 7/11 and there's parking!!!! I can't wait until this restaurant comes to Atlanta because I'll be there every single day. See you soon TMV   So I came back to TMV The next day along with someone who is non-vegan and she was pleasantly surprised. We ordered the Mac n cheese baseballs, the chick'n and waffles and I ordered the "jerk chicken" sandwich as my main course. The cauli wings were still tasty and we got the bbq flavor this time. The Mac n cheese baseballs were also very tasty and had great texture with the crispy, crunchy exterior and the macaroni was cooked to perfection.

photos.caption: Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brunch feast
Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and waffles with asparagus and mashed potatoes
Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Feast

ui3VlKXntDzVIsMZZnmT7w.text: This is the kind of vegan restaurant they should have in every major city.  Large menu with a lot of choices and more importanly the food was amazing! My fav were the chicken n waffles.

dgUurKRhsDpinKvGvN03jA.text: Stopped by there with no expectations. Had a wonderful time. Suzy the bartender was so sweet. She made us great drinks and gave us some great tips on where to go while we are in Vegas. Great little place!! We will forsure be back

o7YS-Pca8qhMxH8CsgH-Xg.text: We were starving by the time we walked through the door. We should have known better than to stay because all the tables were full and the couple before us had been waiting for a long time. The wait was insane.  The poor pregnant hostess was running around seating people while taking orders, serving food, and bussing tables. I wanted to sit her down and let her know that she needs to train her staff better so everything runs smoothly, especially when she is on baby leave.   Get ready to view the largest vegan menu I've ever seen. The portions are enormous! Bring your appetite. I loved the chicken and waffles on top of mashed potatoes. The pulled pork sandwich wasn't that great but I'm sure they'll improve their recipes as time goes on.    I'll give them a thumbs up for lasting a year and opening a new location in San Diego. However, the kitchen needs to get synchronized on executing orders at the same time for a table. My dish didn't come out until 10 minutes after my love received his.

I0WsxpIrelCXdl6mYTmUTw.text: I came here for a late night dessert because they were the only vegan spot open and I figured it's pretty hard to mess up dessert. Not only did they not mess it up, it was BOMB! I ordered "I Love You" (banana split) and "Baby Baby" (deep fried PB & chocolate sandwich). The deep fried sandwich was on the dry side, but I asked for a scoop of ice cream, which made it perfect!  For the longest time, I've avoided coming back to this place, but it has been a while and their dessert proved worthy...so I may give their savory dishes another chance soon!

photos.caption: Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. the Gia waffles
Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Roll
Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. the Anna waffles

mIhCTj4LUu0rlVwFwjFi7A.text: I was in town for NBA Summer League and woke up needing fuel for the day. John A., legendary Commissioner of my fantasy basketball league, suggested meeting at the Modern Vegan, and I was more than a little suspicious. My last memory of vegan food was at Pure Food and Wine, eating "vegan cheese" that tasted like cardboard. Bad vibes from PFW were right, too: the place shut down in a blaze of infamy due to cashflow issues and inability to pay workers, completely unpardonable. It made me enter Modern Vegan with low expectations.  Those expectations were quickly reversed. Vegan corn dogs were incredible. I hate to be cliche, but "I couldn't even tell they were vegan!!!!" and even better, didn't have a flashback of Ralph Nader saying he would never eat a hot dog because he knew what went into it. Falafel was OK as well, though not as exceptional. Hard to fault MV for that, though, given the low upside for falafel.   MV is located in a strip mall and windows are all blacked out. I wondered for a moment if the place had shut down and become some seedy stereotypical "Vegas" establishment, but it's just decor. Inside is totally normal and clean. This place gets the #MERLINFIVE.

NXRO1be8N9MpTWqLiBkKXA.text: Where do I begin.....to tell everyone about this AMAZING restaurant! My family and I were there for a Sunday brunch and we had the absolute best experience ever! Neither one of us is vegan but we were looking forward trying something new and we were soooooo happy we did. We started with mimosas, oh so bubbly and refreshing, and smoothies for the kids, so tasty I'll have hard time convincing them to drink my homemade ones. We then ordered some appetizers to share: the literally loaded nachos-truly the best nachos I've had, an abundant portion for everyone to indulge. The Mac and cheese baseballs-cheesy, warm and delicious. The perfect corn dogs- if I didn't know they were vegan I'd never be able to tell the difference as they far exceeded our expectations on what a vegan corn dog should taste like! We then ordered the stuffed portobello steak, my absolute favorite, so flavorful and healthy I wanted to take another one home. The spicy chicken wrap was superb and asked for another round of drinks. The philly cheese sandwich which beat the flavor of most regular phillys we've had before. We could leave without ordering the Cody waffle and it was the cherry on the cake. Besides the generous portions we cleaned all our player and savored every bite. Thank you TMV and we can't wait to see you again!

HpAf50teoaE_e44zJloTww.text: Wow!  Bar, full vegan menu, breakfast served all day long....what more can you ask for?!?!?!?!   Ventura county, Ca get one of these please!!!  Will be back here every time I come back to Henderson!

photos.caption: Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States

nZKD_ptVYGSYTaU4r04k4g.text: The restaurant itself is cute, clean and modern. Plenty of seating space. And even a couch to lounge on if you so desire.   There is a separate bar area, as well as a regular table area. They have a long family style table too, if you have a big group.   The servers were very friendly and fun. They only have one soup a day (although there are about 8 on the menu, they switch off) We were lucky it was creamy truffle soup, and it was soooooo delicious!   We got the "eggs" benny and the chicken and waffles. The portions seemed very very large, but it was mostly a giant serving of mashed potatoes underneath everything. I don't know if they serve all the dishes like this, but both main courses we got were like this. It was nice for presentation, and I'll never complain about a big portion, but the problem for us wax that they placed everything on top of them. So almost every bite tasted more like potato than the actual food. If I go back I would ask for that on the side instead of underneath.   The chicken and waffles were AMAZING! But they didn't quite pull off the eggs Benny. The "hollandaise sauce" didn't remotely taste like hollandaise sauce. Which I was really looking forward to.  We also got the jalapeno poppers. They were little bites of fried heaven, and those I would definitely get again!

photos.caption: Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chick&#39;n &amp; Waffles

zgmGHMB2i7RDO4e33WpEfg.text: Went here 2x  The first time we came for lunch and I ordered The Whoppster original added cheese and bacon (it was a Wednesday) and my sis ordered the jerk burger. You can choose salad or fries as your side. We both picked fries. So good!! We had a really fun and attentive server.  The second time we came for breakfast. I ordered the #1 skillet (tofu scramble + potatoes + artichokes + mushrooms + green onions + mozzarella) and my sis ordered the chick'n quesadilla. I loved the skillet but thought the scramble was a little salty. It almost seemed like they sprinkled salt on top before arguing. Plus the service was so bad (docked a star). I also ordered pad Thai to go and it was a great amount. Had some on the plane on the way home and still had enough to share with my husband when I got home. Highly recommend this place for the food. The service could be hit or miss.

photos.caption: Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. #1. Asparagus, Mushroom, Green Onion and Mozzarella Skillet
Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chuc k&#39;n Quesadilla
Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Jerk Burger

cotZe7nAavfkVnFEAAVJMQ.text: Delicious!  My husband and I are absolutely impressed.  This place aims to please.  We were treated really well by the waiter and staff... couldn't find an attitude anywhere any in this place not even from the other guest... which says a lot about the people TMV attracts!    The smoothies were really good... like you can taste the flavors good!  Also, my husband ate all his food with only two bites left.  I ate about 1/4 of my chick and waffles it is really filling.  One down fall:  the bathrooms doesn't have hooks... so leave your purse at the table if you don't need it!

photos.caption: Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kody Waffles has peanut butter on the inside
Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and Waffles... enough for 2-3 people to share depending on your appetite
Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and Waffles... There is 2 waffles, one chick, 2 slices of bacon sitting on a bed of Mashed Potatoes!  Yum!

Bd0Fads3wpZt5aL2hUyPYA.text: Yum yum yum. Flew in from Dallas and came straight here before heading to Utah. We were surprisingly not hungry, so me and the hubs shared the eggplant parm sandwich and added mushrooms. YUM! Good enough to want to come back on out way back through.    We came back today and split the jalapeno poppers and the philly cheese steak, both were delicious. Loved the TMV sauce! And the side salad with tomatoes, cucs and balsamic vinaigrette was a perfect, light side. Will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jalapeno Poppers
Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Philly Cheesesteak Sandwich
Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggplant Parm Sandwich

VbxuVqq9l0xG20MxiO7Hvw.text: It is our fourth time at MV. This time we did it smart way. For our first breakfast We got one savory and one sweet dish for our breakfast and we had room for desert. OMG we got deep fried banana bread and it was sooo delicious. Portions so big we went back to our hotel with 3 to go boxes lol.  Next day on a branch time we sheared soup and breakfast burritos between 3 people and the same desert for the whole table ( there was 8 of us)  If u visiting LasVegas even if u staying on the strip take a small trip to this wonderful place, u won't be disappointed!

photos.caption: Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Broccoli and cheese soup, very delicious!

qfwFKQmAcmbHR0mQyCUpDw.text: I hate to give this place 3 stars because the food is soooo amazing but the service is just so awful. hahaha  Food - 5 Stars  Service - 0 stars   So lets just go with 3 starts as an average. I ended up coming here twice during my Las Vegas Trip and both times our waitress forgot us and forgot things we ordered and we had to go up to the bar and asked for our bill so we could leave.   But the food WAS AMAZING. I would still recommend people come here because the food is so good. First visited we ordered the mac and cheese baseballs, breakfast tacos and waffles. Everything was amazing and my husband who is not a vegan agreed, the food was great.   Second time I ordered the bacon stuffed peppers and fried chicken and mashed potatoes and you get so much food! So yes the food is pricy but the taste and the amount you get is worth it.   So would I come here again? Yes.  Do I recommend it? Yes just don't expect great service.

XtrSBzKGhg1kZf1t4o72FQ.text: Ohmygod. This place is fantastic. It was the first thing I see on Maps when I landed in Vegas and knew I had to go. It was the perfect meal after a long flight.  This place is not what it looks like on the outside. It's part of a little strip mall but when you go in it's super cute and trendy. The wait staff were all nice and everything moved quickly, I was surprised how fast the food came out! The menu is EXTENSIVE, I had a tough time choosing. They have breakfast (all day), salads, burgers, sandwiches, and lots of great drinks (smoothies and alcoholic drinks). My pulled pork sandwich with slaw was amazing, and the TMV sauce was great with the fries. I'll definitely be coming back before I leave.

photos.caption: Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pulled Pork Pretzel Bun with fries, Saucy Cauliflower Wings, New York New York Smoothie, and Blue Hawaiian drink

o0QLimcVtj0iUbvqzsxKkg.text: Having loved our first dining experience here, we returned for a follow up and sadly tonight's choices weren't as stellar as those from our first night.  My hubs ordered the mac and cheese and the flavor just wasn't there for us.  We have tried our fair share of vegan macs, both restaurant quality and store bought, so we know a more cheesy flavor is possible.  Beyond that, it also felt like the overall seasoning could've been stronger.  It's a rather large serving of just straight mac and cheese ..if it had been the side to something else maybe we could have seen past it.  Wanting something "healthier" and chock full of veggies, I went for the breakfast budha bowl.  The flavor was on point and it was sooo tasty but man it was swimming in oil.  That just defeats the purpose of choosing a heathier option.  We're considering a third/final visit tomorrow since it's a reasonable distance and can be fit into our packed schedule tomorrow.  Hoping the third time will reinstate our original feelings if we do make it in again.

photos.caption: Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast Budha bowl...waaaay too much oil

jXLMCefbj0bXt0khOoSbWA.text: Nailed it!   The modern vegan is amazing! I had a much better experience this time around.  The decor is very modern, I love the color scheme and chains. The music is fun, but not too loud.   The servers were friendly, knowledgable and attentive! I love their all black uniforms.  The bathrooms are clean and stocked... and gender neutral!  The customer service was on point! We were seated right away and received our food and drinks in a timely manner!  We ordered the poutine for an appetizer. It was bomb! Cheesy, rich, and the fries never lost their texture. I ordered the chicken and waffles for my entre. It was really yummy! I would recommend more chicken, but it was still so good! My boyfriend ordered a burger with bbq and bacon it it! It was also very tasty. I always love Beyond Burger patties. My friends ordered the lobster roll and Reuben hot dog. The Reuben was very good- rich and kinda spicy. I didnt try the lobster roll but it looked great! Lol  We are so happy with our experience! I can't wait to come back!

photos.caption: Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Western bbq burger
Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster roll
Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Onion rings

2287qiwD5K4LHj_MjGenKw.text: The Modern Vegan is a gem hidden in an unassuming strip mall in the shadow of UNLV.  My kids call me a flexitarian as I can be a hard core Vegan, Vegetarian or an Omnivore!  I like to say that I follow my body's religion when it comes to food, I feed on what fuel it needs or craves, within reason!  I can't believe I've never eaten here before now!  Trust me, it was so wonderful, I'll be back!! We all ordered something different and shared, family style,  that's how we roll(sometimes)... The Chicken n Waffles with Bacon and Mashed potatoes are GREAT if that's your jam (not mine), the Lobster Stuffed Portabello with asparagus and cauliflower were TDF! We also ordered the Bolognese with Zoodles which was delicious, it tasted clean and flavorful, the Pad Thai was good however,  the noodles were a little overcooked (says my friends' mom who orders that on the regular), the kids enjoyed the Spaghetti and Meatballs but the Mac n Cheese was bland,  if you regularly eat nutritional yeast on foods you'll be ok, it had "that type" of flavor.  The service was good, I think that it was a busy GRADUATION weekend and they were slammed and you got that sense that they were frazzled. I appreciate when staff let's you know what's going on, that way, we as customers understand and can be more patient, tolerant, compassionate and flexible. Maybe better staffing for busy days. It's a tough line of work and I appreciate these folks serving me so I can kick back, relax, eat yummy food  and enjoy my family and friends!

photos.caption: Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cowboy baby
Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stuffed Portabello - mmm...
Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My daughter and I on a day date!

asSQVr48zoZ_i4sxmQDCEQ.text: One of my favorite vegan breakfast places.  Yummy food and friendly staff.  Everything I had tried here was great so just go and enjoy.

ANs8JRnnIprzpGs-Gv-D1Q.text: Waffle maker was down! Before we left Texas we knew we'd eat here and knew we'd order the waffles! Planned that for over a month lol... so that didn't go as planned... so my husband wanted pho instead. No pho! It's considered a soup and they offer a choice a day No one offered a drink. Water and no ice. But I still like them cause there aren't many vegan joints like it! I'll be glad when this truly grows and is a well oiled machine. The waitress was incredibly nice! I love the vibe! But you know how it is when you want something and can't have it... kinda rained on the parade lol

photos.caption: Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States

l0FUNbyMw3VYYF4hWIJZjQ.text: Some things are better than others which is par for the course with vegan food. Overall this place has solid vegan options, great vibe, excellent concept, extensive menu and delicious drinks.

G7bOIcgUNF_ck0UIxE37PQ.text: Just because you have a lot of menu items doesn't mean that quantity = quality. Had a pretty underwhelming meal at The Modern Vegan. I'm puzzled by the rave reviews of this place. The queso dip was served lukewarm and was so sweet. The Mac and Cheese lacked the cheesy zing that many vegan versions of this dish are known to have. Service is slow and chaotic.

RBe6qxjT5C5NDiv8Jk7XPA.text: Truly some of the best vegan comfort food I've ever had, and the vegan Mac n cheese is to die for!!! Portion sizes are really good for the price you're paying, I will definitely be returning!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Cd9Id1CYAXJQXASZylPD8Q.text: Huge menu! Great service! Cheesecake was amazing and so was the sausage gravy and their potatoes! Very happy with the experience. Would like to try more of their food next time! And more cheesecake!!!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States

AyUPCKlYsgX_GwTUhXy9Mw.text: The Best vegan Restaurant in Las Vegas The food is delicious and the service is great I can't wait to go back! Thank you TMV!

yheyJp4wNQgzw6t1vuZ7LA.text: They have a very impressive menu and it's nice to see the owner is there a lot of the time. My only problem was that a couple of us have allergies and she was not quite sure what exactly we could or couldn't eat so we had to play it safe and I still felt like I ate something I shouldn't have. Like I said, great menu and some nice flavors, but if you have any allergies it might not be the best place for you.

ocsJycyCTjbmKkcg9xN5Vg.text: Generous portions in a insta-worthy setting. Definitely order the chicken & waffles and mac n' cheese balls. Love that they have their entire menu all day.

-6c3mtxNvVJNz_3QH2hnqw.text: This is some gourmet food! Amazing!!! Friendly staff and fun atmosphere! This place is worthy of 5 stars but, there's no meals under 10$ that I could find on the menu. A lot of us who are vegan have also chosen to live a more humble lifestyle and it would be nice if there was at least one 8$ meal on the menu for those of us who can't afford the wonderful feasts they have to offer!  I highly recommend this place! One of my new favorites!

fPI3Kvxb3h725WvVB6BZ0w.text: Amazing! The chicken and waffle is a must get. This is the perfect place to get comfort food. Wish there a restaurant closer to my place, i would be there all the time

sdNU-6DvK5VK1LSAeR9MYQ.text: Some of the other reviews are similar to mine. This was the second time I had tried their food but it was the first I ordered through Postmates. I ordered The Buffalo which said it was a " giant breaded Chik'n patty with buffalo sauce " instead what I got was an impossible patty in a bun with lettuce and tomato. I was very disappointed because not only did it cost me $18 just for this burger, but it's something that would usually cost me $8 at Pancho's Vegan Restaurant.  Now the second thing is they made me re-order twice because they had run out of what I was trying to get. I finally picked the popcorn chik'n which cost me $14. It really isn't anything special. Next time I'm just going to walmart and buying a bag of Quorn instead.  So disappointed at the price and the service.

xzDc1vX029mrRRg4j8zipg.text: My daughter and I went on Sunday. I ordered the lobster roll and she settled on the popcorn chick'n after the waffles were sold out but it was ok cause she wouldn't have finished the waffles and the chick'n was excellent as was my lobster roll! We were sad that there were no milkshakes but still loved the vibe of the place. You were super busy but our waitress was phenomenal and got our order in and out sooner than I had ecpected. I appreciated her sincerity on how busy it was but I was totally fine with the wait. What a wonderful experience!

L_gaxgrC9loOhYBX3loF_g.text: We were so excited to eat here after following on instagram and drooling over their posts. Unfortunately our service was poor. First, we ordered the buffalo wings for an appetizer. They came and we had no napkins or utensils. We waited and waited until finally a table seated just above us gave us their basket. Then the server brought our beers and waters. Our water glass had lipstick on it!  The server took it away and brought back a carafe of water. No glass!  WTH. We had the tacos and cowboy burgers. We love having the all plant-based menu...just wouldn't want to be subjected to that kind of service again.

u86Z0MfgWWlD4NwvVJmIPw.text: I've been vegan for a few years now and last year I came to this place had a burger and thought it was really good, service was good from the owner her self. I lived in LA at the time so recently moved to LV and was dying to go here with my bday around the corner decided this would be the perfect place to celebrate. WRONG- walked in with my family of 4 stood at the entrance for 10 min before they came to greet us to be seated, mind you there was 5 employees running around and walked by us a few times and not one said we'll be right with you nothing. And over 6 tables empty. So we get seated by a gentleman that stated your waitress will be right with you, another 10 min later the waitress comes to the table we were ready to order. My 8 yr old just wanted 1 corn dog and fries which she couldn't do so I had to order 4 corn dogs cause the owner wasn't there? Anyways She didn't bring our food out another waitress and a gentleman brought our food out. After 5 min I had to ask the other waitress for my missing items drinks, side sauces etc. cause my waitress was no where to be seen, then after I seen her I waved her down to Inform her that we couldn't eat the nachos they put so much cheese that my chips are all soggy and it was just to much grossed us out you couldn't taste anything else.  I got the Fried chicken and mashed potatoes are super yummy maybe they should pair it with another side The coleslaw needs some flavor I love coleslaw I had 1 spoon of it and didn't touch it after that, needs some pepper some apple cider vinegar brown sugar simple ingredients for coleslaw.  I messaged the owner on IG just to let her know about the service we experience without her there the staff was not on there A game at all when I left I even seen one of the employees on the side on break drinking a tall can of beer. Very unprofessional and this owner should look into having someone run her business better while she's away. And they use plastic bags your vegan invest in eco. Friendly bags.

YUBtlS2dRs2hNOeQjNtP_A.text: This was the most extensive menu for a vegan restaurant I had ever seen! My family is not vegan and they enjoyed the food, but not as much as I did.  Together we all got the Cauliflower Wings (family's favorite), Veggs Benny, Chicken and Waffles (family's second favorite), Steak and Veggs, and the Jerk. The breakfast portions are INCREDIBLY large!!! The other menu options were more reasonably sized. Overall, great food and quick service :)

7kXG2PiJOdd0lNkM9O8pzQ.text: The food is really good and the menu is incredibly diverse. I definitely wanted to try everything and was really pleased with what I got (the V'eggs Benny). The service, however, is not great. The servers are inattentive and disinterested. I would go back but only if I didn't have anything else planned for later.

W6LSr6xyBCRo8OrIhGEZMA.text: This place is incredibly good!!! Went here three times in two days or four times in three days I can't remember I was in a food coma and a total daze! Dishes I tried, Gia, Todd, Mexicana, jalapeno poppers, baked Mac and cheese balls and the fried chicken and waffles!!! Holy moly, amazing staff, the manager Yvette was super nice, hooked up cheesecake for my birthday! Thanks for opening, a blessing to Las Vegas  look forward to seeing you in Cali soon!

ZAmXdQlGq_jf2BnSAPkxLw.text: Amazing food! Terrible Service! The food is absolutely amazing and comes in enormous sized portions well worth the money and wait. However, that's if they even have it in stock. The menu is large but too large. It makes you want to try everything. I was really excited to try the holy hell after the amazing cowboy burger but it was out of stock. The poor waitress explained that the kitchen is kind of all over the place and half the time they don't know what's out of stock till someone orders it since it's so huge. I definitely would come back to this place. I just hope this new business works out all the kinks until then.

taRk2QLJ-KMYWBlw0FYMPw.text: I had such high hopes because of the super extensive & imaginative menu! At first I was impressed on the wait time for the food, it was pretty quick. Followed by the disappointment of realizing it was because the burger was super cold (I ordered the ranchero). Left it at that, didn't want to make a big deal. Then like 20 minutes after leaving, both me and my friend (she ordered the nerd) got horrible stomach cramps & proceeded to have the worst upset stomach that lasted until the next morning.

jTPIfU8As6dG5IIz7az4gQ.text: I have... mixed emotions about this place. First of all, I didn't see the restaurant at first and it's on a one way street, so that was a fun start to the experience (sarcasm).   The location.... leaves a lot to be desired. I could barely find a parking space and the parking lot way fairly dark. The interior of the restaurant is very IKEA/Hipster-esque and I wouldn't say it's bad, but I wouldn't say it was exactly my cup of tea either. Everything feels a bit cramped and the lighting kind of reminded me of a hospital. My biggest note about the ambiance of the whole restaurant is that HOLY S/&@ the music is LOUD. I almost feel sorry for people who choose to go here for dinner with their friends/family/whoever because you'd be lucky to hear half of the things they say to you. I think my ears were ringing when we exited the restaurant after.  That being said, the menu is huge (which I'm not a big fan of, but it has its pros and cons) and the options are mostly really appealing. I would not usually spend as much on dinner as I did here, but we came for a special occasion, so I could justify it. The food tasted very junk food-ie. I didn't really like the burger I chose, but it tasted good and over all it wasnt bad, it just wasn't my thing. Boyfriend enjoyed his meal thoroughly and also liked our appetizer.   In conclusion, everything was -good- but it just wasn't exactly up my alley for the reasons above. Everyone was really nice and I can see why TMV is getting rave reviews.

photos.caption: Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nachos (Appetizer)

ByPdDgnt6d-WeQWOE77mXg.text: So the executive assistants decided to go on a lunch date while the directors were stuck in training for the day.  Only one of us is actually vegan, but we've all for the most part experienced it and either don't mind it, or enjoy it.  Anyway, I got the lobster roll with fries and the pasta salad.  The food came quickly, so I was surprised that my fries were cold and slightly soggy.  The lobster roll wasn't bad, but it wasn't good either.  It had a lot of sauce on it.  I honestly don't know what they use for pseudo-lobster, but it felt like potato..I think maybe hearts of palm?  Aside from the sauce, kind of felt like I was just eating more fries.  I was surprised at how heavy it all was.  None of us were able to finish our meals, but I took my roll to go and I do intend to finish...honestly it wasn't terrible, maybe it just wasn't for me.  The only thing I was upset about was the pasta salad.  I didn't get pasta salad.  I got mac salad.  If it said "mac salad" on the menu, I wouldn't have ordered it.  That might seem really trivial, but coming from Hawaii, mac salad is kind of a big deal and it actually helps me separate good mainland Hawaiian restaurants from the bad ones.  When ordering it, I guess I expected something more like an anti-pasta...with olive oil or vinegar or something...just not vegan mayo.    I see a lot of reviews complaining about service.  We were sat right away.  Food came fast.  Server checked on us a few times, answered questions about the menu we had.  She was friendly and not intrusive.  I didn't have any issues at all, in fact I think the manager came to check on us too.  Whoever she was, she was making rounds checking on tables.  Overall not the worst experience, just nothing really stood out; at least not  in a positive way.

photos.caption: Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States

sF6Tlqk2HKIG30A4fOnd-w.text: Waitstaff was awesome. Our party was 14 people and they knocked themselves out for us, Lots of great options and the bar drinks were tasty.  Would definitely go back.

p7cC0HNy5ZqJSkoCXhGQWw.text: Disappointed. Really wanted to like this place. Ordered eggplant sandwich to go and it was frozen in the middle! Had to bring it back and they only remade it and didn't offer anything for the inconvenience. After all that, it wasn't even that good tasting. So sad cuz I had high hopes for this place

5Me1NbxbsxK1jufkWuqt4w.text: Love this place. It's my go to vegan place whenever I'm in town. Great selection, great price and awesome food.

t-BUUh7GqxIVlEZdC2UWQA.text: WOW. JUST WOW! I wish I could give more than 5 stars for this one. This is not simply good vegan cuisine.  THIS IS AMAZINGLY DELICIOUS FOOD. PERIOD.  If you're reading reviews and trying to decide if you should dine here- I'll be the one to say it. The answer is YES. You NEED to experience the culinary genius that is The Modern Vegan. Mark my words this spot will become a popular and well known vegas destination before you know it!   Herbivore and carnivores unite because everything we ordered was beyond delicious.   Where do I even begin? My cousin and I decided to pop in after a day at the pool. We were greeted with a warm and friendly ambiance along with open arms. The restaurant is so chic and fabulous. Honestly it's every insta foodies dream.  The manager was so kind to take the time to seat us and fill us in on the interesting backstory of the incredibly talented  woman who is behind this fun and vibey joint.   After being seated, were promptly greeted by our server who was more than willing to give suggestions. (Which we appreciated) The menu was unlike anything I've ever seen. It's ENORMOUS actually. The options are endless. Which as a non meat eater, I felt as though I had just hit some sort of jack pot!   We decided to order the club with vegan bacon and the buffalo chicken sandwich and split both down the middle so that we can share.   THE FOOD. No words that I type on this review will even come close to expressing how unbelievably delicious BOTH sandwiches are. The buffalo chicken sandwich was SPOT ON. The texture, the flavor, and even the appearance. With our first bite we both let out an unintentional food moan as our eyes grew as big as saucers. My world was officially shook. Everything about this buffalo chicken sandwich was pure perfection. The selfish foodie in me was honestly a bit bummed I had to share in that moment....  but now after experiencing it I want to share this place with everyone!   The club sandwich was equally as life changing. It was monstrous in size and so so so tasty. I couldn't get over the bacon. It tasted just like a traditional club sandwich. This club had cucumbers- which happened to be one of our favorite things about this club. It gave the most delicious crunch with each bite.   We ordered both sandwiches with french fries. (Good decision on our part because the fries are super yum)   I honestly don't think there was a single morsel of food left on our plates. Throughout the entire duration of our dining experience we could not stop talking about how phenomenal the food was. Even hours after we ate, we were still talking about the pure creativity and deliciousness of what we experienced. Later that night we were TEXTING each other about. My mouth is no joke watering thinking about our meal just while typing this review. THATS HOW AMAZING THIS FOOD IS.   The Modern Vegan is a new favorite- and I am already planning a trip back-  not even a full day after dining there for the first time!   Thank you TMV for creating a fun and groundbreaking dining experience for those of us who do and dont eat animal meat!

lC4KN6KIKl4-qp9bJxCa1g.text: Wow! I'm surprised at some of the complaints about this place! I get that there are off nights at places, but some people must be super hard to please! I came here with my sister tonight after hearing how much some of her coworkers love TMV. The location, in my opinion, is cool. It's close enough for tourists, but it's also tucked away on a small street across from The Double Down (easy enough for locals). The restaurant itself is in an unassuming building, and while one review critiqued it as feeling "IKEA/hipster," to me, it just felt modern and clean. My sister, who is not vegan, pointed out how beautifully diverse the clientele was. It's definitely not just the downtown/hipster crowd.   The waitress we had was great! (Unfortunately, I didn't get her name.) Very professional and friendly-- she took time to talk with guests, but she was quick and efficient. They were out of the corn dogs, which my sister was bummed about as she heard they're awesome, but they have so many other options, that you really can't complain. I guess that's one thing that always gets me about reviews-- sometime people throw full blown temper tantrums over restaurants running out of popular items. Unless the restaurant is consistently out of like everything, you really gotta reevaluate your life if the one time it happens to you, you throw a hissy fit. Like, you're in Vegas ordering a moderately-prices delicious vegan meal, is your life really all that awful because you can't have one thing on a 100+ item menu? \_()_/   As for the food, my sister and I split an order of popcorn chicken and the All American Burger (I think that's what it was called!). It was all delicious! The sriracha mayo sauce that came with the popcorn chicken was really delicious, and the burger was perfect! I'm pretty sure the patty was a Beyond Burger patty-- that was what it tasted like anyway, but the toppings all really came together nicely. The portions are big, so sharing with friends is totally a good plan. It's nice to try a little of everything. Unfortunately we were way too full to try any of the deserts, but we will definitely be back for one in the near future! Awesome find!

D7yOIjhvKZ3sQSZ_-WDgAg.text: The Modern Vegan is one of the best things to happen to the Las Vegas vegan community recently. I was smitten with TMV after I first perused its expansive menu. In the ~5 times I've been here, I've barely even made a dent in checking off menu items off my list. Thus far, I've been happy with 95% of the food I've tried.   CORN DOGS ($11): This appetizer is a meal in itself since it comes with 4 giant corn dogs. Greasy perfection. 5/5 MAC & CHEESE SIDE ($5): Better than most vegan mac & cheeses I've tried, but not sure if it's omni approved. 3.5/5 GYRO ($14): The sauce and gyro plant-meat are amazing! But the pita bread is awful thick. 4/5 LOUISIANA FRIED CHICKEN ($15): My absolute favorite thing to eat here. My husband's too. The mashed potatoes and mushroom gravy are to die for. 5/5 V'EGGS BENNY ($15): Not my cup of tea. Not bad, but not great either. Too saucy. 3/5 THE BUFFALO ($14): A buffalo chicken sandwich. Another winner. 5/5 OH MY GOD ($10): A chocolatey dessert. Good, but a small portion for the price. I wish the brownie was softer and warmer. The chocolate ice cream was awesome. 4/5 DRINKS: Expensive AF, so I stick to water. The downer here is that the glasses are teeny tiny and refills are usually hard to come by.   As you can see, there's a plethora of options to choose from at TMV. This restaurant is my go-to for meals with friends.  YELP'S 2018 REVIEW CHALLENGE: #17

wzlyzmwqckcRSfTenzDjtg.text: I'm so sad... this was my first time and the entire experience was extremely disappointing.  Stood up front a hot minute and waited even longer for water and someone to take my order. Wish I got the waitresses name, she was super sweet at least.. The only thing I got to eat was the pulled pork on a pretzel bun (dripping in grease) which took 30min. It was just okay - I wouldn't recommend it. I also settled for cold soggy fries instead of sweet potato because they were out. I tried to order the mac n cheese bites but they were out of mac n cheese too (what?). Half way through my sandwich I ordered my dessert because of how long everything was taking. About 5 min after I was finished she finally came to let me know they were out of Oreos... like is this all foreal?! Service - slow. Food - overpriced. Environment - cute but loud (bar seats are not comfy). Location - weird. Like I first stated, extremely disappointed  Maybe this was an off day, I might give them a second try.

HEGzxc40pSLgx5cUUhwIDw.text: We finally made it to TMV. I've been wanting to go there every time we head into Las Vegas but something always comes up and we haven't been able to. Happily, we made it this time and this little gem will be one of the first places we head to when we come back next time.  Our waiter, Scott was super upbeat, helpful and made our dining experience even more pleasurable. The food...delicious! The vibe...modern for sure, thus the name! We tried the v'eggs Benny. Though delicious, the hollandaise sauce was a bit thick and a little too sweet for my liking. My hubby loves the sweet and savory but agreed that the sauce probably could have been thinned a bit. The portion was huge and splitting this dish a good option. The char on the tofu was really flavorful. I loved the savory part best. We tried the V Lobster roll. It was a pleasant change from the typical vegan sandwiches you can find other places. We had yummy smoothies and topped off our meal with the "Baby Baby!" Oh wow! Dessert on steroids! It was a chocolate and peanut butter sandwich that was deep fried and sprinkled with powdered sugar. It was like a beignet and fritter had a baby and the baby was gorgeously beautiful! Highly recommend! Say Hi to Scott for us too!

RAtH7eCQgexxSfChOpAf6A.text: There's a few menu items that stand out, the buffalo chicken burger and Louisiana fried chicken are great.  Prices are crazy for some of the selections. $11 for the popcorn chicken (see pic) The pieces are probably size of a nickel maybe smaller  You can't call in a to-go order by phone. Only through grub hub where prices are increased. Seems like when you would previously call it was the owners personal cell phone.   Location leaves a lot to be desired.

lnInwaA2kNBg83xrRo0Gsw.text: This place was super close to airport and definitely a place I would stop in from the airport before headed into the Strip. We had dessert and it was amazing. We will be returning here frequently to try other items on the menu. Chicken and Waffles is on my list.   Future review coming on the food.  Came back the next day and Suzy at the bar hooked me up again. Helped me pick the next set of desserts to try. LOVED THEM.   I will be making this a regular stop every time when I'm in Las Vegas.

flhUiH_wj78hhrQ6hSzz7A.text: Loved the food quality, variety, and portions here! We wanted a vegetarian dinner so decided to eat here. It's only 7-10 mins from the strip - best to Uber over. I do want to say that the location of the restaurant is a little strange. It is located in a small, rather desserted off-strip market complex alongside of a 7-Eleven. It has a tinted black cover on its windows that doesn't give away how it looks from inside. That is a little weird! Although, as soon as you enter the restaurant, it looks pretty modern with all-white, contemporary decor. It is pretty big and has a lot of seating.  We ordered three items to split between four people - and spoilers - it was TOO MUCH! The portions are huge. We ordered the Breakfast Buddha Bowl, Breakfast Burritos, and Breakfast Tacos. All three were great, with the buddha bowl really standing out for me. It was made with zoodles, tofu scramble, and lots of veggies! I loved their preparation. I would just want you to REALLY think about how much you order if you don't want to box much of your food :)  Their menu is huuuge! So whenever I am in Vegas next, I will be going back to try something else and some dessert too :)

l6XKMUDh-vlkpaV5TDFsyQ.text: Last night I I went with friends to this restaurant. We are all plant based but one of them was also Celiac. Their menu has plenty of Gluten Free options.  We went super excited to try their food. My friend ordered two appetizers, Their Breakfast Potato and Loaded Nachos, both marked with GF. When the appetizers arrived, He wanted to order Burger (they do offer gluten free bun) with fries. Their fries also marked with GF on the menu but because of past bad experiences with "fries" He asked if they fry something with gluten in the same fryer. Since the waitress was new, he could not answer the question, so he went to the Chef to ask. In the meantime, He ended up eating 2 nachos. The waitress returned and said that their fries are not gluten free since the fried something with gluten in the same fryer. Therefore, also the Nachos and the breakfast potatoes are not gluten free. Too late for my friend!!!!  He was confused because on the menu the nachos and the breakfast potatoes were marked GF, and He could not see any warning on their menu about cross contamination. He asked the waitress to please call the chef so she can explain better what options are and to provide my friend with answers why they mark it GF when it is NOT!!!  Well, the waitress came with another person that claimed she is a "dietitian" and both apologize on behalf of the chef because the chef was "too busy". The person said that the do have 2 separate fryers but sometimes they just use one fryer to fry all their food. The Chef did not come out to say nothing!!! And when I got the bill, I was in shock to see that they did not even give discount for their mistake. My friend did not want to create a scene in the restaurant because we were with other guests. He just kept my self-calm and asked me to write this review. They definitely knew they were doing something wrong marking GF on their food when it is not!!!! My friend couldn't sleep the whole night, end up vomiting and having severe stomach pain. I wrote this review not to put their food down, the food was delicious. This restaurant should not mark their food GLUTEN FREE when in reality they don't use the dedicated gluten free fryer. This show lack of education!!! So, if you are Celiac, DO NOT go to this restaurant!!!!

m-1C54ix7LnCa45PCf6pzw.text: Shut the front door with this place! Are you stink Academy every single thing on the menu is vegan! I'm talking chicken and waffles I'm talking grill cheese sandwiches, salads, soups, ice cream, pasta, I'm talking spicy crispy chicken sandwiches... Deep fried peanut butter and jelly sandwiches!!! The list goes on and on and on!   I mean give me a freaking break the parking is easy, the menu is huge, the staff is crazy accommodating, the price is right, They have cool stuff on the TVs, they have a full bar, they have plenty of room to accommodate big parties, and it's super close to the airport... and the food is absolutely epic! I have brought tons of people here that are not vegan but I absolutely love the place and have come on their own with coworkers and or family and friends just to have them go thru the same amazing experience.  The bar area is great to be able to pop in and grab something quick with a beer or a cocktail, or you can sit in the normal dinning area and take your time. Depending on what's happening in town this place can get a little bit dizzy the wait is never that bad.  The ambience here is super trendy with white furniture and white walls. Great music playing and great friends... makes a great time!   This is definitely a place that you're gonna want to check out! Vegan or not!

_WtJ6KRbI3NGPE5rPzj1mw.text: Definitely one of the best vegan meals I've ever had!! That's a heavy statement, considering how many vegan meals I've had. But the validity tho   For a starter my friend and I shared the jalapeno poppers. They were bangin'! I ordered the chick'n and waffles! It was massive. Definitely enough for 2 people to share. It was so yummy! They unfortunately were out of mashed potatoes. Which now that I think about it, is weird, because they had French fries. So if the mashed potatoes were homemade and fresh they could have made them. Anyways I got fries instead. And was still stunned by the whole meal! The chicken pieces had a wonderful consistency and paired so nicely with the waffle. My friend had the Louisiana fried chick'n. I tried a few bites. It was also an exceptional meal.   This place is a little ways from the strip but worth the trek. Highly recommend!

7LyiLJpP0rHv4nQ3gtRlhA.text: First Vegan restaurant that I have gone to.   Confused when I looked at the menu and it had Burgers, Corn Dogs, etc.   Server was great at explaining the Vegan Meat.   I opted for the Falafel but friend got burgers.  I have to say, everything was amazing and the burger would have fooled me in a kind taste.    Texture and taste was spot on.

aorr6sFqGaEzyMxQPWKnQA.text: I'm really glad I came back and tried these guys again, as my first experience was just ok. The service was amazing (thank you Suzy you're so precious)! I got the pulled pork sandwich in a pretzel bun (ITS NOT JACK FRUIT!) and it melted in my mouth and was juicy with delish bbq sauce. Chef Ashley came out and talked for a second and she was super nice too! Bf got breakfast tacos which were a great portion of 3 and exemplary in taste. Everything here is reasonably priced, the highlight being $4 ginger turmeric shots (yes please). I will definitely come back again!

photos.caption: Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Foods

T36bjsuhvPBkdV4acJzY0w.text: Anytime I visit Las Vegas one of the things I have to do is eat at a vegan restaurant. With so many wonderful choices it is hard to pick just one. But this restaurant had lots of great reviews so it is the one that we finally settled on.   It is located in the Naples plaza. The main store in this plaza that you'll see on the corner is a 7-Eleven. The decorations inside the restaurant are modern, just like the name. The food is all vegan.   Everything we ordered was delicious and beautifully presented. We ordered the spaghetti with meatballs, which also comes with two pieces of garlic bread. The meatballs are not made from an animal but they taste very realistic. We also got a side of macaroni and cheese. It has crumbles of bacon, fake bacon, in it. The macaroni and cheese is some of the best I've ever tasted. And we got a CosmoPolitan smoothie. It is made with blueberries, banana, and peanut butter. It's really yummy.   The wait staff is friendly and helpful. There are no kid menus but there are side dishes that can be made into A kids meal. But overall the restaurant is not really designed with kids in mind, which is fine, but just to keep in mind if you are planning on bringing a bunch of kids like we did lol.

o48PosJtjI8EoZ7Np2GmCQ.text: Obsessed! I've been looking for new vegan places to try out and I'm so so sooooo glad I found this place. First off, it's amazing to be able to look at a menu and choose from any food dish knowing it's vegan-friendly. It totally takes the stress out of eating. Secondly, the menu is HUGE! Go be vegan and have so many dishes to choose from is incredible. And breakfast options?! Sold and sold.  We started with the chips, salsa, guac and queso. You can tell the queso isn't "real" cheese but omgggggg it's delicious! It's soy-based and not cashew-based as I originally thought. My friend got the pad Thai and it was great. The peanut sauce taste is prominent but I love that in pad Thai so I was extremely happy with my sample of that dish. I got the teriyaki chicken sandwich and holllyyyyy moly so, so good. They literally have anything you can think of on this menu... we saw a chicken and waffles dish go by.... I was genuinely shocked something like that could be made vegan and look as good as it did to boot.   The onlyyyyyy downside to my experience here was the initial wait. I'm fine with waiting to be sat but no one even came to the front to acknowledge we were there... the couple ahead of us ended up pulling someone aside to ask about being sat. Even just a "be right with you" would have been sufficient. Once we were sat, the service was quick- our food was out well within a reasonable amount of time. The place is a bit small but there's a good mix of small and large tables so you can dine as a group or couple.   This is without a doubt one of my new favorite spots to eat! Even if you're not vegan, you may just love it. My friend isn't a vegan and he is already talking about going back.   P.S. the portions are big!

1t4ua3QY9M0J-Q-HuJCqNA.text: Pricey but this is he best vegan restaurant in all of Vegas. Weirdly enough you won't even notice you're eating vegan! Absolutely everything was amazing.   The restaurant is aesthetically pleasing. I absolutely loved  the look. Super white inside and it works  The service was great, our waiter always made sure we were ok and liking the food.   The food was out of this world. Never had I had vegan food like this. The Big Mac was my top burger I've ever had. Everything tasted fresh and cooked to order. If you're vegan come here!

P-Fc51Wa-TOiVbldftof6w.text: Very cool place.  Go on a Thursday when they have a burger that is exactly like a Big Mac without the meat!!! You'd NEVER KNOW IT!!!!  Avoid the buffalo cauliflower - very odd. The sauce literally was burning our eyes (very peculiar taste too).  Mango toast is great.  Beet salad - delish.  Decent drink selection.  Good time had by all.

qBcU9o4AFhs6uMg8JxCVbA.text: Plant based peeps:  Do not leave Vegas without a meal here!! You will swoon!  A+++  HUGE delish portions and a so many FUN options on this menu!  100% vegan takes on comfort foods you definitely crave after a long night out in Vegas.  Bottomless mimosas:  pick your juice(s) too!!  I loved my pineapple cranberry mimosas.  The waffle options so fabulous you may wipe away a tear of joy.    Very close to UNLV.  In a kind of sketchy-ish area, but not too bad.  Easy close parking in private lot shared with a few other businesses. Place is nice and clean inside, modern and casual. Well lit.  Lots of seating. Service was very friendly and pretty darn fast.  The bartender came out himself to refill our bottomless mimosas while checking if we liked them.  I really cannot wait to return.  Tried the chick'n and waffles, which came out literally the size of a derby hat.  These waffles would have been delicious dry and alone,  but they were sitting atop probably two cups of homemade mashed potatoes, sandwiching a golden crispy fried chick'n filet, and gloriously enveloped in maple syrup.  Two asparagus spears adorned the top, looking like tiny antennas on a carbtastic heap of goodness.

pquBgNHnK8s3Fb-3wF7Iwg.text: Been meaning to give this a try since they opened recently.  Last night we dropped in and were mostly pleased with it except that there are some service issues that need to be addressed. One, they brought my plate out alone and my fiance's over five minutes later. Two, we asked for extra mayo on the side and they neglected to bring it out llke we asked, and 3, servers hardly come by, they're just not enough of them. They should address that or consider going to a counter-order system like Tocaya uses.  Being a cool, all-vegan restaurant is great, bravo!  But careless service is deal-breaker.  They should also hang tapestries or something to absorb sound, the noise level was intrusive.

e_RowGWwpbSFzcTfVIySAA.text: Had to check out this new vegan joint with veganized American comfort food. First off, decor is awesome. Modern, chic, new and clean, it's a great place for families, couples or a group. There is a bar area with screens for sports fans. Now the menu. Huge. Anything you are craving, they have. We got the fried 'chicken' with mash potatoes and slaw and the Thai Asian salad. I think because the seasoning was lumped in one area of the chicken, I got an entire mouthful of salt my first bite in. That was a little harsh and hence the one star off. The salad was nice, fresh and colorful. Another reason for the one star knock off is that our waitress brought our ice cream sundae 10min into our meal, so that all the ice cream pretty much melted by the time we got to it. Service is fast otherwise and off the beaten path away from the strip so parking easy.

photos.caption: Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Louisiana Fried Chick&#39;n

rth5PsnKCmc8RjuZZfLJ_Q.text: Where do I even start?! So many delicious options it was so hard to choose. My sister and I split the biscuits and gravy and the special of the day was a Monte Cristo... what?!?! It was crunchy, sweet/savory deliciousness. The portions here are fairly large so don't be afraid to split a plate. Our group was 2 vegans and 2 others(lol) whom thoroughly enjoyed their buffalo wrap and breakfast quesadilla as well.   The price point matched the food quality, service, and serving size. It's located in a small strip mall by UNLV. This place is a must try and I will definitely be back to try out more of the menu on future Vegas vacays.

Ze0FBLygZpWNoqA90_UiCw.text: HUGE fully vegan menu to choose from. We ended up sharing the "what happens in Vegas" breakfast which was incredible!!! (A note to the chefs -- add kala namak black salt to your tofu scramble, it makes a huge difference!! Or add more if you already use it)   I can't wait to return to this restaurant next time I'm in Vegas because I want to try every menu item (which would take years).   Our server was great. So friendly and knowledgeable- attentive too.

dp9fVlo3ba3FGU7P-WH2ow.text: This is an amazing vegan restaurant in Vegas! So glad I got to check it out on my recent trip. The menu is incredible--so many unique options! There were so many things I've never seen done vegan before! And trust me, I've been to MANY vegan restaurants and festivals and what not, I thought I'd seen it all but nope! I love the approach of making vegan food fun and exciting and well, MODERN.   I decided to go with the vegan gyro, simply because I haven't had a gyro in over 10 yrs and I have never seen a vegan one! Now, I don't even remember what gyros taste like so I can't say if it was realistic, but I definitely enjoyed the sandwich! I think the only thing is I wish there was more sauce , that may just be a personal preference though. The fries on the side were crispy and yummy! Ask for a side of ranch--theirs is delish with fries.  I also tried some of my family's food. All American burger was solid vegan burger goodness. Stuffed portobello steak (?) was surprisingly delicious. But my favorite was the Louisiana fried chick'n! Oh my godddddd. The chicken was good and was served on top of a delightful cloud of mashed potatoes--which were bomb! The portions are quite big and we were all stuffed but we sure saved room for dessert!  Their dessert menu was so poppin we couldn't resist! I had the hardest time deciding but we ultimately went with the I love you (I'm pretty sure). It was a icecream sundae served with a fried banana. Need I say more? So good!!  Our server was super friendly and very helpful--he gave us plenty of great recommendations. He took good care of us! The restaurant had a clean, modern aesthetic which I found to be unique but very cool.  Overall, my family and I had a great meal and experience. I'm a little bummed I live in LA because I think this may be one of the best vegan restaurants I've been to! If I'm in Vegas again I will DEFINITELY be hitting up this spot again!

photos.caption: Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I Love You -- fried banana ice cream sundae. A junk food vegans dream come True
Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegan gyro -- my first gyro in over 10 yrs!!

cTsuwL9LDrSAjEu3HcccAg.text: Pro: Waiter very nice. The gravy on the biscuits and gravy was delicious. Popcorn chick'n was over cooked but still very tasty (would order again). Also the indoor aesthetic is very nice!   Tip: Don't ever order the jerk chicken sandwich, it tastes so plain - definitely doesn't deserved to be labeled as "jerk" or any other type of seasoning for that matter. The tomato on the sandwich was also sliced far too thick. Poor execution overall.   What's worse is that a staff member asked me how everything tasted...looking at the 3/4 of the sandwich still on the plate, I mentioned that the jerk chicken sandwich should be removed from the menu and that the gravy (on the biscuits and gravy) was delicious. This prompted no request to have me order something else, no attempt to discount my bill. I still paid and tipped the waiter. But I do think you all should know in my 17 years of being plant based, I've never been so disappointed with a sandwich.   I imagine that other things on the menu might be  delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Biscuits &#39;N&#39; Gravy

AgcFiXC3eO_CnUHh1R8s9A.text: All these cool vegan places are opening up in Vegas. It's certainly gotten healthier dining options than it had. This one is located close to UNLV. It gets many college students, but it's okay for everyone. The whole menu is vegan, so there's no need to ask questions about if something is vegan.   I had the Reuben the first time here. It's about $12 for the sandwich and a salad. The price is kind of high but you get a lot of food for that. It's a pretty big sandwich. The "corned beef" is made from tofu I think. It comes with a very good vegan cheese. This doesn't taste fake like some of the kinds in stores. It comes with a side of your choice. The salad isn't outstanding, but it came with a good dressing and was a nice compliment to the heavy sandwich.   It has a large menu. So many things to check out. They are also open for breakfast, so lots of options for any time.

photos.caption: Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States

dAo6EMAt1I4IwtkldiRqxg.text: This place is the bees knees of vegan/vegetarian food that I've tasted. I ordered the fish tacos, ginger and turmeric shot, and lemonade. My homeboy ordered the avocado toast and waffle Athena and the ginger and turmeric shot as well. The food is delicious. We literally had no complaints. The ginger and turmeric was fresh pressed and all ingredients were top of the line fresh. I'm flabbergasted honestly. Glad this place is a few steps away while I'm here. The service here is nice. The decor is hip and cool. They have dark tinting like a club, we thought they were closed. The music is fabulous. The classics are played. Simply Devine!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States

W7gWF7qJZ1QYSYi7grXWAw.text: First time ordering from them, I had Postmates deliver to me at work. I ordered the BBQ sandwich on a Pretzel bun. It was delicious! My boss also ordered the cauliflower buffalo bites. I didn't get to try them but they look like they were cooked to perfection.

WzLspEDn7Wign4APJEFAZA.text: The food was good, but the service was slow. Had to wait for order to be taken and had to wake for my check.

Qun2TEtpHWUqBSgpTb9iWA.text: Update- After receiving a snarky response from this restaurant on their Facebook page, I was done giving this place another chance. Now, 16 days later, I get the response I should have gotten in the first place. But Gia, let me ask you; if a few people sent it back already, why did you continue to use the sauce? Shouldn't you have pulled it and remade it immediately? I'm not coming back and I've been showing your initial response to all my fellow vegans. I'm happy to add this one as well.

orp9f19nzVCd1MKH4RI41Q.text: Went today and it was just ok. The thing I love most about being vegan is how good you feel even after a big meal. That's not the case here - very greasy/oily/over processed foods. I felt awful after. I'll still leave 3 stars because it is what it is, vegan junk food has it's place occasionally.  I don't recommend the gyro though. Something just tasted so off.. and it certainly was not served on a pita. Also what's with the weird tasting warm water with no ice....?  We will probably give this place another shot but I'll keep my expectations much lower the second time around.

PrjUW4QHRH0q-qf8xqsXpQ.text: Super good food, everything tastes amazing. I usually do Postmates so I've tried almost everything but when I came in for my first time the cooks didn't have the best attitude when my friend had to fix her order. I get it though! Other than that I love the dog videos playing.  Chairs could be more comfy they're completely plastic.  Great lunch + late night spot!

5YNwPl-j-9w3cTAhgVePew.text: This place is the boom! I deliver for postmates, which is a food and etc... delivery service. I pick up here all the time and the food looks delicious and smells good. I've decided to try it out even though I'm not Vegan, it's kinda like Vegan Comfort food. Everyone was pleasant, my waitress was very helpful, she let me know which food to try out since I'm not a True Vegan, lol. I got the onion rings and chicken and waffle plate, and I love it. I did suggest to the waitress that they should have several sampler plates, that way, people like me can get a little taste of different foods to try, before they order something and don't like it when they taste it.

gQWsUTdatdP3my1TPjauUA.text: This is the 1st and the last place my daughter and I had our vegan meal when we were in Vegas. This IS a must visit vegan venue when you are in Vegas. The staff, specially Steffen and Yvette, were really awesome! They'll be opening a California location in October, we were told. Will definitely take a drive there. Sometimes, wish vs they are closer

piTCNvaK6VkZJXjmqjn1ww.text: My lousiana fried chickn was quite good. Tho mashed potato and gravy was little bland. I like spicy food & probably expected it to be spicy. Mushroom gravy poutine was really good. Hubby had double burger and I liked that BBQ flavor. The portion sizes are huge. 2 big eaters couldn't finish everything and left very full & satisfied. My carnivore husband wants to go back for my lousiana chickn sandwich. Curb appeal needed a little work. Windy day brought trash right in front of their main entrance.

rLX-kQfrowRDLeN0LUJUcg.text: I wish there was a rating higher than 5 for my experience here tonight. when I placed my order, I let our server avery know that I have a severe nut allergy. avery and the chef went above and beyond to make recommendations that catered my allergies. I cannot say how much it meant to me how kind and understanding they were and still gave me a delicious meal on top of that. they did it with so much heart and it was truly a memorable, tailored experience.

YQqjlgDf0VzLVcAkkizanQ.text: Food isn't consistent. Hopefully with time they'll work out all the kinks but I wouldn't bring Omni friends or family here ever again.

e5ZSkdp3lACtafwK8FH8KA.text: Nice service, good atmosphere, very clean, yummy green curry, and we didn't have to wait forever to get our food. Two thumbs up!

BAyuu7F9FHH7qRETDLPqtg.text: Very disappointed with this one.  Food wasn't that good, quality isn't top-notch so it's very pricey for what you're getting. And I didn't realize the place was super loud! It was like walking into a club where you have to yell so you can hear each other.  Sorry, but I'm not a fan of this vegan place.

Pzssz99lbrS5zXNoIlNR9Q.text: Came in to the modern vegan Thursday night around 3, the food was great but service was even better. Scott the bartender was very fast and friendly, great personality and service. Will definitely be coming back soon!

mGNB8aEzax854hZoi3owJQ.text: Sadly, this is the second time I've really been turned off here. The first was when I called to order something to be picked up on my way to work. I dont use credit cards, she said she'd let me do it this "once." The sandwich was $15 and I paid with a $20. Fully expecting me to answer "No I don't need any change" when asked she was visibly disappointed when I said "Yes" and only gave her $3 instead of the $5 and pat on the head she felt she deserved for my "One time only special cash pick up" exception. Ugh.  Im not a fast learner apparently because I actually went back last week lol and found a note on the door, closed until Oct 10th. ?? Hungry today I thought maybe I can find out what's going on so I called. Low and behold they're open. I asked the girl what happened, just you know, curious, I had changed lunch plans with a friend the day I saw the note (VEGENATION DOWNTOWN ROCKS) just a simple 5 second answer would have been the polite thing, and she just hung up on me!!! Lol this is Las Vegas, I don't expect a lot but I'm MONEY on the phone, to just hang up on me?? I gave her the benefit of the doubt and called back. Asked her again what happened and she hung up on me AGAIN. Ugh 15 dollars for a sandwich x 2 x a week. Thats over $1500 in a year this place won't be seeing from me because a snotty little girl didn't feel like being polite. AND I'll NEVER recommend this place or bring a friend, AND my experience will be shared with anyone who'll listen, so add some more dollars on top of that.

FPL2jLyapuJCZlIw8-iQTA.text: Menu is impressive but the server let us know right away that they were out of most of the items. Food was O-K. The breakfast burrito and potato's it came with were COLD and the burrito wasn't even wrapped so I had it eat it with a fork and knife.Service was pretty bad. Not rude or anything but In their own world and not attentive at all. Took 10 min to bring us hot sauce for the burrito and maple syrup for our waffles. When I asked for syrup the server seemed confused like oh more syrup? When literally there was nothing on the waffles. Overheard the owner telling customers that she doesn't care about bad reviews and that she will reply and tell them to never come back... don't know why you would take pride in that. Extremely loud in here too. Don't expect to be able to talk to whoever your with. There's a lot better vegan restaurants in LV...

I30B_F49wBkm9cKbmxM6Tw.text: I was really looking forward to eating here, as this restaurant has an extensive menu.  However, we ended up leaving after sitting for half an hour with absolutely no service, with the exception of being given some menus and a couple of glasses of water when we were first seated. So, if you aren't really hungry and have some time to kill, then this is the place for you.

50za2Ob69bFFsNcthr33LQ.text: So many options!! I love everything I've tried. The owner is super awesome, the staff is really friendly, and the atmosphere is cool. I will definitely keep coming back. :)

FHYfdNZWL6Ef0M5cr8AIJg.text: Absolutely loved the food, I'm not vegan but my boss convinced me to come it was such a cool place. The macaroni was so good tastes like really Mac and cheese with a twist. The avocado appetizers were super bomb love those. The potatoes were probably my favorite don't forget to order those. And also tried there "club" honestly was so good so fresh either cucumber and tomato and lettuce not heavy at all. Don't wanna miss out on this place. Even if your not vegan promise you will find something really good.

PNTAangucTsnMVvcQHY3vQ.text: This place was absolutely amazing! I went with my Bf and my friend(neither of them are vegan) and they thought the food was amazing! When we first entered, we were greeted with a smile by the woman at the door and we were seated immediately. The place is super cute inside and a lot bigger than I was expecting. The decor is so cute and the windows are all tinted so you're not catching and glares or heat from the outside. The menu has to be one of the most extensive vegan menus I have ever seen and I'm used to vegan restaurants because Los Angeles has a ton. This was definitely the biggest selection I have ever seen. It was as overwhelming as the Cheesecake Factory menu. They have breakfast options, wraps, burgers, salads, Thai inspired dishes, Mexican inspired dishes, and a bunch of desserts. Their portions are really big so keep that in mind. I ordered the buffalo chicken sandwich and my BF got the chicken and waffles. We could not finish both as they don't play around with the portions lol. Both were so good. The breading on their chicken is so crunchy and the chicken tastes so bomb! My friend could not believe he was eating vegan chicken. He was thoroughly impressed. I wish I could have tried more off of the menu, but we were stuffed afterwards. Also, they don't allow you to sub the onion rings for the fries, even at an additional charge. I was kind of bummed about that since you don't find many places with vegan onion rings. They do have it as a side order but I knew French fries and onion rings would have been too much food. I also got their strawberry rum drink called Desert Crush and it was so good!! When I am back in Vegas, I will be sure to hit this place up again!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Buffalo Sandwich
Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Desert Crush
Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and Waffles

c6jHrn2IgkvMPj2RZxmdYg.text: Love love love this place, the lobster roll was amazing! Also the Philly Cheese Steak & my favorite the Chicken & Waffles! I do I wish we lived there but when we are there we will be at The Modern Vegan!

z2FW7T4uZ0FpnPD_AdqYDg.text: I've been a couple times here every time I go to Vegas and it really is our go to vegan spot they have really great customer service the food is amazing make sure to have an appetite because it comes in really large portions

cKZgBiY0tajG4CvbYIebuQ.text: I sure hope the food tastes good because the to-go waitress/bartender was the worst. I sat at the bar to order. I spoke to her. She barley acknowledged me. I guess bucking your eyes and giving a fake smile means hello? I don't know. She didn't even ask if I wanted a drink while I sat there; didn't even offer water. She chatted with the other folks at the bar said, "thank you" and "thanks" to them. When it came to me there was nothing; no conversation. When she finally came over she said "what are you getting?" I gave her my order. I asked for grilled onions instead of raw onions. She acted as if it was a hassle ask about the onions, but order cook did too. He couldn't act too pained though because you can see him through the order/kitchen window. Maybe I shouldn't have asked for grilled onions, lol. Any who, she threw my bill on the counter and rushed away like she was sooooo busy. It didn't seem busy at all, but who knows? I paid. When she finally returned with my change, she placed if so far back that it was close close to falling behind the bar. She made eye contact with the guys next to me. She again made conversation with them and said, "thank you" when she handed them their bill. When she gave me my food she said "thank you" seemingly annoyed because I didn't leave a tip.  Trying to hold on to my initial excitement about eating here, I took my burger with barely grilled onions and left. I came back and asked for a refund. The GM was very nice. She allowed me to keep the food any way. All in all, the food, BFF burger, just was ok. The experience, however, was less than ok.

WKZkb7hzwrIAAF1p7dBtkA.text: Very salty. So salty that I could not finish my food. The cheesecake was so tiny and not worth the price. Really wanted to love this place, but I don't think I'll visit again!

KUrYY4YhA9_8cndXuhzRzA.text: Nom bomb! They have the most extensive vegan menu I haven't ever seen in my freaking life. So excited we found this spot. Huge portions , cute decor, and creative drinks as well. This was super close to the strip too which was convenient.  Open one in Los Angeles please so I can eat here all the time and turn all my friends vegan.
