Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mexicana
Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and waffles

joJEDRLQltlTw1dovySD-g.text: My husband and I had the popcorn chicken, the baked macaroni and cheese, and the Louisiana chicken. The food was delicious . The popcorn chicken came with a dip that was so good. The Louisiana chicken came with coleslaw and mashed potatoes. The chicken was tender and crunchy all at the same time. The only downside I would say was that the Mac and cheese was a little bland. It required a bit more salt n pepper . However, the service was quick and the wait for food was less than 10 min. We were pleasantly surprised when it came back so quick!! When I'm in Vegas again I will surely look this place up again!!!

VMJyDgTq_OjSIHwaGzVgCQ.text: Delicious great tasting food!! Exclusive mordern experience. Phenomenal service. Some of the best high end vegan plates available. Highly recommended.

Wb7BVxbp7rHoKGocSII4Xg.text: I am so excited to have a restaurant like this in Las Vegas. Very hip, casual and fun spot close to the university.  Ambiance was nice and fun service crew.   My hunny ordered "The Buffalo" chicken burger and I ordered the Ruben.   His food was tasty but was served cold. The ranch recipe needs some improvement.  My Ruben was delicious. So happy I don't have to travel to Costa Mesa for a good vegan Ruben sandwich anymore!  There are a ton of items on the menu however,  they were out of many of the options including juice and smoothies.   Considering this is a two week old restaurant, I am looking forward to coming again. Kitchen staff should be on track soon   Ps.  Do not bring your mom. Some of the waitresses taste in their outfit choices will give her a heart attack lol!

8UAVYzHG4bWBSksg3Qb4_g.text: AMAZING spot for vegans and vegetarians. There are over 150 plant-based menu items. My personal favorites, however, are the Chick'n and Waffles and the Mac and Cheese. My only criticism is that the service can be super inconsistent. Usually the service is decent, but there have been a few order mix-ups and long waits. One of the waitresses that never fails to impress is a short Asian/Polynesian(?) woman who usually has a bun in her hair -- sorry, I wish I could remember her name! She's super friendly and every time that she's who comes to take our order, I know the service will be great.

BHhsvMEAKBE9LXguZuUXNA.text: We loved this place, my husband and I. We were visiting Vegas for our anniversary and I looked up vegan spots near our hotel. The Modern Vegan popped up and when I looked at the menu I was sold! We went and I ordered the lobster roll with fries. All I can say is O-M-G!!!! It was so delicious. My husband ordered the bowl with the cereal(rolled oats) and peanut butter, cashews and I believe bananas. He loved it as well. I definitely recommend this place and I definitely will be back next time we visit.

photos.caption: Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ET_dou69wEEkJAWfocj5Lw.text: Just left this place and we were so disappointed because we walked out due to the WORST customer service ever.  We had high expectations for this place.  It was our first time trying it, but will never go back.  As soon as we walked in no one greeted us for about 5 min which seemed very strange because they were not even that busy.  A few employees walked by us and said we will be right with you, which in their language means "I am too busy to help you, but maybe someone else will."  Some lady (looked like the owner) eventually came over and sat us down and just walked away.  No nice welcome.  No drink offer.  No menus.  No service... We waited for 15 min and NOBODY came over to say anything... We started yelling other locations.  Maybe we will find the grace to give it another try some other day.

RzB3DgxTxzBaF2wQhVv5gg.text: Throughly impressed with this place! I've been wanting to try it out for some time and this last weekend I took my boyfriend here with me. Todd took care of us during our meal. He was extremely nice and accommodating and clearly cared about how we enjoyed everything. Food was fantastic! I had the Buddha bowl, my boyfriend had the falafel. Both tasted amazing. I will definitely be coming back here, and sending more people their way!   Side note, this place does have a louder, upbeat vibe so if you're not wanting that atmosphere, I would just order to go.

bhB2d17qmd8RxIedwJzR_w.text: This was actually really delicious! Had the Buffalo burger, Nice spice. Drink Pink Crush, the best drink!!! The price for the portion of the drink I thought seemed little high. Don't mind paying that if it was atleast little larger. But that drink was the absolute Best! Service was really good! People are really nice, place is clean but COLD!

photos.caption: Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Zf3hyf9A3kKGrF_nvaB_zA.text: This place has everything in one spot! Portions are not disappointing and prices are super reasonable! They have a bar :)Atmosphere is way chill and you won't be disappointed!

-KDQP0rzbiJlzWu39W9nGQ.text: I've eaten at this establishment twice during my visit to Las Vegas (June 23rd and June 24th) and I absolutely love this place!  On my first visit I had the Rubin sandwich and my second visit I had the Pulled Pork sandwich and both were amazing!!  I also split some Cauliflower Buffalo Wings with my friend and they were amazing as well!  This place has a really great atmosphere and the staff is incredibly nice.  I can't say enough good things about this place and I definitely plan on coming back here if I ever find myself in Vegas again.  I highly recommend eating here if you enjoy vegan food or if you're curious about vegan food because The Modern Vegan is definitely a good start.

rweErl-SxIn3PKpQapFaRA.text: The French toast was delicious and so was the philly !  They were out of all of the waffles and pancakes. So ican't wait to go back !

uYJhVExCMlSf98AuLSLGpg.text: An awesome restaurant in an awesome location. I loved the decor and especially the extensive menu with so many appealing options. I had the chicken salad sandwich. Creamy chicken with some celery for crunch and cranberries for a hint of sweetness, all served on two thick slices of sourdough. It reminded me of sandwiches my grandma used to make for me--except veganized! One star off for being closed on Monday and Tuesday. I hope their hours will expand after they get past the launch period. Las Vegas is so lucky to have a vegan option like this.

photos.caption: Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stylish interior
Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stylish interior

11V59ElGcMIpPdty9DznOA.text: I am revising my review of The Modern Vegan from a while back, having dined in once, ordered to go twice since, everything was great, the burgers are excellent

x5YJsRoyCKZ6p59R4nMqsw.text: This is hands down the best vegan spot in Vegas. Yes, they are new and they have kinks to iron out- but quality of the food, presentation, atmosphere was amazing! The waiter did inform us of some items that weren't on the menu... honestly, it gave me a reason to come back! Everything we ordered  Louisiana chicken, lobster roll, cauliflower buffalo wings were incredible. I could bring meat eaters here and show them what's up- and not hear a complaint! I recommend it highly! Veganism is not a fad, we're changing the world!

ihlMsWfL86t3AoaDVO2S5Q.text: Love that fact that this establishment is opened till 5am on Thursday Friday and Saturday... love having a Vegan place to go eat at after I get off from work at 1am

mMDaKpkMQ4O7uC-6AyT6EA.text: I have been to many vegan restaurants all across the country from LA to NYC.  The Modern Vegan is by far my favorite of all.  The food is amazing and there is such a variety of dishes to choose from.  It doesn't matter what your in the mood for, they have it!  And all of the staff are knowledgeable and friendly.  Best place EVER!!!!!

0j9E-aYrFafTitpcq262LQ.text: Definitely the best vegan food I've ever had before! Everything tasted better than what they were non vegan!!!!

qRxy80HuSbjkmhIa-t4lFQ.text: Came here for the first time today and from the food, to the service, to the atmosphere this place is all around incredible. It's super hip and trendy with friendly staffs. We ordered the popcorn chicken and "The BFF" burger. The price for a vegan joint is absolutely amazing for what you get. I couldn't even finish all of my food. The presentation of our food was great as well as "instagram worthy." I was honestly so full and satisfied I had to sit in my car for 5 minutes before driving because the food was just THAT BOMB!

photos.caption: Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. &#34;THE BFF&#34; burger - pretzel burger filled with Mac and cheese !

NAJ5UzA0RjVv5VucFPNwfQ.text: This place is amazing. Absolutely 5/5. It was our first time there and we ordered as much as we could just to get a pretty good range of dishes.   They were sold out of the fried cheddar, but we went ahead and tasted the Mac and Cheese. Definitely delicious! Honestly it's in my top three vegan macaroni and cheeses of all time. And I'm picky when it comes to that. Now, understand too that this top-3 Mac and Cheese was the worst thing in this list. Everything else was PHENOMENAL. We ordered corndogs -- the batter is absolutely delicious. Boyfriend had the buffalo burger and if you've read any of the reviews here for it -- you know it's awesome. I went out of my comfort zone and ordered the Louisiana fried chicken with mashed potatoes and gravy. Honestly hats off to our very patient waitress (I wish I'd gotten her name but she knows who she is!) who convinced me to give the gravy a try (I was afraid it would have a strong taste of mushroom when I saw the pics and that's just not my thing)! But it was AMAZING. Tender, juicy, savory and spiced perfectly. There was no hint of mushroom whatsoever. Seriously. You guys. Order THAT. Start there and then try everything else on the menu.   We also had smoothies (I got the Flamingo and he got the Tropicana).  Both were awesome. Mine was better   We ordered two additional meals to-go because we wanted to grab as much as we could since we don't live on that side of town: the Philly Cheese and the Rueben sandwiches. I didn't take a bite of my Philly, but the bf took a bite of his Reuben before we left and swears it is the best Reuben he has ever had in his LIFE (this includes real-meat ones)! He said the flavor was on point, the sourkraught was good and crisp and the, "meat," was juicy and not dry like others he's had.  My point is: this place has a HUGE menu, and we got 8 items off the list and they were all fantastic. Don't think this is variety without quality taste. I am honestly blown away by the time and effort that must have been put into opening this restaurant and offering customers the sheer amount of amazing choices. Seriously. We were both impressed.  Not only that but every staff member I interacted with was friendly, courteous and helpful, and honestly I was having a really scary and awful day to cap off some pretty rough weeks and none of them even knows how much this whole experience cheered me up. It was just good food and good people who really cared about their craft. I've still got a lot to deal with, but today at least, will will stand out in my memory a little bit more and for a better reason than it would have been if we'd not decided to give the place a go.   Everyone I know will be hearing about this place from me.   Update: I tasted the Philly when I got home and I can confirm it too is fantastic.

photos.caption: Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Buffalo chicken sandwich
Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corndogs

K2mxwU-qT-_eTZxOcx6N5g.text: This is the best vegan experience that we've had in Vegas thus far! The chicken and waffles plate was amazing! My husband ordered biscuits and gravy and it was delicious! Will be back next time we're in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The biscuits and gravy dish was also DELICIOUS. Liked it a lot better than non vegan original biscuits and gravy.

rZAuIrxmSGEDBATdS-7ouw.text: A little overwhelming when you first walk in but I quickly adjusted to the music volume and vibe! Staff was super friendly and knowledgeable. Gxs2xdgOoZjtr2nsfb-ctA.text: As a vegan, I'm sad to say that I was very disappointed with my experience here. I was weary of this place from the get go because of their GIGANTIC menu. The menu is huge and allllll over the place. From waffles, to pad Thai, to poutine? I think that restaurants are usually better off sticking with smaller menus and having a few amazing dishes rather than dozens of just-okay dishes. I think this is definitely a problem here.   My boyfriend and I ordered three dishes: the poutine, Louisiana chicken, & the lobster roll. The poutine was the best dish of the bunch, but it still wasn't great. First of all, for an appetizer, the portion was MASSIVE. The fries seemed to be unsalted and a bit under done. The cheese and gravy was just ok, nothing memorable. The Louisiana chicken dish was similar. It was nothing more than just ok. The fried chicken looked good, but it just didn't taste quite right. I've had lots of vegan fried chicken from a variety of restaurants- but this tastes like something you buy frozen and heat up in your microwave. The coleslaw was also not good, it also tasted like something you'd get at a grocery store. The mashed potatoes were probably the best part of the dish, but still nothing I'd go back for. The lobster roll looked great but the taste and texture was just... awful. I never send food back but I had to with this dish, especially considering the high prices here. They took it off the check with no problems and I really appreciated that.  (Although I didn't enjoy the food much- I do want to say that everything was plated quite beautifully!)   Besides the food, the service was pretty good and everyone was very nice. The decor wasn't bad, however it was a confusing feel. It's like they mixed together a fancier restaurant with a fast casual cafe. They had a gigantic bar but such a small kitchen, which just didn't make sense to me. If the restaurant closes at 6pm, is a huge bar really necessary? I've worked as a cook in a couple different restaurants and I cannot begin to fathom how they cook everything on their menu in their tiny kitchen. It blows my mind. I currently work at a restaurant with a menu 1/3 the size of their menu, but our kitchen is 3x the size of theirs! This is probably part of the reason the quality of the food was lacking. I feel like the owners might not come from a food service background, or were maybe just too ambitious?   Overall, I really, really wanted to like this place and I hate to see a vegan business do poorly. However, I  think there's a lot of things that need to be fixed for the restaurant to live up to its potential. With a much smaller (& more focused) menu, revamping the kitchen, and maybe bringing in someone with more experience in this industry this place could be successful.

f5tzZxfdMZ-G306MC1omqA.text: Wish this place was better. I went in for brunch on a fairly busy Sunday so I'll give them that. Me and a friend ordered drinks and food all at the same time. One drink came out by itself then my friends food (chicken and waffles). Ten minutes later the other drink came out by itself. I had to remind our server that I was still missing the Mexicana and when she comes back with the plate it was cold and seemed to have been sitting at the counter waiting for someone to pick it up.  Food overall taste was okay, I tasted my friends chicken and waffles which was pretty good. I had a few bites of my own food but the chick'n was cold and pretty tasteless. because of the service I won't be coming back which is unfortunate as I love to support vegan businesses.

8ehZaSEgTuDRSe2xzy8FFg.text: Man where to start with this place. As most of the reviews have stated the service here isn't the best, and the atmosphere is very confusing, but what bothers me the most is the food itself. The food taste like the chefs went to Whole Foods and purchased as many Vegan instafood (Gardien patties, Daiya, etc.). The best example is there Mac and cheese,  my wife bought some Mac and Cheese by Daiya and it looked/tasted like the same Mac and Cheese from here. Would not recommend anyone to come here unless they change up their menu.

gJcTsNuEO6om-g6h8kxZ3A.text: Outside of my main careers, 2 things I have worked with the most are food and customer service. Both need to be present at any restaurant worth anything, & both need to be good, or at least decent, for any restaurant to deserve paying customers. I won't go back to TMV, because the food was overpriced & mostly disappointing, and the customer service was for the most part shockingly nonexistent or bad, depending on the moment. Everything on the menu is $3 to $5 more expensive than would be reasonable, & the portions and quality do NOT back up the inflated prices. Out of 4 entrees and 2 appetizers, only 2 items were really enjoyable...the "jalapeno poppers" & the "meatball sub". Couldn't find much flavour in the "eggs benny", the buffalo caesar wrap, the philly cheesesteak, or the "mac n cheese balls" (sauce was great but the balls had zero flavour). I love vegan food. I have cooked it/served it/catered it/sought it out, and hoped for the best at many places, since I became vegan in 2001. This place is NOT where I would send someone looking to experience good vegan food for their first time. Even if the customer service wasn't some of the worst I've ever seen, I'd hesitate to go back & try more dishes here. The menu looks eclectic and amazing, but it's hard to justify a return visit, & such high prices, when only 2 out of 6 items purchased were satisfying. Aside from needing to have DELICIOUS food, I believe every vegan restaurant needs EXCELLENT customer service, or at least enough to make every guest feel welcome & appreciated. It's an opportunity to be ambassadors to non-vegans, a chance to welcome people into (ideally) a pleasant, cruelty-free atmosphere, with (ideally) yummy, satisfying food. So about that customer service... First, the phone number leads straight to an answering machine (during biz hours), so that's kind of special... Having arrived, of the 6 staff members I interacted with out of necessity, 1 was awesome, 1 was pleasant and helpful, & 4 ranged from careless to shockingly rude. First the positive...Jordan, cleaning glasses behind the bar was classy, helpful, & kind, & he should really be training the rest of the staff on how to be friendly & professional. The gal at the window to the kitchen (possibly the owner, who seems to like making snarky responses on these reviews) was friendly, smiling, & promptly answered three questions I had regarding ingredients, even running to the back to check ingredients listed on packages. On the downside...the hostess promised faster service if we sat at the bar, telling me I didn't need to carry a menu with me, only to leave us at the bar with no menus. Once food started arriving, I politely asked a young food runner for utensils...twice, cuz the first time he half-heartedly called out to one of the girls working the bar & then disappeared, until I caught him walking by & asked again. Of the two ladies behind the bar, both of whom ignored my gf and I for a LONG time before taking our orders...the younger server flashed us a smile once or twice, but really seemed to have no time for us...and the older of the two, whom I initially flagged down to ask my simple ingredients questions, showered us with neglect & disrespect. She first told me I should ask her fellow bar server "when she's done making things", then after a LONG wait, told me I should go talk to the cooks, because apparently neither of the bar servers know much about the food, nor are capable of relaying questions to cooks or managers...so off I went to chat with the gal putting finished plates in a window. When I mentioned we were going to be ordering 2 additional entrees to go, our server said, "You'll have to box it up yourself, cuz we don't do that". I asked, "What about when people just come & order food to go?"  "We don't do that", was again the answer. Do they have boxes & containers? Yes, yes they do. Will they hand one to the cooks, or designate an order as "to go"? No, no they won't. In all my days of waiting tables, of boxing leftovers up for people, & neatly packaging carryout items, I never imagined I would find a restaurant with such ludicrous policies & excuses. At one point, I discovered our check was on the counter just to my right. There had been no formal delivery of said check, no "Anything else?", no "Thank you", nothing at all. Upon glancing at the check, I noticed a charge for extra ranch, which we didn't order nor receive. I mentioned it to the ladies behind the bar, which resulted in the older server in the bandana grimacing, grabbing the bill from me, printing out an adjusted bill, & tossing it toward me on the counter with no apology. We paid the bill, & she tossed my credit card & receipt to sign, dropped on the counter with no eye contact, no gracious word, no thanks or farewells, just...nothing. This wasn't just 1 person having a bad day. Most of the staff seemed bummed to be there. Lots of young, funky looks, but barely any smiles. No "Vegas, baby!" It was sad.

0hSZsiI9--Nsr1obMIxYLQ.text: The food here is always exceptional, I'm impressed by the ingenuousness of the menu! The servers are kind and knowledgeable, and the atmosphere is bright and clean. I love that one of the tv's is always playing cute animal videos. We come to the Modern Vegan at least 3 times a month, and it really is the highlight of our week each and every time! I've taken plenty of meat eaters here, and they loved it too! The Modern Vegan just might be the best vegan eatery in town! Thank you so much Modern Vegan!

HH4a76upgIQv4cTWrXV5MQ.text: Eeeeehhhhhh I don't know what's going on with this place. To start, they have amazing options. AMAZING - BUT they will most likely be out of your first choice. So word of advice, pick a TOP THREE. They don't tell you what they're out of until you're ordering. We ordered the cheese fries, Mac n cheese balls, the queen and the Mexicana. Everything was good, not crazy delicious, but good. Most of the staff aren't customer service oriented, but the manager is very attentive and professional. Other than that, clean decor, and good parking. Check it out

2lmmK2hURHTtaLTsLrcTSw.text: Firstly, let me start by apologizing for the length of the review. I want to put in every detail of my experience with this place. Secondly, I want to say that I am glad to see more truly vegan restaurants are popping up and after reading some of the reviews for The Modern Vegan, I was pretty excited for my boyfriend and I to try it on our Vegas trip this past weekend. This review is not from someone who hasn't tried good and flavorful vegan food before, and therefore has no idea what actual flavor is like. I am no newbie to the vegan scene. I live in SoCal where we have plenty of vegan restaurants. Some bursting with flavor and some not so much. SO that being said, I have some things to say about this place.   Yesterday (4/15/18), my boyfriend and I tried to call to ask if we needed to make a reservation after hearing that they are really busy. We called 3 times and the phone went straight to voicemail each time. Weird, but that wasn't about to deter us from going to what we thought was going to be our new spot to eat when we come to Vegas.   We walk in and the hostess told us there would be a 10 minute wait which is really not bad at all but then she suggested that we could sit at the bar  where they serve the full menu and get faster service. We go to the bar and waited for a few minutes before we were able to get someone's attention to ask for menus. I should mention there were at least 3 people behind the bar and not one of them acknowledged us when we sat down or offered us menus. After perusing the menu, we have some of our options for food narrowed down and we wanted to ask a question regarding the ingredients to a dish to see if it had hydrogenated oil. By the way, research hydrogenated oil if you don't know what it is. It's essentially not food and like one molecule away from tupperware, but I digress.   There was a lady with a bandana in her hair and she seemed nice enough as she asked us if we would like a drink. I ordered a drink and my bf asked if she knew the answer to our question. She didn't know but didn't offer to go to the back and ask the cook or offer for us to see an ingredient list. She told us to wait for this other girl behind the bar (has a partially shaved head) because she might know the answer. I believe she went and told shaved head girl that we had a question for her and she honestly never came over to talk to us. We got the attention of the bandana lady and she again acted like she couldn't do anything remotely resembling good customer service and after a while of us going back and forth with her and telling her we couldn't wait all day for someone to answer our question (seriously guys we were waiting a long time for shaved head girl to come over), she finally told us to walk up to a window where we could see the kitchen and ask the cooks ourselves. So my bf walked over to the window and talked to a woman who was cooking. She was very personable and was able to answer our question very well.   After finding out that they do not, in fact, use hydrogenated oil, we were able to place our order. Again, we had to wait for a while for someone (remember there were multiple people behind the bar) to come and take our order. Shaved head girl finally came over and she seemed nice enough and we told her we wanted to order a couple things for there and then a couple things to go to eat later. We ordered Jalapeno Poppers and Mac and Cheese Balls to start. The Jalapeno Poppers were really good and the peppers had a great spice to them. The Mac and Cheese Balls, on the other hand, were really bland and lacking in flavor. We did love the dipping sauce that came with both of the appetizers. For entrees we ordered the Eggs Benny and the Meatball Sub. The Eggs Benny was pretty tasteless and boring but the Meatball Sub, though severely over priced especially because it wasn't that big, was actually pretty tasty and meatball subs are one of my favourite dishes when done right.     When our food was brought to us, it was brought without utensils and we had to ask the same guy twice before he brought them. During our meal, nobody checked in with us to see how we were doing or if we liked the food. Not one person looked our way the entire time. Finally, shaved head girl brought us our check and walked away. After informing the bandana lady that we had wanted to order more food to go, she told shaved head girl who said "more food?!" with a disgusted look on her face. Remember, we had already informed her we wanted more food for later. We get our food and we had to box it up ourselves because apparently they "don't do that". We got our bill ($92!! insanely overpriced) and they had charged us for something we didn't order. After taking the item off, bandana lady tossed the receipt back to my bf along with major attitude. Needless to say it was the first time in our lives we didn't leave a tip for a server.   This place was overpriced and overly hyped.  Don't waste your time or money.

DPkO_QD9Qoa3OQvTXztgXQ.text: The BEST! Whatever your in the mood for they got it! I ordered fried Mac and cheese mmm and we also got the Louisiana fried chickN so glad I came here it's seriously some where you could go every day

HIX7UNQXHZN_xY3ExSxDFQ.text: Don't order the jalapeno poppers. At $11 for 3 poppers that are full of seeds like they didn't even bother removing them. We couldn't even eat them they were so spicy. My husband bit into one and immediately turned red and started coughing, he's used to eating very spicy food and jalapeno poppers don't even faze him normally. upon inspection of the jalapeno we find a shit ton of seeds not like they accidentally left some in but like they never even tried to remove them. So my husband is sitting there dying while we have nothing to drink because one of the glasses of tap water they brought us was full of floating stuff and was disgusting and he had already finished the other small glass with no waitress in sight to refill us. $11 wasted on an inedible appetizer. They charge $3 a glass for ice tea. The other food we ordered was good. When we finished we asked the waitress if they normally leave all of the seeds in the jalapenos and explained they were so excruciatingly hot we couldn't eat them. She said the kitchen told her sometimes they will accidentally leave some in and she doesn't know what happened maybe they were in season that's why they were so hot. I'm just sitting there like ummm ok. She apologized but we still had to pay for some crap we couldn't eat. I'll never come back here with dirty water and people that obviously don't know how to make what they serve. Not worth the money! Booo on you Modern Vegan

rA9G9vGkwUSQw5ZSuaFWGw.text: This place is my absolute favorite . I had the chick en and waffles and it was amazing . This was my first time at a Vegan restaurant and I will definitely be back . The service is Wonderful

WPUQVV2hMlhDWSIOWH0Ieg.text: If you are vegetarian, I think you'll love this place. My friends were all raving. I am raw vegan, so it wasn't as good for me - the only thing raw vegan was a salad, and an expensive one at that. I think if Friends want to eat here again I will go off my raw diet and eat what they are eating with them.

j1ui5lV1KfzZ1MczjU686g.text: Was vegan for a long time and previously wasn't, but when I moved back to Vegas and saw TMV was now posted up, I became so happy to have a vegan place with such a large menu. SOOOOO happy to see this menu after LV had zero vegan options for forev.  The menu is HUGE and I've tried many things on here and it's some of the best vegan food I've ever had. Seriously even down to the iced coffee it's worth coming back and trying so many different things on the menu.  ONLY reason why I'm giving four stars out of five is that the service/food can be kind of inconsistent. I could have a so-so server who forgets water, doesn't get orders correctly, etc. or the best service I've ever had. Same with the food. For example, their buffalo chik'n burger was one of the best things I've ever put in my mouth. But their Flamingo smoothie was super lacking in flavor for a smoothie and the baked mac n cheese was super liquidy and didn't seem baked. I hope they add to their dessert section! Nothing that wouldn't ever have me coming back.

HRHwZJWmmVWZHcL1kTPeIg.text: This was the one spot I KNEW I had to visit when I went to Las Vegas. I've been following them on Instagram for a while and everything looked amazing. Luckily , it's amazing in real life too!  A friend and I came in around 10:30am on a Sunday for brunch and we were seated right away. We were given menus and water. We decided what we wanted rather quickly, and our waitress (who was great) was able to take our food and drink orders together.  The food came out in a reasonable amount of time. I ordered the Chick'n Waffles which was amazing. Looked just like the photos I've seen and it tasted great! My friend got the biscuits and gravy and enjoyed that too. One thing to note here is the portion sizes are GIGANTIC. Seriously, my friend and I could have just split one entree and not even finished. I wish I could have taken my leftovers home, but sadly I had a long drive to San Diego ahead of me. I will definitely be back the next time I'm in Vegas, and I definitely want to try some dessert!

swn6LZuptgtNqt4XGQtkBA.text: Yes! Yes! Yes!  We feasted here for my 50th b-day breakfast!  It was scrumdillisious!  Lindsay was our server and she was a delight.  Very helpful and informative.  We were pleasantly overwhelmed by the selections.  The food was delicious.  The service was great.  The restaurant was squeeky clean.  My one and only suggestion is to add an open sign that is visible from the outside.  We almost left because we thought it was closed.  Sooo glad we went up and checked!  Wishing this restaurant great success!

photos.caption: Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken &#39;n waffles
Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States

IzIw_xBtl1PBHIBhjSJ8nQ.text: The BIG MAC was one of thee best vegan burgers EVER. It's much bigger than the McDonald's version and the taste is incomparable in taste! I believe it's only served on Thursday's.

_4BWZjLngxU9ON3x0Xog4w.text: They've got everything a vegan could want and more. It's all vegan. A fun place to eat every time because you can always get something new!

ot3paO3odS1frvDzlqKskQ.text: First props go to Missy the waitress holdin down the whole place!   When we get there I was a little impatient that I had to wait like 2 minutes before someone greeted and seated me. I mean, who do I think I am like the president or something?!  Anyway, back to Missy... she was 1 of 3 people working tha floor- the bartender, the host & Missy. As busy as she was, she got everything right and made sure we were taken care of.   Restaurant vibe is chill. Patrons are chill. Location is ?questionable but I'm not a Vegas resident so who knows, maybe the neighborhood is chill too. One thing that threw me off was the urine stench outside.   Anyway, the food.... I yelped prior and read all of the mixed reviews of people saying they didn't know what all the hype was about and how bad the service is. I don't know why this place has any of those kinds of reviews because this place is the.  B o m b! The only way to not like the food is if you are a meat eater then you're not even making a fair comparison because this is one of the best vegan restaurants I've tried! Chickun actually tastes like chicken! Texture, consistency and flavors.   Do yourself a favor. Try this place. And don't complain about the service. Or the food

tSgmYZhaBFsjZMQboESkIw.text: Tried to give this place a shot many times more than 8 times to be exact. It's unfortunate every time I went I received the same service. Each waiter needs more training. I shouldn't have to ask for anything when being served food such as .. napkins, utensils, more water, and condiments. That should be a given. The food is not good at all except breakfast. Extremely overpriced for what you get.. just because the portion is big doesn't mean ur paying for quality or taste. It's unfortunate I would rather go to Vegenation or even chef Kenny's vegan restaurant is 10 times better. If you want mediocre food with poor service try out TMV.

a0KOYKEZs3qT-bWmyZJKJw.text: If I'm being honest, I am not a True vegan. However, I do enjoy vegan food, cooking, and health benefits. I was recommended this place by a friend in vegas and after hearing that they have 200+ options of 100% vegan choices, I had to go. I will say, I was not impressed with the location but I'm super excited to hear that they're building a location in Reno (where I live) coming next summer.   The ambiance is upscale, modern, with clean lines and mainly white but with some brighter colors. It's beautiful inside. The menu is a bit intimidating but it's beyond amazing. They have anything from burgers to tacos to waffles to chicken to dessert. And it's 100% vegan. The pictures of the food do not do it justice and I was pleasantly surprised about the quality, flavors, and amount of food.   My friend and I wanted to order one menu item each and split another as sort of an appetizer. I got the cauliflower chicken wings with buffalo sauce, she got a burger and we split fish tacos. WOW. those tacos are enough to keep me a customer for years to come and be super impatient about their arrival in Reno. Additionally the wings were AMAZING and totally not what I was expecting. The vegan ranch complimented them perfectly and I. Want. More.   Can't wait to go back to vegas to try more and anxiously await its arrival here!!! 10/10 recommend.

EKyERnONUu_09FC72f9Vdg.text: Best vegan breakfast hands down! I ordered the breakfast burrito with taco meat and house potatoes. The potatoes were cooked and seasoned perfectly. The burrito was extremely filling in the best way, I couldn't put it down. A must try restaurant!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast Burrito

VyZUwKBlZLngJ4ydHlBzww.text: My new favorite Vegan place in Las Vegas! The food was delicious & I loved the white, clean, simplistic decor. And it's located next to UNLV, so it's not too far a drive from the strip. My only complaint is that they are closed on Mondays & Tuesdays & I leave on Wednesday!

photos.caption: Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Louisiana Chicken! Breaded Chick&#39;n with Mashed Potatoes smothered with a Mushroom &amp; Sausage gravy.
Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Afqbxn2jK4-5VG3rUkFyUQ.text: OVER PRICED. Plain and simple they need to fix their menu. $11 for avocado toast?? You have to be joking? We ordered the meatball sub, the reuben, and a lemonade, the total was $41. That is ridiculous. Oh, not to mention the waitress forgot to mention that it's a $3 up charge if you want onion rings or sweet potato fries as your side (which we did). For the location of this place (ghetto) it's just over priced for the quality you receive. The lemonade was the best part... will not be returning

rS1-1K7vIOAWgQYbRiDEHg.text: Two stops this trip to Vegas.   First on Sunday with a regular menu. First: GREAT COFFEE. Yum. We split a smoothie and "eggs" florentine. It was so amazing. Such great food, so tasty and creative. All vegan. How they make vegan hollandaise sauce I'd really like know. Really. It was fantastic.   Our second visit was on the way out of town on Tuesday. Google said it was closed so we called. They are now open on Tuesday with a limited menu. Mostly Mexican food, breakfast and lunch were both available at 11 when we arrived. My husband had churro french toast. WOW!!! It was just incredible. I had a carne asada burrito with red and green sauce. So delicious. They don't skimp on the portions either.   The service is great. The manager came around and asked about our food, checking to be sure everything was just right.   The menu is incredible. So many mainstream dishes you never think you will have again once you have gone vegan are at this unique spot. I wish they would open a location in my hometown. I would eat there every day.  I highly recommend this spot and will return again and again.

CQ0jxktl6SpoI0w0tQQRMQ.text: Very cool setting, very clean and modern (go figure, right? (lol) The popcorn chicken was really good, and also enjoyed the fish tacos and jalapeno poppers. Tried the lobster roll and it was okay, but not my favorite dish. Service was great - attentive, but not overly so. Only downside was difficult for Uber to pin the location for pickup, but no fault of TMV.

SOrgal7IHc4bVIkh8DTWfQ.text: Even though I'm a pescatarian, I'm always looking for a reason to convert all the way over to being a full Vegan. I have tried a few restaurants here and in California and yet The Modern Vegan has stolen my heart. Not only because of the food but because of the owner. She was so patient, helpful and very knowledgeable.   Ok so about the food I ordered the Mac & Cheese Balls, Buffalo Chik'n Sandwich and of course BOTTOMLESS MIMOSAS!!! Let's take a moment of silence........ (Pause)   The Mac & Cheese balls are AMAZING!!! full of flavor by themselves and when you add the sauce ..... explosion. The balls were baseball sized (2per order) and had a great Panko-like crispy texture outside. Inside was warm, cheesy and creamy.   Buffalo Chik'n Sandwich equally delicious. Even though the Chik'n was dipped in buffalo sauce it was still crispy. It was dressed with a garden mix & avocado.   As far as Service, it was great!!!!!! Our waiter made sure we were doing well and you can tell the owner put a lot of heart into this wonderful place.

photos.caption: Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mac &amp; Cheese Balls
Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bottomless Mimosas
Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Buffalo Burger

Z2y0K3hNfmsLmfnVrzUwbA.text: I was a bit afraid to try Vegan food but my friend had assured me i would not notice the difference. BOY! was he right. We had the stuffed jalapenos, they were so good ( one of peppers had us gasping for air haha) I had the Portobello mushrooms, the presentation was great but most of all the taste was delicious. I would definitely come back and try more food here.

EwGZxY9ik0IeElLR7k_OPQ.text: I come here a lot, and have never had bad service. The food is always great as well. I'm currently obsessed with the buffalo chick'n wrap- I definitely recommend it. You can't go wrong with the burgers either- especially on the days when they have their Mac Attack burger and their Whopper Wednesday's.

4QiAlTq5KM8_i9-Lz8fbFw.text: This place is now on my go to spots when visiting Vegas. The mango toast, open faced avocados, waffles and the french toast. OMG all of it is sooo delicious. I might need a Vegas trip real soon.   Service can be a little slow, decor is simple but really just come for the food with a little patience.

9CQCs2jqEe0qrXqT5_XqvQ.text: The food here is pretty good. The prices are a little high. But I love the decor and ambiance of the restaurant, it's super cute. Their breakfast foods were really good. I like the chicken and waffles. And their vegan French toast is fire!

uz8uQMnbnEILWVgKk_zGjw.text: Overall, I had a wonderful experience! Our server, Scott, was very pleasant and made awesome suggestions. The food was delicious. The fritters are a little bland but other than that, everything was absolutely amazing!   *I would have given 5 stars but on my first order of chicken n waffles the mashed potatoes were cold and they had to remake my plate. The 2nd (fresh/hot) chicken n waffles were 100%

jFnPPmBOhSdjHq5ZvMWMRw.text: Unfortunately we didn't even get a chance to taste the food because we ended up leaving after a half hour without anyone approaching our table to even bring waters. They had maybe 3 people that we saw working there and they were SLAMMED And then when I finally called someone over, they took someone else's order before us who came in way after us. I usually don't like writing negative reviews but I gotta keep it real and say that They need to hire more people you know so we can actually oh idk place an order to eat?

qJ_Q6_U3WFWY3AcCjxihrw.text: Food is delicious !! Steak & cheese delicious .... buffalo chicken is amazing.... nachos are perfect. The only thing I would change is the type of music.... only music played was very loud hip hop. Maybe adjust the volume if hip hop is preferred. It's difficult to have a conversation with the music so loud.

pT-lkSBAgVu8LiSW9CuOZg.text: ughhh this food!!! I LOVE. everything is vegan... which is hard to believe half the time i'm eating here! even the cocktails are amazing. this is a great place to bring your non plant based friends to! the mac abc cheese ball appetizer is unrealllll :p

wN8xcg79d7Q4hD64rJwpXw.text: Bomb!!!! Everything... just.... BOMB!!! Get the chicken & waffles, that's all I got to say

NRDR5Kx3MgtJOA_1nK44QA.text: Omg.   This place is sooooooooo good!! Even if you aren't vegan I highly recommend it.  I got the chicken and waffles. It was incredible.  Like legit the best I've ever had!  I can't wait to go back

CjRmvq2ujUD4BgIa6QN5XA.text: Great food!!! Honestly the food is on point. The menu was extensive which is a lot for someone who never decides lol but I think for just opening and being new to this it's awesome.

n2eAz2hIBEXbgf7B_A2p5A.text: Ambiance was great. The place was very clean and inviting. We were seated pretty quickly. They were out of a few things on the menu, but that wasn't such a problem. I had the spaghetti. My friends got the rancho and fish tacos. Everything tasted great! And the service was great. Our waiter was very kind. Overall, we had a very good experience with TMV and will definitely recommend this place to friends.

t_4LPtjXQWJDUD05ou_2Pg.text: Very eccentric and welcoming. They play trap music and funny animal videos all day lol. Love this place and the food is amazing.

xJif4gdkAMjm7of1rCSIDw.text: Omg this place is amazing! Chicken n waffles were fire!!! Definitely recommend this place to anyone looking for bomb vegan food!!!

Xzlvz1DoBOFzDgEz3X6ogw.text: My boyfriend and I were there the Saturday they opened. They have a lot to work on but I will be back. We waited a hour to get seated because the kitchen was backed up. We ordered the Todd waffles, baked Mac n cheese, and the buffalo burger. The waffles were cold but good, the Mac was dry but has potential to be amazing with more sauce, and nothing bad to say about the burger! They forgot about the burger so we had to wait further. Overall I thought they were pricey, and lots of kinks to work out but we will definitely try again in a couple weeks.

nl3bjMfXAW8jlHsexxBWCQ.text: I am giving a 4 because they are new and do have some kinks to work out, however i see great potential. Customer service was great, everyone kept apologizing however they had nothing to apologize for there was no delay or anything. Now this a big pet peeve, and lots of resturants do it and i feel it is unacceptable. When someone orders an appetizer that comes before your entree to hold you over, if you bring the appetizer with the entree first thats too much to eat at once, also it make the table a cluster eff with plates everywhere. Please can restuarants stop this, its resturant management 101. Now most people think fried foods take no skill, but they are complex because the outside can be cooked but the inside can be cold unfortunately that is what happened with the mac and cheese baseballs. Maybe just check the temp before hand. My sons frenchie came out about half way through our meal, mostly because i think they may have forgot. He ate my fries though so not too big of an issue. The lobster roll was good, i wont fault them it just wasnt what i wanted on my taste buds (they were out of what i really wanted) the regular mac and cheese was luke warm but that could be because out of precedent i wouldnt eat it until i finished my appetizer. But it was much better then the fried baseballs. My boyfriend LOVED his southern fried chicken and i loved my sons frenchie. Then dessert we got the banana split. I would have really loved if it was a normal banana split i havent had one since i went vegan 6 years ago. However it was very good. As stated i see a lot of potential for the atmosphere, menu and price. Just some kinks to work out and then place could be perfect!

JzQzvOk2EVptHv0Yx4_knw.text: Super stoked to have such a great new vegan spot in town! Drinks were great, food was amazing, and dessert was spot on! Plus the menu is massive!!! For sure will be coming back!

SEA3la05pkyNqGbItcWusw.text: Wanted to wait a few weeks after they opened to try everything out. I am really hoping those people who have written this place off give it a second chance. I love the vibe, the staff, the food... Everything was so good!

SdkTa7GzkkYDsqgInkz-UA.text: Went for lunch about 1230pm the place was packed, but still we were immediately seated.  We sat down and were given menus and given waters (no ice).  Our waiter came by and introduced himself and was really polite and friendly, also informing us that the kitchen is free flowing before we ordered, so food comes out when ready which was helpful so no questions asked.  I asked the waiter for ice and lemon, he had no problem with it and even brought a carafe because the glasses are a bit short, which I thought was really cool.  My husband ordered a lemonade I tried a sip and it was refreshing, but needed more sweetness to it.  So I think he will order something different next time.  The food,  I was craving a buffalo chicken and mac n cheese so we order that and split everything also from a pic I saw here on yelp a deep fried PB and J we asked the wait staff and he said it was the app called PB Delight it wasnt what we expected but it was still good, the bread was a 9grain and fruits were fresh.  The buffalo chicken sandwhich was so delish! Crispy goodness and fresh veggies and the pretzel bun was great!  The side mac n cheese came before everything we devoured it, the flavor was on point.  I'll definately return to try the nachos and another chicken sandwhich...maybe even a dessert

QujKMCzxLuVAwhvJp9GGgA.text: Amazing. Looking for some wonderful friendly owners Todd and Gia.  As well as the wait staff.. if I lived here this would be my favorite eating place. Very clean and the taste is beyond most vegan restaurants that I have ever been to with so many selections. Overall had a wonderful time. Constantly busy on a Wednesday night. And some of the best tasting onion rings and vegan cheesecake that I have ever had. God bless

EQ6Glnl6wexAxvP6zVUlxQ.text: This is what food is meant to be. Even your non-vegan friends will love this place. The ambience is trendy, cool and the staff service is second-to-none.  I think it would take a lifetime to try everything on this menu, so you never have to worry about running out of options. We'll continue to make eating here a non-negotiable every time we're back in town.

AbmzntxLUCAmig6WP7mz3Q.text: This place is AMAZING! My boyfriend and I were visiting Las Vegas from the Bay Area, and I was super excited to try this place. We live in South San Francisco and the only vegan restaurants around are Indian and Thai Food, which I really don't care for that type of food. TMV has a HUGE menu and everything on it is Vegan. They have a variety of options, it's like a Vegan Denny's! I liked that they had healthy light options too. The breakfast bowls were HUGE! All the portions were big you can definitely share all items from the menu. The customer service was great as well! Yvette and her staff do a great job. We stayed in Vegas for 2 nights and we ate there every day! Can't wait to go back, I wish they had one here in the Bay Area :)

uNwlZ2y4BEJvjY5WcK-PuQ.text: Stopped by TMV for lunch today. They do a different soup for each day of the week-today they had tomato bisque and omg it was literally the best tomato bisque I've ever had! All of Gia's recipes are delish!!! Definitely coming back for more!

VSbxG6bMnap528tfNNpzVg.text: This place is awesome, the atmosphere is cool and the food is amazing!! There are so many choices that it's hard to choose from but so far everything I have had is great! I absolutely love the nacho dip!

fjEdsKSL_kEqvLYnheXNxQ.text: Went this morning and was excited since I have heard great things. Pretty disappointed. Told off the bat the waffle machine was broken. My husband ordered coffee with agave. They brought the coffee and said they had no idea if the agave was added. Then came the $3.00 shot glass of coconut milk. I had soup and sent it back. Tasted like salt and more salt. My daughter ordered french toast and it took 30 mins. Was so behind they asked if we wanted it to go. Umm no she would like to eat it now. Disappointed and will not go back. The biscuits and gravy was good. Breakfast skillet was just ok. Heard a whole speech of how they are awaiting the tesla of waffle makers. Who cares.

6Fu8USliFYMgLeEkBUaXMw.text: Loved this place! Great food with generous portions so unless you eat a lot you'll probably have enough to take some home in a to go box. They just had their grand opening so with time I'm sure they will get faster. It was packed today and I heard it has been since they opened a few days ago. Nice clean environment and friendly service. Will definitely be going back!

kdT0zAkomHPVt3nZnUZsYw.text: If you're looking for a spot for a quick in and out bite TMV is definitely a spot to go to! For my first time trying it I was really surprised, didn't know what to get luckily I had amazing service from a young lady named Kylie as she provided everything I needed with out having to tell her, she recommended "the Mac attack" which was delicious!! Definitely give it a try!!

eOaHHe3TRo0vH26twh0s_Q.text: As a new Vegas resident I must say my taste buds were highly pleased when I have TMV a try. Pretty PRICEY but I'd gladly recommend the Cauliflower & Cosmopolitan smoothie to any one!!

89Ah5-azoFqfJRyf_9s4sw.text: I had heard about this place for some time, being from the SoCal area I couldn't try them until I finally came back this week to Vegas. If your looking for something good to eat this place is it! Good food, good drinks and staff were nice and helpful with suggestions of things to try. The menu has a bit of everything so your bound to find something you might be craving.  I ended up getting the Ruben and my friend ordered the pulled pork sandwich and it was so good. I will definitely come back here again when I'm in town and try more items from the menu and recommend my friends to giv this place a try to.

etgdHXRjz69Ol05y1TGPrQ.text: What a great find. So glad to have another wonderful place to get tasty food. Taco Tuesday street tacos are amazing.   The service was top notch fast friendly and very knowledgeable. This is a must return. 5 stars.

Zf0N_EIFdf6aeutKhQcYww.text: First time here and the food is amazing. I'm having the Gia waffle and the ingredients and taste are amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gia waffle

VdFhh9dg4eYFYyDdaGDSwg.text: Good food.  Okay atmosphere.  A little pricey but good size portions.  The chicken n waffles is delicious. It comes with mashed potatoes. Also the chicken and biscuits are really good. Can't wait to return and try other items.  Extensive menu with lots of options.

L9oiBfebF-ypGZa8CrolxQ.text: The food here is delicious. They can be pretty busy if ordering to go so grab a smoothie while you wait. The portions are huge also.

AWnTis5DEgq_FYx6YSbSnA.text: Updated 5 star review. I've been in a number of times prior to my first review and it seem like the initial opening kinks have been worked out. TMV has hit the mark every time with their creative recipes, hearty portions, and great service. The lobster roll is dynamite, so fresh, unique, and tasty!   TMV is definitely my number 1 vegan spot in LAS (that's saying a lot for this little desert vegan haven)

2EWXAhhQnfeztuWSqWw2bQ.text: Great concept - iffy execution. Hint if your wait staff has to yell to answer questions or take your order, you're doing it wrong.  Food for the most part decent portions. Auto gratuity? Really? Take the menu with a grain of salt. "Oh we never have that I don't know why it's on the menu" " oh yeah we only have one soup ignore the others" music so loud you can't have a conversation with the person next to you. It's trendy and will fade just as fast. Ignore the sketchy strip mall it's in  Update - if the response below is any indication of how this place takes valid criticism they definitely need to get over themselves. Would update to zero stars if possible.

8zFYPZtf-KH9w6FJD02H6Q.text: Food was great! One of the best waffle I had.  Though it took a while for our food to come out, service was generally good.  Pretty expensive but I guess not many vegan options around in Vegas for competition. Not a big fan of their Phad Thai, seemed a bit less on the flavor and seasoning. Huge huge selection on the menu, can be a bit confusing but a number of great options to try.  Overall, if I am in Vegas again, I will certainly visit this place few times during my stay to try different things on their menu.

e2775PECPdnzpI4NTzeZEQ.text: We were happy to find this killer vegan restaurant just a few-minutes drive off the strip...it's located in an unassuming strip mall right by UNLV and I hope it stays around because I'll come here every time I'm in town. The menu is massive--I mean really, really extensive and can suit any desire.  I had the buffalo cauliflower and "chicken" popcorn and both were crazy good. Excellent side sauces. My man had the tofu pinwheel and it was just so-so, but his "pulled pork" burger on a pretzel bun was great (best bun ever, he says).  He wants to come back and try the "cheese steak" because he feels like they understand "meat" textures here. Next time, I want to try their "chicken soup" and one of their salads--and I definitely want to have one if not both of their interesting avo toast options. Very creative takes on a staple.  The staff was extremely friendly and upbeat and several people were servicing our table, so we never needed to ask for or wait for anything.  The food came out quickly, the tastes were exceptional, and the ambience was modern, yet casual, so I think it's a great place to take people who are committed vegans, transitioning into vegetarianism, or full-blown meat eaters.

0n0cSSYefhY7tB5Cs60jRw.text: Wow, this place is so bomb! We have found a new go-to vegan spot in Vegas. My wife and I shared th French toast and Mexicana breakfast and both were flavorful and hearty. I strongly recommend this place and will double down by heading back for dinner.    CW

I0Vo2f0WdhTbLf2gmW7GEw.text: Disappointed in this place- but probably because my expectations were set high as I had received so many recommendations.  I came here last Thursday around 6 and the place was pretty much empty. I sat first and waited for my friend to join me. I'm big on service and this place lacked just that. Browsing the menu while I waited, the lobster role caught my eye; wondering what the substitute for the "lobster" was I decided to ask our server as the menu just described it as a "super secret recipe".  I couldn't tell if she was new or just extremely awkward- asking her questions almost made me uncomfortable (that's how bad it was). Anyways, her response to the lobster substitute question was "I don't think they'll tell me because it says super secret" lol what-- what if I have an allergy. Weird. Another woman who looked like a manager later advised us it was heart of palm.   We ordered the fish tacos, the Buffalo, and the lobster roll. The fish tacos were mediocre at best and really lacked flavor. The buffalo, on the other hand, was exceptional FULL of flavor and the chicken substitute had great texture- highly recommend! The lobster roll was massive but was absolutely horrible- the sauce they smother it in is so overpowering and ruins the whole thing. It does not taste like a lobster role whatsoever; even with consideration of it being "vegan".   Service was definitely lacking but I'd give them the benefit of the doubt as the place is still pretty new. Food was "eh" but the menu was very extensive so I'd probably give them another try. I'm still team Vegenation for now though.

Z7uW5LDu7fln5Kp-wY82fg.text: Been wanting to try this place for a long time and my friend and I finally found time to go have dinner and we were not disappointed!! I had the buffalo burger and my friend had the truffle mushroom soup and it was incredible! The food was so flavorful and filling. The restaurant is super open and well-decorated. I loved the ambiance and all of the pretty lights. The service was awesome, Scott is one of the friendliest and most attentive servers I've ever had! He definitely made the experience that much better! :)

photos.caption: Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States

O37Qmk_35I8F6zcIar3w3Q.text: Visiting Las Vegas and I needed something healthy...sat at the counter since I was by myself...staff was super nice and food was really good...about a $8 Uber ride from the strip and then I walked back. I got a smoothie and a bowl.

photos.caption: Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States

GU1uNu6kmRuzg5eVxasS2g.text: Menu looked amazing unfortunately we never made it in to order. We stood at the entrance for about 5 minutes before being acknowledged. Once someone came up to us they said it would be a 10-15 minute wait which was fine. About 10 minutes in a party of 4 comes in and was seated right away. Again nothing was said to the my party of 2 and a solo dinner that was before us. Very bad customer service from the beginning. It felt as if they did not care about small parties.

_gy88u0wToB0uG4XOrIR7A.text: I liked the Portabello Lobster steak, but didn't love it.  Like everything Vegas it was a bit over the top on sauce and cheese, trying to be better than it actually was.  But I do love the effort to bring interesting Vegan food to a meat-infested region and love grubhub delivers it to the Westin and arrived like 30 minutes early.  I look forward to trying other dishes in the future.

gA2FiWLsdS4S7ua_BlBvhw.text: Amazing as always!! Little bit expensive for this college student but I still keep coming back

LhSoVYQze9g_9lCH3xlFFg.text: Let's get down to business.  First of all. I hate giving 1 stars, I love seeing vegan places open up and grow. I love the ambience of the place. Modern, nice and white good for the eyes. All the servers, hosts were awesome! Tatted up, different styles, they were free and I love that about this place so as far as customer service that's a 5 star for me. The employees are all 5 stars because it made me happy that they didn't need to wear a uniform and just dressed as they pleased kind of feeling.  I'm upset o have to give this rating but I am because the pricing of the food is ridiculous for the quality. I dont mind spending $50+ on a couple items as long as that stuff is good but no go for me here.   Now, it's time to be cut throat because we are now talking about the food industry as I own 2 places myself here in Las Vegas. People being cut throat with me is how one of my places is doing so well because I turned tragic into triumph.   Down to the food:  $5 Side of baked mac n cheese: Tasted like cardboard, not only once but after every single bite tasted like cardboard. Bland, the flavor was off and there was just something missing. I think it was the cheesiness part, I finished it though cause there's was like 6 bites because of the portion size, or maybe my fatass was just making it 6 bites. Lol.   $8 New York New York Smoothie: Was not a smoothie, it was a chunky chocolate milk. I couldn't taste much, all the flavors of the banana, cacao, agave were so light. Thus far, it was good but I tasted the stinginess of ingredients in the drink.   $15 Biscuits and Gravy: Gravy tasted like it was sitting in a stainless steel container for a couple days. Like, canned gravy with a lot of herbs and some rusty metallic flavor. Biscuit had no flavor, flat top on butter? With a little garlic powder. Rosemary infused butter maybe? Mashed potatoes, I know have been sitting in a container. Discoloration, the texture and the moisture of water coming out of the mash I knowing it's been sitting. Bland.  $11 Zuchini Fritters: chopped up zucchini inside a ball of unseasoned flour and some gooey stuff which I think should have been cheese. It was my least favorite item I've gotten out of this meal. The texture was good but the flavor was just not having it, this item was poorly put together. The tzatziki sauce was good though.  $14 Buffalo Burger: Soft Pretzel bun, with a breaded chick'n tossed in buffalo. Not bad at all. I liked it, fries were unseasoned, at least mine were but the burger wasn't half bad. I took it to go.  The problem I see having a big menu is that the lack of flavor falls off all of the items. I didn't get to taste it all but as of asking the server the most popular items I got 2 of them. I most likely will be back because I want to change this review but as of today it's a 1 star for me. I came here from all the hype on the LAS VEGANS GROUP page but that all got shot down.

QnoXUI5ub-7iMDDUuZXHyA.text: It was yesterday. I was visiting Las Vegas. We went to the modern vegan restaurant and we order a burger. It took them 30 minutes to get the burger and then we noticed that it wasn't as I ordered it (mean wail my friend gut its food )so with lot of smiles I ask them to "fix it please" and they took the burger back to the kitchen. 30 minutes later I got my burger back and again it was with nothing that I asked in it (they latterly just gave me that burger to shush me) The problem is that they didn't put me in priority to get my food first so I was literally waiting more than an hour to get my food. While I could see so many Burgers coming out of the kitchen... One of the reasons that I'm writing it here in "Yelp" it's because how the management deal with me.  They looked at me like I'm the "annoying" one with their body language and with short of patience to me and with words like "so what do you want now"... Nonetheless the manager tried to charge me for the frys that I was snacking while I'm waiting for my food. So I asked for the owner that was in the restaurant (actually in the kitchen) that time and the manager didn't let me talk to him/her. She prevented me to talk to the owner to tell him what was the problem with my experience at my first time in this restaurant. I felt very not welcomed there. It's really doesn't matter how good the food is wail the experience was really bad and quite upsetting. I have to say that the waitress was great and very delightful (it was her third day at work) She showed us the 'order' and it was fine. They messed up at the kitchen.

RVqVbFr0fXQde63UgUl5og.text: This was my first time in the vegas area. My job requires me to fly here every three months. I recently turned vegan and was amazed with the numerous about of vegan spots around the Henderson area. I heard great reviews about the Modern vegan via yelp. So I tried it for myself. 5 stars! As soon as u arrive to the parking lot you can tell this place is going to be delicious . The decor and detail of the place matches the menu. I arrived around 4 and the friendly hostess greeted me. I ordered the mac n cheese balls but they ran out & also ran out of sweet potatoes fries. When I heard that I knew this place was poppin. The waitstaff and bartenders were absolutely the most friendliest people to wait on me.   Now let's talk about the food! I got the jalapeno poppers and baked mac n cheese! DELICIOUS ! Hands down the best vegan mac n cheese I've ever tasted. It was creamy but not thick. Every bite was a water fall in my mouth! The poppers were just as good. The filling wasn't too much , just right. It mixed well with the house sauce that comes with it, and a Jameson neat.   I will definitely come back to this place in three months !

photos.caption: Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegan mac n cheese is the best &#34;mac n cheese&#34; I&#39;ve ever tasted. It&#39;s light &amp; creamy at the same time.

aKK1_N5WkJPoAO1CBY8KuQ.text: Stopped by here for dinner last night. Had the Carne Asada Burrito and the Cheese Quesadilla. Really liked both, the burrito was large and I couldn't finish it, since I had gorged myself on the chips and guacamole beforehand. Service was great as well. Location is a bit sketchy, but that doesn't reflect on the quality of the food or the service.

JELEpweePsOWV1Z7Og6_Nw.text: Wouldnt suggest this place to anyone. I ate their 3 days ago and had been throwing up since. Food was not fresh at all. Just happened to watch the news and saw them on here with a grade "C" eat at ur own risk

XGBpGA0JPUG-OxNDyczOew.text: I came here today for Mother's Day brunch and will definitely come back! First off, the restaurant itself is very nice and clean and a little unexpected to find a vegan restaurant in this area. For starters, we had PB delight, ahhhmazing! For entrees, I ordered their famous chicken and waffles and spaghetti and meatballs for my husband. Both were delicious and big portions! And for dessert we had Oh my God! And yes it was OMG good!!!   I'm taking a star away due to the service, host was on the phone for a couple of minutes while we were standing in front of her and did not even acknowledge us. No hi/hello or welcome, and rolled her eyes right in front of us! Also, our food took 45min to come out, server was very apologetic and offered us dessert so it was all good!  I definitely recommend this new vegan restaurant in town!

I am cautiously optimistic to go back. I would love to have another Vegan restaurant in rotation!  *old review* They say the Modern Vegan is pretty good. It's hard to tell as the service is horrible.  Walked in on a Sunday afternoon to the restaurant being a quarter full and stood there roughly 5 minutes before being greeted with an "I'll be right with you." After standing around another three minutes I gave up. Conversely, I went to the No Fur Cafe which was equally as full with 1/3 of the staff and was greeted immediately. The food was great also.  There aren't only two vegan restaurants anymore. Far too much competition to get away this. I hope they turn the service around so I can at least try and see if the food is good or not.

p8tM7OR8FoKr19McemK-1A.text: Food - Amazing! Service - Super Friendly! Atmosphere - trendy, modern, and loud Price - A lil' high  Overall a great place! UqXmdW-Z21ghoUqzpTDhDw.text: I'm from Los Angeles (land of the vegans), and I was in town for JAMZ Cheer competition with my daughter and husband. I've tasted a LOT of vegan food. I've been plant-based for the better part of 15 years. I ordered The Modern Vegan via Uber Eats. THIS PLACE IS AMAZING!!! In fact, it's so good that I called them when I finished eating to let them know it tasted like "sex" in my mouth. I ordered the breakfast burrito, and asked that they leave out the corn. It was perfect! My daughter had the waffles with fruit, and I had one, because their portion sizes are so big that it fed my husband, my daughter, and myself. Run to The Modern Vegan with your mouth wide open, and don't look back.

-dW6S5k-BNH8tu_-ZICMhw.text: OMG the food here is nothing short of SPECTACULAR! So much variety, so many fantastic options. We tried the Jambalaya, Philly Cheese steak, Lobster roll and lousiana fried chikn. The chikn, philly and Jambalaya were PHENOMENAL and I will be dreaming of them!.Lobster roll mehhh too many onions and mayo. Wont order that again. None the less I need this place close to me in California so I can try the entire menu. It's far above many Vegan places I have been to. Now the CONS....SERVICE... subpar to say the least.  Waitresses are young and non observant.  Walked past my table 4x and didnt remove empty plates and trash...I felt they were more attentive to talking among themselves then checking on the customers. I had to bite my tongue a couple times at the fact my.waitress swept the floors, played in her hair and then handled food....that's horrible. All in all I will 100% return cause let's face it...good vegan is hard to find and worth the trouble.  My 4 stars was due to service,  NOTfood.

0usM_6FmpBTWYWNZbptXiA.text: The modern vegan is exactly what it sounds like. I didn't expect much, and from the moment I walked in, I felt a different energy... not the kind of energy I would like to eat in. I wanted a to sit at this table with my 3 friends and they told me we weren't allowed because they can only sit parties of 6 or more. I looked around at the other 4 customers who were in there and told the waitress that they weren't very busy.... she said it didn't matter. I asked if I could talk to the manager about the seating she said no. Then they seated a party of five there.... I would like to say that the menus looked like they had a lot of options, but the menu aesthetics weren't appealing. The restaurant vibe was not up to par. I decided to leave because the service was not pleasant. I told them thanks but I am deciding I want to go somewhere else... as I was walking out, the lady there who was servicing us said "men will be men" which is very sexist. I did not appreciate the service I had at all and will not go back.

aRoTuAxjo7H0OMK81-IUZQ.text: While visiting from out of state we had researched vegan places to eat in Vegas and we were most excited about TMV, unfortunately from the very beginning it was not a great experience. One food item we ordered was unavailable so we chose another, this was told to us after the waitress had already put in the order so we had to choose another item. That food item, what happens in Vegas, came out and we were told our other dish should be up shortly. It had been at least 5 minutes since the first dish came out when the general manager approached the table saying that the waffle machine was actually broken and I wouldn't be getting my chicken and waffles and to order something else. I then chose the V'Eggs Benny and it definitely left a lot to be desired. The hollandaise sauce had a weird sweet cashew/soy milk flavor you often find in vegan sauces with little flavor of anything else and everything was one consistent texture of mushiness. The What Happens in Vegas was good, though as mentioned came out way before the other order and was then cold when it came time to eat. The manager gave us a $1.50 off though in hindsight we really should have only paid half of what we did as the entire experience from start to end was met with issues. Wish we would have spent our time and money elsewhere.  UPDATE:  Just changed to one star after after reading previous reviews and how the owner reacts to negative reviews and I'm appalled I even stepped foot in this place. Honestly we didn't even notice gratuity was already added to the check as we were so ready to get out and on with our day, unfortunately we ended up tipping them close to double what they deserved for subpar service and seriously bad and bland food. There were so many better vegan spots in Vegas that you can enjoy during your visit, don't waste your time here.

photos.caption: Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. V&#39;Eggs Benny, not great, just something very off about the sauce.
Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. What Happens in Vegas, fine, but something I can easily make myself.

X_qZFvB5kvL6xTVIrS2sJQ.text: I haven't reviewed anywhere in a long time, but this experience put such a bad taste in my mouth that I had to come out of the woodwork.   I went here on a Friday afternoon during a lull, so you would think we would receive great service, right? WRONG. We put in an order for a ginger ale, mac & cheese balls, a waffle, and a Reuben. The mac & cheese balls were never put in - we ended up getting them at the end of our meal and we were so full we didn't eat more than a bite. I was also not too impressed with the taste of them - the sauce is a saving grace. The noodles were pretty dry and the bacon they put in them overpower whatever cheesiness you may get. Meh.    The ginger ale took multiple waitresses to get, and wasn't brought until about 10-15 minutes after we ordered. It was just sitting at the end of the bar, taunting us. We were one of maybe 3 couples in the entire restaurant, and it was a chore to get their attention, and each time they actually came to the table to give us our order, they immediately turned around without asking if there was anything else, which caused the perpetual game waving our hands around hoping someone else would see us. More on the ginger ale later.   The waffle was enormous and my boyfriend said it was quite good, however it was very, very dry. When we finally got the attention of our waitress again (who was busy cleaning the restaurant. The entire time.) we asked for some syrup. We received about two tablespoons and they had the gall to charge us 50 or 75 cents (can't remember the exact price but I'm still shocked) for more syrup?! When they barely put any on in the first place?! Ridiculous.   My Reuben was okay but nothing to write home about. Portions were decently sized, but majorly overpriced by $2-4. The manager did eventually come over once they realized that our mac & cheese balls never came and apologized for the wait. When she asked if there was anything else, I asked for a refill on the ginger ale and she said there were no refills on drinks, but she would refill as a gesture. She brought out the can and - omg. Literally a tiny half-can of ginger ale. For $3. Half the glass is ice. What a ripoff.   This restaurant really reminded me a lot of NYC eateries without any of the charm or service. Overpriced, under-seasoned, and trying to get every last cent out of you they can while ignoring their customers. I really love going to local restaurants, but this is one I do not think I would come back to. Only giving it an extra star because it has late-night hours and an expansive and fully vegan menu, but there are so many other options on this side of town that will give us great service, great food, and at reasonable prices.

UB5ublCV9OZqT6n9_4p-TA.text: My Favorite Vegan spot ... The waffle and chicken is amazing. The ribs are awesome too. I love how the add to the menu.  This is the best Vegan spot in Vegas and the only Vegan spot that has a grand menu.

6o0yBBy1lFFRLFfoVKOeCA.text: Update - They Don't Deserve Your Business!  I ordered a Rueben with a side salad and they gave me a double chicken sandwich with bacon and fries. I don't eat fried food, and I had this brought to me so add in inconvenience. They do not take phone calls or resolve issues, but they'll take your money and leave you hungry. vDoi_10qVcAnw7so-vi7iA.text: This is my go to spot in Vegas. Every time I come to Vegas, I go back to this place and it's just wonderful! Their breakfast and brunch option are incredible. Steak & eggs, chicken & waffles, everything I've gotten has been delicious, and the staff here is super friendly. Their menu is a bit overwhelming, but honestly it just keeps me coming back to try more and more.

CohUStxjCqYNGWt9P2I2_A.text: Umm, it was okay?  My waiter was super friendly and I loved him. Swear we were bffs by the time I finished my meal.   The mac and cheese is one of my top 3 vegan mac and cheeses! Nutty and creamy and a tiny hint of spice in the background to bring to together. I considered ordering a second side to-go, and I regret never doing so to this day!  The chicken and waffles were...interesting. The waffle was everything a waffle should be. Crusty on the outside, fluffy on the inside. Not too overdone but not gummy either. Juuuust right! The chicken tho, it was just too much! I don't hate seitan, but a fat hunk of fried seitan with no other buffer but a waffle was overwhelming. I just kept chewing, and chewing and chewing and chewing, with some hot sauce of course! No way I'd be able to eat all that with no other outstanding flavors. I think it would've been better as chicken strips.   The potatoes underneath were sweet! An unpleasant surprise. Savory potatoes would've been the PERFECT complement the seitan needed, but that mark was missed.   The sweet potatoes, and the sweet waffle and the fried but otherwise flavorless seitan was off balance...That mac and cheese tho!  My sister raved about her biscuits and gravy.
