Kfyc8FRfxoAilLSUjUAO3Q.text: This spot is located near UNLVs Thomas & Mack Center. The outside of the restaurant is deceiving since it just has black and white signs with TMV on the windows. When you open the door and walk in the ambiance shifts to what reminded me of this place called "LIME" in SF. Pretty much a daytime club. The first time we went, was in the morning. The music is loud and the portions are large. We shared, Breakfast Potato Skins, I ordered the Lobster Roll and bf got the Chik'n & Waffles. All of which were amazing! No to-go box needed. The service was okay, the server seemed to be new at serving but no complaints.  The second time we came was during their first late night service hours. We pulled up around 2am. The late night menu is a shorter version of the main menu but still plenty of options to choose from. This time I got the jerk sandwich and he got the reuben. Again, amazing...and unbelievably vegan. No box needed again! The owner asked us how everything was during this visit and it was mighty delicious! Will definitely be back more often.

vA7FjEbxH9NUlNF_cFmyyQ.text: Another great vegan spot off the strip. Unlike some of the others, though, this one is actually relatively close by. It's located adjacent to the University of Nevada campus, probably a 10 min taxi or ridehail trip from the strip.   When you walk into the restaurant, you immediately get the whole "modern" part of their name. The inside is very monochromatic; that is, most of the furniture and decor is bright white, with some black accents here and there. At a quick glance, you could almost think the restaurant was on the higher end of things. But once doing a deeper look, the types of plain tables, setup, and (of course) menu items steers you back to the reality: MDV offers comfort food, plain and simple.  And they sure do offer a lot of it. Their menu is a massive, over-sized one pager. A huge portion of it is devoted to breakfast items alone (which can be ordered any time of the day), with the rest being a mix of mostly normal lunch and dinner offerings, desserts, etc.  On my last trip to Vegas, I actually ate here twice. First, yes, it was that good. But second, it was on my way back to the airport and I wanted something easy to carry onto the plane with me.   On the first visit, my co-worker and I shared an order of corn dogs, and I got the reuben for my main. The corn dogs were out of this world. They were definitely more than your standard store-bought variety, not that there's necessarily anything wrong those. But the batter on MDV's Corn Dog was the best I've had yet. Not only that, quite rightfully (but sadly, not commonly elsewhere) they had mayo, ketchup, and mustard on the side.  As for the reuben, it was certainly up there in the rankings of reubens I've had. The texture and construction was really on point, and it tasted exactly how I hoped.   The next day, I got a club sandwich, which was equally good and really massive. Even after transporting it a little to the airport, it was still quite intact and not a mess (as can often happen with a poorly made sandwich).  I must also say that the staff I interacted with both days were extremely nice. The waitress on the first night had a lot of great recommendations, and frequently checked in on us to ensure we had everything we needed. The following day, the guy behind the bar (who was assisting with take away orders) was generally very friendly, and had a nice large glass of water poured for me while I waited (a simple, but nice touch).  With a menu that size, I'm definitely looking forward to trying some more options next time I'm in town.

nGBKSCJpwe097Q-us6vr3w.text: Great food and Great customer service! Love the Louisiana Fried Chicken . The atmosphere is friendly and not to fancy. Modern and comfortable.

ZiHUEL0KUYhAA4FDVa-CGg.text: I was super excited to try The Modern Vegan which I had bookmarked for a long time.   We arrived early on a Saturday, around 5:30pm. We were immediately sat and provided with menus.   The menu was quite extensive. There was a lot going on and a lot of items to pick from. This was both a good and a bad thing for me. It was a good thing because often there aren't many vegan choices on the menu. This was a bad thing because I'm indecisive and it made picking something much harder.   Our server was friendly, taking the time to explain the menu. In addition to the menu there is also a bar.   We settled on burgers and sandwiches. The cowboy burger was amazing. It was a burger with bbq sauce, bacon, and grilled onions, all vegan of course.   Price point is about $17 a plate. This is good quality vegan food so that price is what I would have expected.   It's a bummer that this place isn't closer to where I live. I'll definitely be back to try other menu items.

uyLFQL4yR5vHGlLnSxecaw.text: If our vegan friends who came into down hasn't told us about TMV we would've been complete posers!   On a Sunday afternoon, this was the hot spot to hit up for a late lunch/brunch with visiting friends. The ambiance and environment is super modern and contemporary with hints of black and white all around. It's a step up from a diner or quick-eat restaurant. There's a comfortable feel while also feeling trendy and hip.  We tried the corn dogs and queso for appetizers which were super delicious! The corn dogs were light and fluffy and the in-house-made "mayo" was a perfect compliment! The queso has just the tiny kick to it with corn chips on the side. My husband has the chicken and waffles which took some time since it was the most popular item in the joint but it was well worth it! The syrup wasn't overly sweet and the crispy "chicken" fit well with the fluffy waffle. I had the veggie Benedict which came home with me! The portion was very generous and filling! The mashed potatoes went really well with the spicy coconut "hollandaise" sauce and veggies. Our friends enjoyed their Reuben and the breakfast combo!   We will definitely be back because it's the business - just knowing it's super popular so there's always a wait during peak days and times!

Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Quest and chips

4U1fmYmgpUUXqNvUFeXrmA.text: Yum! Yum! Yum! Breakfast, lunch or dinner, you can't go wrong with anything on the menu. So good!!!!!

WhrnO_2RGIF26XFfiTGAMQ.text: We love this restaurant.  Truly delicious vegan food, tons of options, and generous portions.  The staff has always been super friendly.    We wish we lived closer so we could eat here more often.

2yhjKI3S6qwgvnaPBv-D7w.text: Great food and option, the inside is very modern and nice. Unless it was just bad timing I do think they need more support staff, waiter didn't have a chance to check on me at any point because he had to many tables & took a long time to get check. Other than that great place!

photos.caption: Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. What Happens in Vegas

4jn4LyCIvpwTGD46nTys7Q.text: Damn. I REALLY wanted to get behind this place because I love when new vegan joints open up here and I want to love them and support them but unfortunately they kind of missed the mark. I've tried this place out twice now and unfortunately, I don't think I'll be returning.  The first time we came we tried the Frenchie, V'eggs Benedict and a side of their Baked Mac n Cheese.  Hunnie Bunnie liked her French toast and the mac n cheese was pretty good - they make their own cheese sauce and it's very CHEESE-LIKE and SAUCY! But the V'eggs Benedict was DRENCHED in sauce, I had to scrape most of it off and the dish itself was rather flavorless.  The second time we came we tried several items: Spaghetti and Meatballs: Not enough sauce or flavor.  Eggplant Bolognese: Not enough sauce or flavor either.  Buffalo Chick'n sandwich: This was pretty freakin good, but honestly what isn't when it's drenched in a delicious sauce?  Popcorn chicken appetizer: These were pretty good as well, they tasted like actual popcorn chicken.  Mashed potatoes: Barely warm and no flavor.  Onion rings: The breading wouldn't stay on to save its' life and there was ZERO flavor. It does come with a dipping sauce but it should have good flavor WITHOUT the sauce.  I had also asked for a side of cheese sauce because I wanted to dip my fries in it when I got my sandwich but they brought it out with the popcorn chicken.   They brought the appetizer out first WITH my cheese sauce which I thought was odd because I wanted the cheese sauce to dip my fries in when I got my sandwich.  And after that the rest of the food kind of trickled out. The mashed potatoes side. And then the two pasta dishes a little later and then the onion rings and then finally my sandwich - it dragged because the server thought I ordered something else.  I really wish I could have ranted and raved about how amazing this place is. The menu is huge and looks like it has great potential but the food is expensive and flavorless. Chep said it was "The worst food he's had in Las Vegas in ten years." I wouldn't say that, but it wasn't GOOD.

photos.caption: Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spaghetti and Meatballs: Not enough sauce or flavor.

Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Buffalo Chicken Sandwich: Can&#39;t go wrong with Buffalo sauce, good stuff. Fries were meh.

Tm8DyGDBpfpBAOL9HZ-Arw.text: My husband and I are visiting and decided to find some vegan restaurants and found this gem. We went for lunch and it was delicious. Out of all the vegan places we've visited throughout the country, this place had an awesome variety of options to choose from! We were there for happy-hour and got bottomless mimosas! The bartender/waiter Scott was awesome and personable and he just kept bringing out the drinks and he made personalized surprise drinks, which were amazing! He recommended his favorites (which we decided to order) and it was delicious (Fish Tacos, Cowboy Burger). Excellent customer service and definitely recommend if you're in town!

kuD2sSq7UhvkqsFQmzE0lQ.text: I landed in Vegas, and my first vegan spot was here. As soon as I walked in, I was greeted at the door and graciously offered to put my luggage in a secure area while I ate. For my cocktail, I got the blue Hawaiian which was fairly large for it's price. For my appetizer, I got the Canadian poutine and I ate every ounce of it - the gravy on top was to die for! Then for my breakfast, I got the V'eggs Benny... the meal itself was amazing except I definitely could have gone without the hollandaise sauce due to it having a heavy and weird flavor palate. Other than the sauce, the place and atmosphere itself was amazing!! Would definitely recommend.

NzpsuPMICHHftkysYBNlzw.text: Food was amazing and everything I expected. As others have mentioned service can be hit or miss. I have to say my server was super sweet,  but not as attentive. I had to ask for silverware, extra napkins and my coffee was never refilled.  I work in the service industry, so I try to be pretty forgiving, but the restaurant wasn't crowded, so there really wasn't an excuse for the lack of service.  Thus this is why I'm giving this place 4 stars instead of 5.   Food is a 5 Service 3.5  Will I go back? Yes, because their menu is so extensive, I really have more items I'd love to try on my next visit.    Hopefully I will be able to update my review to 5 stars with better service on my next visit.

oD4E94hFAvWjmdm7S-zT0Q.text: Food was okay. What I didn't like about this place is that our food didn't come at the same time. My bf was almost done with his chicken and waffles before my food came. This was the second time we've been here. Probably won't be back.

sOwLi-qpb61YITB2e18okA.text: I drove from Los Angeles to try this restaurant. The pictures on IG and yelp looks amazing, but unfortunately this was a waste of time and money.  I arrived with my family at 8:30 pm 3/30/19, before we could all get in the door the server Lindsey, said they close in 30 min. We said that was fine. She then said "ok just letting you know because at 9 you would have to get out" we then said ok, then she insisted again "I just have to let you know because i don't know if that's enough time to eat" I then said "it seems like you don't want to serve us" she then acted like that wasn't the case.  After being seated we were handed the very limited Tuesday menu. We ordered our food and were not asked anything about drinks. Minutes later 2 dishes were brought out, 10 min after that 2 more dishes 10 min after that the final 3 dishes. It wasn't until we asked if they had drinks she rudely responded with "yes I have you give you guys water" without offering any other option until we asked.  The food was obviously nothing like the photos and poorly tossed together. The inside of the burrito was not warm, the sauce on top was cold like it was just grabbed out the fridge ((the burrito/sauce is served over paper that gets soggy and rips so try not to eat the paper)), French toast had barely any syrup, the strawberry served with one of the dishes was old, and the one of the dishes was very salty, but we didn't complain.  My son went to ask Lindsey for some more syrup but before he could even get within a 5 ft radius of her she pointed to the restroom and said "restroom is over there".  I've never had such awful customer service. And on top of it she had the nerve to add her own gratuity. I would not suggest anyone come here.

U4LzVx5-dLeCvhk2xUrGEQ.text: First time here and we were very impressed with the healthy food selections (menu options were vast). And who knew vegan food was so delicious. My party had the Mango Madness as a starter, then for our meals we had the Stuffed Portobello Steak, the Buffalo burger, the Snob burger, and to top it off for dessert we had the Holy Hell. Unique names for items, but each item was delicious. Definitely coming back here again.

h2DJNQYdjR_AVWr3URaOYQ.text: Restaurant is located in a really sketchy area, I had to make 3 loops around the block to locate it because maps kept telling me to turn into this run down apartment complex lol but once inside it's very clean, classy, & modern. I got the "What Happens in Vegas" which includes vegan eggs, asparagus, vegan sausage, vegan bacon and a piece of toast. I ordered it to-go and it was ready in about 10 minutes! Everything was DELICIOUS! I couldn't eat the toast because I'm Gluten-Free & i don't believe they have gluten free options (at least not that i saw on the menu), but this was the best vegan breakfast I've had in Vegas so far! The sausage smelled a little bit like beggin strips, but tasted just like real meat lol I highly recommend for vegans as well as curious meat eaters :)

G2NVDyK53znyCclEP0PcMg.text: I'm really not trying to leave a bad review so no one goes back there. I really hope that my honest feedback helps this Vegan Restaurant because there's not a lot of vegan places out in Vegas so I would love for this place to strive. So I came here for my first time with my my boyfriend on Saturday morning. We ordered some Waffles, Cauliflower wings, and a Gyro. My boyfriend is from Greece and he enjoyed a traditional gyro that taste so similar to the ones back at home! That was a ! The waffles were good but would be better if they came out warm not room temperature. And the Wings were the bomb.com! Another ! We got so excited about our amazing experience on Saturday, we wanted to return again the next day! Then it went down hill from there on Sunday. We decided to order corn dogs and cauliflower wings this time. The corn dogs came out first. As we bit into them, we both noticed the inside was uncooked! My boyfriend scooped out raw batter! We checked 3 out of 4 hot dogs and they were all like that. So we had them sent back and didn't want new ones anymore. When our wings came out, similar issue. The batter wasn't cooked all the way and we couldn't eat them fully, we had to pick off the raw breading and just eat the cauliflower my guess is the cook was OVER battering the food and it wasn't able to cook all the way throughly. The outside looked cooked but that wasn't the case inside. We kindly let the waitress know after we were done just to give the cooks a heads up about the inside being a lil raw, just so they're aware and wouldn't serve it like that to everyone else. We didn't demand our money back or a discount. Things happen and there was obviously different cook from the day before. We noticed that the cook argued with the waitress instead of taking honest feedback about the food. That was really unprofessional and we were just trying to help. Overall the service is amazing and the place has a cool vibe to it, but I think the food is really going to depend on who's cooking it that day. I have to give it a 2 star though because I left the restaurant not feeling well, and later threw up the batter from the wings! The raw batter obliviously didn't sit well in my stomach and that was the only thing I ate that day and I didn't drink I only had water.

oN7Sj11FdgcGqdCNlNLo9Q.text: The food is fantastic but their service is hit or miss.   Let me say that I have both eaten in the restaurant and ordered delivery.   My first tip for you is to not order delivery from grubhub (sorry yelp). Long story short but I had a horror story one evening in which I placed an order 3 times, was on the phone with yelp support twice, was on yelp support online twice, and still never received my order. I then ordered from Postmates and received the wrong order (this is about 2 -3 hours later).   I ended up speaking to the manager of the restaurant and she said that they were having issues on and off with yelp orders not going through correctly (both pickup and delivery) and that they were working on fixing it.   Another issue I have with them is that they never answer their phone. Literally. Never.   That being said I have ordered from Postmates after that and gotten my order on time and everything was correct so just be aware if you are ordering delivery.   Now let's get onto the food.   Their portion sizes are massive and the chicken and waffles can easily feed two people. I have had their burgers, sandwiches, salads, and obviously they're famous chicken and waffles and I have not been disappointed with any of them. I've also tried their smoothies which are delicious but extremely overpriced so I would not recommend them ($10 for a tiny little cup of blended up banana and almond milk  - no thank you)   This place has great hours on the weekend as well so if you need some late-night munchies you don't have to stray from your vegan diet .. it was honestly probably one of the most exciting parts for me!  The parking is also pretty good. They have a decent size parking lot and I've never had an issue getting a spot although it can be a little seedy if you come late at night.  I eat here every time I come to Vegas and I won't be stopping anytime soon!!

NSc8s5_okbwLaEBD9JNa9w.text: I love so much about this restaurant. The future is vegan and The Modern Vegan is leading the way. Delightfully diverse clientele -- all are welcome here. The menu is a playground of culinary options that are usually off-limits to vegans. Lobster Roll, anyone? Our server was very patient with us as we took forever to decide what to order. The jalapeno poppers were SPICY but very good if you can stand the heat. The onion rings were fantastic. The best item on the menu is the French toast. Trust me. Covered in berries it's a feast for the eyes as well as the tummy.  The service was a little slow (although as I said it took us a long time to order) so be aware if you're in a rush.

7AqSCO1Ks1udin3JwKPZVA.text: Full disclosure, I'm so not vegan. But I do stick to a meatless menu plan a couple days a week and have made several visits here over the past couple months trying a little bit of everything. I like what TMV offers for those with specialized diets, but those assuming "vegan" is synonymous with "healthy" will likely be overwhelmed by the massive menu that largely covers all the cheat meal bases from nachos and poutine to burgers and tacos. Luckily, they still have juices, smoothies, salads, and sandwiches for those wanting lighter options.  HITS: The Mexicana breakfast tacos are huge and tasty portion with three overflowing tacos. The cauliflower buffalo "wings" are among the best I've tried in terms of texture and even reheated well the next day. The hearts of palm-based "lobster" roll was impressive, with a tart and tangy sauce and a huge portion (an ongoing theme). The baked mac and cheese sauce was creamier than other versions I've tried and I think I detected a hint of butternut squash? Their sauces overall are one of their strengths. From the burger category, I customized the Cowboy (featuring Beyond Meat products) and enjoyed it as much as a regular burger, and the pretzel bun held up better than other vegan versions I've had around town, would omit the "bacon" next time.  SERVICE:  I've sat at the high top tables at the bar for all visits and usually get Anthony as my server, and have yet to encounter any of the service issues mentioned in other reviews. He's attentive and personable and I appreciate that I get my check taken care of quickly when I'm on limited time. Reading the snarky owner responses to low reviews is a turn off but I have only encountered positive vibes on site.   SUGGESTIONS: Portions are enormous which make the $10-15/dish prices reasonable but some of the apps are large enough to be meals in themselves, which could be adjusted or offered as half portions with lower pricing. Though I liked the tacos, the tortillas themselves didn't hold up well and their waffles are huge and dense.   Overall, I think they could pare down the menu a bit to improve quality. I appreciate that they offer so much but by now there's bound to be stuff that doesn't perform well or simply doesn't get ordered often. I am looking forward to bringing some vegan friends here who have just moved to Vegas- next I plan to try the loaded queso and the fish tacos!

mVTFA5Nk9aeldRVSjLORFA.text: Too many options I wanted to try it all! I ordered the TMV Club sandwich it was amazing! I've been vegan for about 8 months and it taste so much like if I was eating real bacon inside my Sandwich! Flavor was amazing and the sauce or spread was amazing! French fries were also really good and the sauce they offered me on the side was also amazing! Think it's called the TMV sauce but not too sure! Also ordered a Berry, peanut butter and chocolate smoothie! Also did not disappoint! Place closes at 11pm and people were still coming in until the very last minute! I will definitely be sure to come here every time I visit Las Vegas again!!!

YYDpcH82C3vEWzAMgkXGqA.text: Just landed in Vegas and I had no desire to leave the hotel. Searched for vegan restaurants that would be able to postmate to my hotel and the modern vegan was the closes. I gotta say, just reviewing the food alone IT WAS AMAZING! everything that I ordered was off the charts delicious. Decided to get the mac and cheese, the poutine fries and the San Diego salad. Everything was amazing delicious and didn't taste vegan at all. So flavorful, seasoned perfectly and such huge portions. If I wasn't so hungry, I think I could've made it last 2 servings. It was a little more than I was hoping to spend on the first meal here, but again it's Vegas, it was huge portions and why the f not?  On my way back to LA, I'm definitely planning on going back one more time and taking some with me. Absolutely in love with the modern vegan, anybody who comes to Vegas, I think even if you're not vegan wouldn't be disappointed with this place, it's just that good.

Oz4XQWfUyIvCArZT_HqpyQ.text: The weird blonde owner ate a French fry off the customers plate as the server was walking by to serve to table WTF?

VhpFElGxKMJbXFs9Cd6-qw.text: Writing an update since last year.   I'm happy to see they started opening on Monday for a Raw Vegan food day but my friend and I were both really disappointed.   What I can say though, is their burgers are great and their mac and cheese were good too. Hopefully, their gluten-free options are spruced up   I got the quinoa bowl and it was bland. It was made up of cabbage, carrot, mushroom, avocado, and quinoa. This seemed great and looked beautiful when brought out but the flavor was completely lacking. I would think maybe it is a one-off but I had gotten their avocado caprese which was just ok and also their pesto soup which, again, completely lacking in any memorable flavor. I'm writing this in hopes that management and staff will reassess their menu because this will be a BIG turn off to people and tbh, speaking for 2 vegans, 1 being Raw 1/3 of each year, we were both surprised at how this was coming out of the kitchen. We were really excited to come this day because not many places in Vegas have raw foods option and were left scratching our heads at how the ball could have been dropped on this. Hope this gets passed as a constructive critique and not a blast on the restaurant - really easy to add some flavors. I've been here 3 times and only once was it something I would want to come back for (the burger and mac and cheese). This will most likely not compete well in Cali. It just seems like any gluten-free option is not going to be good and I'm not sure why.

t8h6naHSnYvAeVnvrPUkZA.text: Drove here from Los Angeles to see what the hype was about, and I must admit the food is truly delicious. I had the cowboy and my girlfriend had the Gia. We shared a flamingo smoothie because the portions were so big.   The ambience was nice and the inside of the  restaurant was very clean. HOWEVER, Our only complaint was the service we received from the tall gentlemen at the bar with dreads who resembled a model. He didn't bring our drinks out until the food was about to be plated, I asked for ranch and he forgot and gave other customers multiple sauces. Additionally, he didn't ask if the food was good and offered dessert after handing us our bill. Honestly in the future I would rather get the food To go, if customer service isn't placed as a top priority.

0OAs5deZQLbw32B01C1IiA.text: The food was amazing! And the atmosphere is social and inviting.   I am spending the weekend in Las Vegas and have visited the Modern Vegan twice already. There menu is extensive and has variety. This is by far my favorite restaurant. Vegans and meat eaters, alike, will enjoy eating here. Plus the staff is kind and they are helpful in suggesting great menu selections. They've only been open a few weeks, and I hope they continue to thrive so I can go again the next time in Vegas.   Between my boyfriend and I, we had the Pulled Pork sandwich on a pretzel bun, the buffalo chicken sandwich, the BLAT (bacon, lettuce, avocado, tomato sandwich), and a dessert. Everything was good!

BOMVq-EaqjNNKs5xdnBJ1Q.text: Service was great Mando our waiter was very nice and helpful in choosing our order   this not at all rated by him. Just the food!  HOWEVER, food was not at all that it was hyped to be. Coming from LA VEGAN FOOD this place blew  too expensive not at all worth the price.  I had the chick'n and waffles, the mashed potatoes were good, but overall the waffles and chick'n was flavorless.  My boyfriend and brother ordered the great American. Using the beyond patty I didn't think they could go wrong, but they did the bun had no taste. Presentation was great but as far as taste, if it wasn't for the BEYOND patty it would be a zero.  For appetizers we got jalapeno poppers and Mac n cheese. Jalapeno poppers were really good   Mac n cheese again missing something not good at all.  I gave this place a 2 because of their food and prices. Overall total paid was $71 not including tip.  Coming from LA and vegan for 3yrs. I do not recommend and if you do try it coming from LA it was more expensive then VEGGIE GRILL, and SAGE BISTRO.   In my opinion, if I ever went back to Las Vegas I will NOT be returning to MODERN VEGAN.  PICTURES ARE deceiving

vHUOhcas68m2O7iBUnFuGw.text: Love it !!!!!!!! This restaurant is awesome.. the place is cool, big enough and comfy.  Buuuut the food omg is delicious! 3bZqIM8yaxODFSKrJCs08g.text: Not great. Very fast food vegan/not high quality. My tofu scramble was oily and my toast and sausage were burnt. They also told me that they do not allow substitutions. Lots of menu options and cool atmosphere but overall don't recommend.

oIh0o0tV2AWeNC4R4pNhyw.text: The place was great. Small. Clean. Friendly staff. Glad I found this vegan gem here in vegas.

t38IgpgYuJnaQQPD3nK4UA.text: This place is pretty cool. I sat at the bar since i was dining alone and the bartender was very nice. The cheese fries were excellent and the portion was pretty decent for the price. I went there late so had to order from a limited menu but will go earlier another time to for more menu options. Its great to find a vegan place that stays open late and has Good food. They have a few gluten free items which is awesome and even a few organic items.  I look forward to going back soon.

P5Hb1rz0HEpETCP5afsHNw.text: Have been coming to the modern vegan for a while now. Staff is always very friendly and the food is usually good. Big fan of the skillets and the burgers. Went yesterday and had a new server names Moe. This guy was awesome. If I ever had a complaint with TMV it would be that sometimes I'm unhappy with the service or care from employees at times, but Moe absolutely crushed it.

VrDiF6_FPgENw86JAB114Q.text: Today was the grand opening, congratulations!   The food did take a little longer than you might typically expect, but come on! it's literally DAY ONE! Of course everything isn't going to be fast on the first day!   Everyone was kind and sweet, the restaurant was packed, and most importantly / the food was BOMB! Everything tasted delicious which is the most important thing!   Don't come to a brand new place in the first week if you're in a massive rush. Maybe come back a little later in the month. The food is for sure worth the wait and you will enjoy it more when you have time to be patient!   I think today was amazing. The food was great. The restaurant is clean and tidy and the food speaks for itself!   Update: May 2018 Came back with a friend for a late lunch, ordered 4 things, all absolutely amazing!!!!!! Breakfast potato skins / delish! Louisiana fried chicken, outstanding! Fish tacos - legitimately tasted just like regular fish tacos (but no death!) and finally the grilled cheese - ORDER IT NOW!!!!!!

wBXP5sSXkofD-Xs3rY_R0g.text: I've been waiting to go to TMV since it opened, but figured I'd wait a bit so it wouldn't be as busy as opening week. My fiance and I came around 6pm post-gym and very hungry, so we went all out!   Cosmopolitan smoothie: really liked it, was smooth consistency and had good flavors. Didn't overpower our meal.  Truffle Mushroom soup: had really good flavor, but the consistency wasn't creamy enough. Did not taste any truffle flavor. Just call it mushroom soup and I would still eat it.  Side of mac & cheese: slightly bland, missing a bit of salt. It has potential though. There were some vegan bacon bits in there which gave it good texture.  The Buffalo burger w/fries: the tastiest vegan burger according to my fiance. It had a good buffalo flavor, but it didn't overpower the sandwich. The avocado was a nice touch. He asked for ranch on the side which made it super tasty. Fries a little under salted, but the crispiness was good.  The Rancho w/salad: Definitely bit off more than I could chew with this one. Didn't realize it came with a double chick'n patty, but I ended up taking the second one home. The patty is super crunchy and tasty, and as a whole that burger was delicious! I like that they used spinach for the salad. I got the dressing on the side.  The service: We were seated right away and the restaurant still had a decent amount of people at their tables. Our server Missy was very nice and helped me pinpoint which burger to get. It looked like the place was pretty busy and only 3 servers I think? Either way, there was always someone to refill our waters and check on us to make sure we were okay or if we needed anything.   The price: A bit pricey, but tasty and worth it to go once in a while for a nice meal. The quality is on point.  We will be back to try the breakfast items next time!

b8Nf8QyQd6bk3dHB4EChsA.text: Came here over the weekend on December 30th 2018 for breakfast we had order the chicken and waffles,  burrito and also the eggless Benedict.  the portions were huge the food was delicious I highly recommend if you're in Vegas to go to this location if you're vegetarian vegan great service will definitely be coming back once I come back to Vegas.

0oAklSaXpCyzGtLItjUy0g.text: The food is delicious,  the staff is friendly and courteous,  I recommend this restaurant to everyone I know. Love this place.

uJviTrDDpAVtvHSfP9ax7w.text: Not great. Everything was fried, and the flavors were lackluster. Go to one of the other great vegan restaurants in Vegas- I recommend Blackout.

2yijH6rL6463awN5GieB9Q.text: The reality of Las Vegas is that just about everything is larger than life, has a great looking veneer but it all hides cheap crap, lots and lots of cheap crap. Sadly this place is just more Vegas. Large portions, great looking but not really good at all. I ended up forcing down about a quarter of the food on my plate before giving up. It was certainly disappointing as I'd hope to get a break from the normal vibe of this town.  Update: I wish I had seen how the owner responded to reviews prior to going as I would have just skipped it all together. There is not reason to enable that kind of behavior.

JVylM-LTK1x8FbrJ7RKvlA.text: As a local vegan, I'm absolutely head over heels for TMV's food. All your old favorites are made vegan so well here. However, every time I either eat at this restaurant or order delivery through postmates, they completely bungle my order and have generally incompetent service. The staff is all very friendly but they constantly mess up my order, take a long time, and ignore you. I wish there were more alternatives so I could eat elsewhere.

h3ojwuAWyfkYXFTDGVuhZw.text: The Food Presentation: I saw pictures of the food on the website I ordered the "What Happens in Vegas", based on the lovely photo , I was expecting a healthy bushel of asparagus (~7 pieces), hearty chunks of tofu in the scramble, 1/2 a plate full of the potatoes seasoned with an abundance of basil, a hearty portion of the vegan bacon, and vegan sausage. When my plate arrived, my partner and I could not hold in our laughter.  See my picture. The plate had two scrawny, shriveled pieces of asparagus, a fried mess of crumbs posing as the tofu scramble, and potatoes covering 1/4 of the plate with just a dash of basil, and 2 extremely oily pieces of vegan bacon. The vegan sausage was the only thing on the plate that looked like the advertised picture.  The items were spread on the plate in a manner that screamed "we ran out of food and are trying our best to make it appear as though we did not".    The Food Taste: Underwhelming.  The tofu scramble had a crumb consistency and lacked any distinguishable flavor.  It was hard to get over the crumb-like consistency.  You could not stab it with your fork like a real tofu scramble because it was too crumby.  The crumbs rolled off the fork.  The only way to get it into your mouth was to shovel it in quickly like a starving person.  Even then, some crumbs escaped to the floor.  The asparagus was bland.  The potatoes were okay but did not have anything that stood out about it.  The vegan bacon was just oily.  The only thing that was good was the vegan sausage.  My partner got the breakfast burrito, which was primarily ice-burg lettuce and onions.  The onions over-powered the dish.  A burrito from Chipotle customized to vegan would have tasted much better (and had more nutritious lettuce) for less than half the price. Also, the coffee was not the best (watery, gas station grade coffee).    The Service:  We waited well over 1 hour for our food.  The waiter was quick to put in our order and bring us coffee, however, he did not check on us again until about 45 minutes later to tell us that our food was almost ready.  He also did not provide a coffee refill until that point.  I wasn't actually sure if our waiter was supposed to be our waiter.  I somehow thought he was the bartender who stepped in real quick because everyone else was busy.  Then we got ignored for a good 45 minutes.  It did give ample time to observe the staff and see the mini-dramas occurring amongst the employees.  Given, they were probably stressed that they were running out of food or something and had to spread the plates thin.  There seemed to be mini-meetings/scolding's between the gal that appeared to be the owner and the employees.  The atmosphere seemed extremely tense. Unprofessional.    The Price: The "What Happens in Vegas" and breakfast burrito were each $15.  Compared that to VegeNation that offers a Tofu Scramble and Vegan Burrito for $11.95 each, I would call the Modern Vegan not much value for your buck.  Also, given the taste factor, remember you can get a Chipotle burrito that is customized Vegan for just $6.50.  The Ambiance:  Average. Looks like it was a 7-11 or night club converted into a restaurant (based on the location and tinted black windows). Some good ideas, but still had a run-of-the-mill Ikea feel to it.   I was excited to try this place, but the overall food quality, taste, service, and price were lacking.  Especially since I tried VegeNation the day before (which was excellent) and had a direct comparison.

b_7DCGLfUqTks38TZBR_UQ.text: Everything looked and tasted amazing. So many choices on the menu that I wanted to try everything. I had the Buddha bowl and hubby had the meatball sandwich. A must stop for Vegan food lovers. Super helpful staff!!

Jh0hkrxQKuUFSzBUK0SJ8g.text: There are so many great options at the Modern Vegan., like so many. I would recommend the TMV cheese fries for a starter. My sisters had the king burger and the skillet number four entree (they thoroughly enjoyed them both)!

89Y-Jw7D0PjSnZjJiMV77w.text: To get to the point of why 2 stars: Service- the server couldn't make a recommendation which is part of her job; our food came out late and way after other people who were seated after us got there food.  Menu- the kitchen was backed up and can't seem to handle such a large menu Food- lobster sandwich was possibly made with heart of palm that was way too salty. Corn dogs were actually really really good! So were our alcoholic becer Portion and price- too big and too high; appetizers such as corn dogs come too big (4 whole corn dogs). They should cut the price and the portion so people can afford the food and be able to try more without getting stuffed. Overall, the prices on the menu are too expensive for the experience and the location which is not the safest area and a bit run down.   TMV is new and maybe with a little time they will improve, I hope. Great items on the menu I would look forward to trying in 6months when I give them another chance.   Update 5/26 visit ( won't go again)  This food was delicious but the service; here is my feedback: we were the first ones there in the morning when they opened. the skillet came out 12 minutes before the waffle. One waitress came by and said it was because the food is made to order and we only have one waffle iron. The next server blamed it on "new cooks". Why can no one take ownership for the issue? My silverware was placed on a dirty silicone mat when they took my skillet away to keep it warm. I asked for new silverware and they asked me why? Gross! You know I had a very bad experience but I had no "Service recovery". Nothing was comped on my bill. This is the second time I tried eating there and I won't be back again. I hope that they hire a front of the house manager who can actually run a restaurant. They got the food but they cannot execute.

YdbDPs8O5E1JvgaegV2GKA.text: I was surprised to find out that the modern vegan was open all hours, we came after a concert and I was definitely ready to grab. I ordered the fried peanut butter and jelly, but I wasn't the biggest fan. The other people that I was with got chicken and nachos and both of those were delicious. I definitely recommend this place for any vegan and anybody who is not vegan as well it tasted delicious.

PQakh3VvULlFfttrHISmtA.text: I'm coming in Sunday with my non vegan, fiance and sister in law. And while browsing the menu pictures I noticed some pictures of less then stellar reviews, coupled with a response from the manager. Which of course led me to read other reviews. Which lead me to actually posting something.   I tried this place spontaneously one morning after a few errands I ran on campus at UNLV. It's great that I could practically hop a fence and get to a vegan joint for lunch or breakfast. Who cares about the strip mall, this is Vegas. Embrace some diversity.  But more to the point. I came in around 10am, and they weren't too busy. The hostess was nice. The decor was clean, white and simple. But had some very nice touches. Hey the furniture may come from ikea, but so does my mattress and I love it.   My server was attentive, refilled my water glass a few times, I sorely needed it. Room temperature water is actually absorbed better by your digestive system. This is a desert. (Summer is coming TMV, larger water glasses might be a good idea).   I had chk'n and waffles. Which I've only had a few times in the last decade. They were good. I might have preferred the breading slightly less crispy, but wasn't a deal breaker. The waffle, was good. The mashed potatoes were delicious. I wanted more syrup.. but then I wanted gravely too. I asked for neither and wasn't unsatisfied. Nearly finished the double size portion.   I did ask for recommendations from the server. I wanted a sandwich to go. I ride a motorcycle so space is limited and as I usually pack a lunch in the same size container. I needed something that would fit. I really wanted to try everything, last on my list was the Rueben. I've actually never had the meat version. (15 yrs vegan). But this is what he recommended, though he couldn't see it fitting in my tubberware. It did, and I told him to hold the fries when I ordered. I would have liked the option to get the sandwich al carte, but ended up just telling him to save that order of fries for himself. The Ruben was delicious, half of it was lunch and I came home and threw the other half in the oven for dinner. Just as good.   It's a bit pricey, I could make similar items at home for about the same cost, with more servings...but do you know how nice it is to have so many options? And people will cook it for you, craft the details, do your dishes and serve you. It's a rare experience in my book. Yes over tried nearly every vegan joint in town. I like Violets, but it's way too far away from where I live and work.   I could see a lighter portions option being a big hit, or a order to go menu designed for the broke college student. Maybe in the future? Just thoughts.   Gia, you've done a fantastic job. This is truly a Vegas Vegan restaurant. Thank you.   As a note. I gave this 5 stars. I work in food service, so maybe I have a more realistic approach to expectations. But just because I don't particularly like or agree with something doesn't mean it isn't good or relevant.

o4zt4zILPqZmL_rILH5kzw.text: I think my boyfriend enjoyed it more than me. He loved the Mac n cheese balls and breakfast burrito. I liked the burrito, but not the Mac n cheese balls. I had the chicken n waffle as recommended by the server, but I thought it was ok. The breading came off the chicken and the asparagus didn't have the woody part of the stalk removed. You only got 2 pieces of asparagus. I'll go back though and order the Rueben. I also brought in a coffee drink come another place, and they made it seem like a big deal. I didn't even think about it. I didn't mind putting it back in the car.

UGM_yP2OfGVrrmeNUyrMXA.text: My first experience in a Vegan restaurant while on a first date! The waiter "Alex" was amazingly friendly and welcoming. I'll definately be going back.

TeLDDL-NvCJlOL7VUDCdqw.text: The food is really good. Very good!!!  Unfortunately, the times I've gone they're out of half the menu items. And to make matters worse, you're not told they're out til you've already placed your order. This is a common problem for restaurants that have a big menu. I think that's the case with TMV - they haven't learned to manage their inventory because it's too large. They probably need to pair it down a bit. (They should, however, inform customers right when they're seated rather than after they order.)  Today we were told the issue was that 'the waffle iron broke.' Weird, right? Because a restaurant should have more than one. And you can just go buy another one real quick at Target around the corner. Because it's Fathers' Day weekend and likely to be kind of busy for brunch. (Just for the record, they were also out of vanilla ice cream and other items too.)  I want this place to work. They just need to figure out this issue and stop disappointing people.

ShSP6yjm4cJgk2Jzl2tNeA.text: Overpriced and bland. I have been here a couple times and am not very impressed. Their carrot cake is truly just raw carrots inside a small slice of cake. The vegan tacos are just your regular bagged tortillas, barely warmed up, filled with tofu and potatoes. No salsa to accompany them. I've also tried their Asian noodles, which again, lacked flavor, very disappointed. Most dishes average around $15 - $17 , definitely not worth it. Service is ok, so 3 stars for that.

oMNIu7y_pfJd4fYZpuZgPQ.text: The service and the food was great, but the plates are HUGE and the employees do not tell you so. We had a ridiculous amount of food left

The service was excellent, everyone was so friendly and accommodating and the food and drinks were top notch! I highly recommend the Louisiana Fried Chicken, it was insanely good. We can't wait to come back

jjg5oT4bynknm9IKRnxvyg.text: PROS: - tasty food which is the most important thing  - lots of options to choose from  - not the most affordable pricing but I'm willing to pay a little more to support a vegan establishment so it's all good   CONS: - lots of options and therefore many things were not available which is annoying cuz then why is it even on the menu?  - the girls that work there (other than the obvious owner and the hostess) made it awkward -it was like being in a high school cafeteria with the posse of girls in the corner talking shit - I shouldn't see you talking about us - that's not professional or cool - plus it doesn't get you a good tip  - dirty dish that had to be sent back for another - absolutely unacceptable!   This one is neither a pro or con but note to the owner - the pictures u take before u bring the food out is what got me to come to your restaurant so keep it up ;)  Little improvements and you're good to go

IKEjlQkxAPmKNY0Qe5JdHA.text: The food is really great. I love the Mac n cheese balls and the chicken and waffles. Ordered from there tons of times, but always get take out! Because unfortunately although the food is good & the decor is nice, the staff service is disappointing at best. They always forget things I've asked for specifically and then make it a hassle to get my compete order. Kind of ruins what could be an awesome experience.

cno3iGORlV6mni72ra0Dlw.text: Simply the best vegan food in Vegas. Huge menu of delicious offerings in a beautiful, modern, clean environment. The service is always friendly and Alex is simply the best; his recommendation of the Impossible burger on Thursday was excellent and his kind manner made for an outstanding experience!

8FfEhYIp4RUoz5DCczudAQ.text: Initial wait for a table wasn't too bad considering we arrived at peak brunch time on Saturday (11:30-12ish). I think we just beat the rush, as we were eating there were mobs of people waiting outside.  5 tables were reserved when we arrived and 4 of them remained reserved during our entire time there (which was about 1.5 hours). Either they reserve them really early or don't cancel reservations when they're too late. Unfortunate, since it looks like they lost business due to wait times being too long.  Food came out pretty fast (like "no way that could have all been made to order that fast" fast). I had the chicken and waffles because they were out of the benedicts. It was huge, and tasty...but really cold. Looks like other people had the same issue with that dish.   Ordered the cheesecake trio to-go. This and the cheque took a long time.   I am sure the kinks will work out and they will get better. Everyone was really nice and kept apologizing for the way things were going in general.

R1AiLQfvDfsMLucVlDi-5w.text: This is a very nice restaurant. It is also nice to see people actually support us vegans who choose not to eat meat. Sometimes when it comes to dining out its very hard to get anything on any other menu but here you won't have a problem!  Don't miss out on dessert!

58gVdnmRIsyIdz-N3FAKBg.text: Let's start with the good: the menu. It is HUGE. HUUUUUGE. There are a ton of awesome items on it. This place was extremely hyped up prior to opening, largely in thanks to the local vegans website, "Vegans, Baby." Now, on to the "meh" / bad. I stayed away for quite a few weeks because of the owner's behavior on social media. I saw multiple instances where she was being incredibly rude to potential customers, including arguing on her business page regarding the "right" way to create a menu item. It really disgusted me and made me not want to become a patron. However, I did come to try it out. Starting with location: it's close to UNLV, which is great for vegan students, but in a very unsavory part of town. The windows are completely blacked out from the outside as well, which makes you wonder if they're even open. After parking and taking our valuables with us (haha) we went inside. The hostess was on her phone, which was a bit of a turnoff - I completely understand boredom at work, but at least fold silverware or something. The interior itself is pretty nice and looks like it'd be cool for brunch/happy hour (if they had that; they're only open until 6pm at present). They have bumping club/rap music which also confused me - if they were open late I'd get it, but during lunchtime it created an odd ambiance.  The waitstaff seemed generally under-trained and very confused when taking orders. One of the food runners had to be asked four times for hot sauce; he continuously brought us ranch and ketchup until we gave up and waited for our waitress to return. I think the waitstaff has potential to be good, they just need A LOT more practice. Two of us ordered a gyro, the other three ordered various salads. The portions here are HUGE and honestly could feed two people per entree. I would highly advise they size down their menu items and decrease price as it's just not realistic. As far as the gyro, it was good, but not great. It was thick, fluffy bread as large as my face - which really made me wonder whether the owners had ever had a real gyro. The massive side of the bread made it really hard to enjoy the interior, which essentially fell everywhere and couldn't be contained by this half of a bread loaf. The salads were all pretty good, no complaints there. Payment also took some time as the waitress seemed confused as to how to use her portable POS machine. Overall I'm glad I went, but I wouldn't go out of my way to go here. I hope that they will begin to offer carry out or Postmates/Uber Eats as I'd prefer that over eating in.

qmi8o_661Ap6spCP_QFAgg.text: Went there last night and ordered the Philly the nachos the Austin salad and popcorn chicken the service wasn't that good the Austin salad never came untill we finished everything else and it took forever to even place a order but for the most part the food was tasty as usual

4wJbf4Sg06e8NtjmuKwxVw.text: If you're looking for truly healthy and well prepared vegan food at a reasonable price this is the place. We went there on Saturday for brunch as we couldn't find anything healthy to eat on the strip. It was a $6 Uber ride and we're so glad we went there even though it's not in the prettiest part of town, but safe especially as there were many young families too.  It's a very simple and clean venue in a small strip mall. The food was fabulous. I enjoy large portions and I was very pleased as I left quite full. They've only been open for about 6 months and you can tell they've come a long way.  Even with the place being packed the service was excellent and friendly. I would highly recommend TMV. I can't wait to go back and try other menu choices.

HUDtav7edAIC5RgAfJVaJw.text: I really wanted to like this place /: first time we went, I loved the food, thought it was a little overpriced but the portions are a good size for the most part, service was okay but didn't matter since the food is tasty. Came back soon after, food was great as well, service a little off and then they add 20% gratuity even when you have to flag your server down and wait for each individual plate to come out but whatever okay. Went the third and maybe the last time and got sat at the bar. This experience was the worst, our server, I think his name is Steffon, was pretty rude right from the beginning, why? I don't know, we're always pretty nice. My bf ordered a burrito with chicken, a few minutes later our server came and told us that "the kitchen messed up the order and put the meat crumbles instead of the chicken if you want to send it back your order will take 15 min" um what? Why didn't you just have them redo it as the customer wanted it, at least be nice about it but my bf accepted since we didn't want to wait 15 min. Food was alright, the breakfast burrito was cold. My bf never complains but today was the first time I heard him say something bad about service and food. When we finished, our server gave us our check very rudely. Good thing my bf paid and left a tip because I wouldn't have. I really hope TMV can better their service. Otherwise people will start to notice and not come. Again, I really wanted to like this place but after this service I don't think we will.

fiS8cMTgXL5m4Vz5j6x6rg.text: The food was absolutely amazing. The service? Horrible and honestly the only reason I will not be returning. Was at the restaurant yesterday(07/13) after friends raving about it, and very disappointed.

YYAoDHrQGD5WHbWOp57ubw.text: Went here on Easter (2018) with husband & and my vegan daughters 13 & 16 years old They Love it to say the least!!! So so grateful to not only have Amazing VEGAN food but to be able to go out to dinner to a Vegan restaurant on Vacation!!!! To the Young couple that opened this restaurant  Good Luck on your delicious Huge menu options!  Ps If you or your children have any allergies has do mine they honor that as well!

bT9vAyX9IHZ5Dt9XpdYt7A.text: I was excited for them to open and they did not disappoint. I had the lobster roll it was delicious as the fry's were to die for. I will be back

4O-_ZHQVTffkZwNWS1CrBw.text: Absolutely in love! The vibe was dope. Decor and music were my jam. Missy our server knew her stuff and took great care of us. I fell in love before our food even hit the table. But once it did, we were flabbergasted! We had nachos with "chicken" for starters. They may have been the best nachos we've ever had, vegan or not! We shared the Louisiana Chicken, Chicken and Waffles and The Queen burger. Even my husband,  the only non vegan, helped eat every last bite. My family and I will be repeat customers for sure!

5851bFOahVRw7J6df6iYvw.text: As a vegan I was so excited when I first heard about TMV and made it a priority to visit during my stay in Vegas. To put it simply, it's a great idea but poorly executed by means of service. It didn't seem very busy and there were a lot of servers but the "hostess with the mostest" was the only one running the show. My water glass sat empty pretty much the whole time I was there and my v'eggs benedict was cold. I probably would not come here again.

sfBRTynjq4uoctZ0ZLn_gw.text: Really great, I loved it! I don't see how there could be any complaints! Had the chicken and waffles and Mac and Cheese balls! The chicken was so crispy and I never thought I would experience that again being a vegan! Thank you!

ROGRrO_aqKy6WsvDYJ0Nsw.text: Well this place was a surprise ! Not sure how I feel about the branding it looks like Mayweather's Money Team and the atmosphere feels like a nightclub which is cool but also can feel a bit sterile but hey also gives it a clean feeling which is rare for this area. Besides all that the staff was helpful and honest about the menu. The menu was a bit overwhelming so many options maybe condensing the menus to separate breakfast lunch and dinner menus would be helpful, awesome that they do have so many options though ! That being said a lot of the items on the menu weren't available like they only serve one soup per day and they didn't have the cheese for Mac n cheese and nachos etc... ok whatever plenty of other options. So we ordered the corn dogs for appetizer surprisingly nom and I had the Snob because I'm a snob for portobello mushrooms and not a fan of beyond meat and soy this soy that wheat this wheat that... it's great there are vegan options but I think it's lazy to use premade products come up with some original plant based meat subs to get 5 stars from me... it's all about the jackfruit and less soy and wheat products because that's the cheap and easy route .... anyway that's just my preference ... the pretzel bun was bomb the snob burger was bomb I loved the cheese on it and prefer it over Skinny Fats port sandwich... my friend ordered the spaghetti which she really enjoyed... over all I like this place and it's good place to take your non vegan friends who are interested in trying meat subs... this place has potential the foods already bomb not healthy but tasty

photos.caption: Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Modern Vegan - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_yAiwWKjRBGRnNSpkS0VDQ.text: My one of many fave vegan restaurants in Vegas! Very brand new and well awaited to try. I didn't want to rush and visit within the first week-month knowing it would be packed. So I visited at just the right time and experienced no wait time and seated immediately. First let me just say, from the jump the ambiance and style of the restaurant alone is very appealing to the eye. Hence the name "Modern" Vegan! Totally suits the restaurant perfectly. My waiter was completely knowledgeable about the menu, made a few suggestions, and explained each dish down to the seasonings! Buffalo cauliflower seems to be my go-to at every vegan restaurant even non-vegan places. So I decided to automatically try their twist on it. As well as the lobster roll and I think my bff ordered fish tacos. Their menu by the way is out of this world! Super diverse with many options to choose from (entrees I didn't even know were possible of being made vegan) thanks to the owner and ceo of the restaurant; most items on the menu are recipes created from scratch by her! On top of everything, I truly give this place a 5 star rating due to their genuine customer service. They really care here. Customer service is everything to me. Wether you work in retail, hospitality, or the food & beverage industry it counts. I seem to have really bad luck with finding a piece of hair whenever I eat out. And unfortunately it did happen to me here. It happens to me so often that I stopped blaming where i ate at but started blaming myself! Lol thank goodness the manager came by and apologized and took really great care of us. She literally remade everything I ordered and gave a complimentary dessert. They went above and beyond! I appreciate her accountability and she's truly the sweetest soul I've ever met. They def have a returning customer right here, always!

juauAANVtE1uNHv7PwU_yw.text: Where else can you go in the middle of the night to get super delicious vegan food?  This place.  I can't remember all I ordered (since I visited about a month ago and forgot to write my review then), but I remember it all being super good and the next time I'm in Vegas I am going back here!

MMzhtEqTAn2gAU8aS-k7WA.text: The modern vegan has such a great atmosphere and feels very homey. The staff is very welcoming from the minute you step foot in the front door until the time you leave. They treat you like you are part of the family and you never feel like just another customer. I always sit at the bar with my friend each time we come in usually at 3am from a good night out and it's the best way to end the night. We are always greeted by the very attractive and friendly bartender/server Scott. Scott always has a smile on his face. He is very attentive to what you need and is always on top of everything!! He is one of the best bartender/servers that I have met in a long time. We need more people like him. The food is amazing as well ! I am always craving those sweet potato fries! The service and staff are amazing! I recommend whoever is reading this to try it out as well vegan or not ! You won't regret it !

nHsD1p_ZjR8FZxREJmAtkg.text: This place was really amazing! The ambiance and atmosphere given by the staff makes you feel welcomed and enjoy the great tasting food and quality of drinks that are made. The bartender that was serving me Scott was super friendly, fast, attractive, skilled, and easy to talk to he made you feel good along with preparing great tasting drinks. I will definitely be returning for the amazing food, drinks, and staff that made my experience here an unforgettable and pleasant one. Thanks you TMV!!

s3K070-d7F08gHI8OwjMKQ.text: One star solely because they are Vegan. If you love salt, this is the place for you. All I could taste was salt. I ordered the Reuben, it tasted like a salt sandwich. My wife had the Fried Chicken.....that was "Fried Salt." Look, I am from North Carolina, I am used to to a heavy dose of salt, but this southern boy had more than my heart could take, (literally) In all seriousness any place that has 4 and 1/2 stars on here should be leaps and bounds better than this place. I have been Vegan for 2 years and this is the worst Vegan restaurant I have ever eaten at. The prices were WAY to high for the amount of food that I received. My wife and I ordered the "cheese" cake trio for $13. I think the cheesecake came from the Kid's Menu, because I truly don't know what my money went to. Also, the cheese cake was supposed to be Strawberry, Blueberry, and Peanut Butter. What the menu neglects to tell you is that it is plain cheesecake with some fake tasting syrup, a dollop of Jiffy peanut butter, one strawberry sliced paper thin, and 3 blueberries. Look that is ok, but not for $13. Overall, I am sad. If a non-vegan ate here I would be afraid they would never go vegan. It does not represent our community well, and that is the worst part. Ownership, if your reading, you've lost a vegan with a large following. Customers, there are plenty of other great vegan restaurants in Vegas, go else where and save your self the drive/uber money. You'll be happy you did. Thanks.

EMEHFZclr9oJLXSgJxSFXw.text: Had such a great experience at The Modern Vegan! Such a good place to take non-vegans! My boyfriend was convinced the chick'n he got was real and wouldn't let me try it! He had to check with the waitress 10/10 would recommend!

ngV0Of2FVttpEjibE6MqAQ.text: The first two times I came here is when they first opened and everything was really great. The service was fast and friendly and the food was good. I recently went back and the vibe is totally different now. The service was really really bad. Like really bad. Just slow and they seemed like they didn't know what was going on with anything. However the food was still really good so that's a plus but I'm not sure what happened to their service
